listing_jobDesc:
Would you like to join our team as a JavaScript Developer, working on our leading cloud-based, business to business SaaS software product?
We have a globally distributed team structure, but with the core software engineering teams being in the UK & Germany.
In total, we are a ~600 staff global Software company with the HQ here in the UK & can offer our staff a genuine, defined career path through the software engineering teams or in to a related area, if you so wish (Some have gone on to Product, or dedicated UX, for example)
We strongly prefer internal promotions & in fact, this role is due to an individual in a team being promoted to "senior".
Salary: £60K - £70K + 10% Bonus + Excellent Benefits (Private Pension, Private Health, etc)
Location: UK wide, work form home office. 1 day per month (all expenses paid) trip to the central London office with your team.
We are looking for a JavaScript developer to join our team to work on sophisticated front-end web applications – our product suite includes a browser-based word processor written in vanilla TypeScript / JavaScript
You will be looking to join our industry leading cloud-native software platform Software Engineering team, working on globally used business software to provide an intuitive, pixel perfect & packed with functionality Software UI.
The front-end is TypeScript/JavaScript. The high degree of complexity (e.g. word processor in a browser) means popular frameworks are not suitable, so the role requires our developers to be comfortable problem solving in vanilla TypeScript/JavaScript.
The back-end is largely Java based. Moves are underway to implement a container-based approach which will allow for more flexible choice of languages in future, including Node JS.
We operate a continuous integration approach with biweekly releases which means code has to be always releasable, so experience with automated pipelines and dark launch patterns would be advantageous.
Above all though, we value teamwork & communication; it shows in the fact our staff turnover is super low for the industry & we have long-lasting team’s who work exceptionally well together!
What we’re looking for:
 Understands principles of good code structure (e.g. OOP) and writes “clean” code Able to identify and fix technical debt Understands and implements an appropriate level of automated testing for your work (Although we have a dedicated QA team of 10+, also) Understands security vulnerabilities typical to your area of work and how to prevent them Understands performance concerns within the product code or development tools and when to appropriately optimise
Must have prior technical experience in:
 JavaScript ES6+ (OO / Vanilla) &/or TypeScript Unit testing
Advantageous technical skills:
 Web security, TypeScript, JavaScript ES2020, Node.js, iQuery, Bootstrap, Lodash, HTML5, CSS3, Git, Continuous Integration, Dark launch patterns.
If the above sound like you & you have 2+ years commercial coding experience (years are not important, but this is a rough guide to the level we are looking at), then please apply & find out more! Principal Duties experience level: Graduate or Junior DeveloperRole: Junior Web DeveloperSalary: £24,000 - £30,000 PA subject to experiencePlease note - no remote working available for this position, in house position only.Job RoleWe have an exciting opportunity here at Waddle Insurance for a Junior Web Developer to join our Development team. You will be reporting to a Senior Developer who you will work closely with on a daily basis, on projects that include the company’s website and CRM system. This is a key role within the company during a period of growth, allowing you access to new and invigorating projects.Web Development StackKnowledge & experience required on the following:HTMLCSSJavaScript + jQueryPHP + LaravelMySQL + EloquentResponsibilitiesGeneral*Work as part of a development team on both front-end and back-end code for the company's CRM and Website.*Be able to develop and troubleshoot programmes and work towards achieving business targets and goals.JavaScript + jQuery*Understand the strengths and weaknesses of JavaScript and keep these in mind when approaching tasks.*Demonstrate a willingness and desire to learn new skills as well as refine current ones.Day-to-day tasks: *Develop and troubleshoot programmes*Test software and eliminate bugs*Work proficiently with all kinds of JavaScript infrastructures*Analyse requirements for software*Create software designs*Implement the software designs using JavaScript*Debugging code*Documentation of codePHP + Laravel*Have a very good fundamental knowledge and be trained in developing and testing various PHP scripts.*Create and maintain databases as well as performing backend and frontend tests to ensure the applications are optimised and performing effectively.Day-to-day tasks: *Write and implement PHP code and use PHP libraries*Troubleshoot and manage pre-existing PHP code*Write, test and maintain source code*Securely interact with databases*Gather requirements to design improvements to take place on the company's web applications hosted on Laravel*Troubleshoot and debug code*Write documentation for various development activities that take place*Refactor and remove redundant convoluted pieces of codeMySql + EloquentCreate SQL databases and ensure applications are interfacing with them correctly.Day-to-day tasks: *Maintain integrity of data*Implement databases designs*Ensure databases are operational for applications and developers*Write SQL statements to retrieve data for applications*Security of data in databasesThe CompanyWaddle Insurance is a fast-growing life and protection insurance company with over twelve years of experience within the industry. Waddle Insurance is a highly respected company within the insurance industry, held in high regard for our unique processes and always putting the client’s needs and requirements at the forefront of our business. Over the last four years Waddle Insurance has expanded to new heights and now has two offices, both in the heart of the Uplands, Swansea, with forty members of staff – and growing.Training and Development is a massive part of our company, and we continuously look to develop our employees in their role and future roles within the company. We have a committed training programme that begins when you first step in the door here at Waddle Insurance and will continue throughout your employment. We utilise a range of in-house and external training programmes that will allow you to gain accredited, professional qualifications as you progress within your career.CultureOur workplace culture is very important to us here at Waddle Insurance. As the company has grown our focus on workplace culture has developed and grown with it. That includes both of our offices being dog friendly! We have a wonderful variety of office dogs who boost office morale and generally make our days better – make sure to check them out on our Instagram page.Over the last few years, we have invested in our employees and have several fully trained Mental Health First Aiders. This dedicated team are on hand to assist all employees whenever they are needed and are a vital part of the Wellbeing team.Here at Waddle Insurance, we are very proud to say that we have an on-site gym with a committed fitness instructor specialising in fitness and nutrition. Our fitness instructor will take the time to meet with all employees, complete a gym induction and create individual fitness and training plans. This way, all employees have a dedicated instructor who is on hand to help them set fitness goals and gain valuable information regarding their nutrition.As part of our focus on Health and Wellbeing within Waddle Insurance, as a company we take pride in making home cooked meals (all prepared in our in-house kitchen), creating new and tasty smoothies, run morning fitness camps on site, as well as weekly running and tennis club after work that is open to everyone.What to Expect from Working with Us*You will join a vibrant team where collaboration is encouraged across all projects and departments.*Opportunity to put your ideas across in a live project from the get go.*One to one mentoring with a Senior Developer whilst learning your new role.*Continuous training throughout your employment so you will be up to date with all new product knowledge.*An exciting career path with the opportunity to progress into more senior roles.*You will be joining a social and active company who places employee mental health and wellbeing at the forefront of their business.Why Work for UsOur workplace culture is very important to us here at Waddle Insurance. As the company has grown our focus on workplace culture has developed and grown with it. There are many benefits to working for us, such as:*Staff away days every quarter - Our away days are highly anticipated throughout the year. We split the company into two teams and appoint two new team captains each time. Our latest events have included paintballing, zorb football, and a Pen Y Fan hike!* Dog friendly offices - We have a wonderful variety of office dogs who boost office morale and generally makes our days better, make sure to check them out on our Instagram page.* On site gym and fitness instructor - Our fitness instructor will take the time to meet with all employees, complete a gym induction and create individual fitness and training plans. This way, all employees have a dedicated instructor who is on hand to help them set fitness goals and gain valuable information regarding their nutrition. We also host a number of fitness activities - including all inclusive morning bootcamp sessions (followed by a healthy breakfast made in our fully equipped kitchen), weekly running, yoga and tennis clubs after work.* Trained Mental Health First Aiders - Our MHFA are always on hand for all of our colleagues as well as actively creating wellness events for the whole company. Our recent events celebrated Men’s Health Week and Stress Awareness Month where we took part in a number of different activities such as meditation sessions, lunchtime picnics, Time to Talk Breakfast meetings, yoga classes and company dog walk in the park.* Regular home cooked meals - Summer BBQs are always on the menu here at Waddle Insurance, as well as making curries from scratch and a spot of baking! We regularly make extra food throughout the month, so there is always a meal in the freezer for your lunch.* Dedicated training and development structure - Here at Waddle Insurance we truly value the importance of developing our staff. All of our training is fully funded by Waddle Insurance that will help you develop your career at Waddle and beyond. It is a blend of internal and external training to include professionally accredited courses such as CIPD, ILM, CeMap, R05 and many more.Benefits*Casual dress*Early finish on Fridays*Work Anniversaries and Birthday celebrations*Company Events*Free Food Days*Dog friendly offices*Gym Membership*Wellness programmes*Company pension*28 days holidays plus three wellness days per year*Christmas office shut downJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £24,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsGym membershipWellness programmesSchedule:Monday to Friday Principal Duties experience level: Graduate or Junior DeveloperRole: Junior Web DeveloperSalary: £24,000 - £30,000 PA subject to experiencePlease note - no remote working available for this position, in house position only.Job RoleWe have an exciting opportunity here at Waddle Insurance for a Junior Web Developer to join our Development team. Senior PHP Developer
UK based - Outside IR35 - Fully Remote
£465/day
Who are we?
We're a software development company building the world's Elastic Workforce, reinventing work and challenging the assumption that a local team = the best team.
We help businesses deliver technical projects better than ever before through our platform and on-demand Elastic Teams.
What's in it for you? Our mission is to create freelance jobs with more benefits than permanent.

Want to know more? read: https://distributed.co/about
About the role:
We're looking for a creative PHP Developer to help us achieve key business technological goals. The perfect candidate for this position is a hands-on professional with experience providing product improvement suggestions and an ability to translate business needs into client-friendly technical solutions.
You will be responsible for developing websites and customised applications and implementing a usability testing process to ensure that it fulfils the requirement of the client.
Your Responsibilities

Develop database objects and data models supporting the applications
Conform to coding standards using industry best practices
Planning and prototyping new applications.
Deciding on the best technologies and languages for the project.
Running performance benchmarking tests.

About You

Experience with PHP coding.
Familiarity with MySQL databases and their declarative query languages
Experience with Continuous integration
Working in AGILE/SCRUM
Git source control experience
Experience with Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket
TDD (Test Driven Development)
Knowledge in systems, data integration, and server administration
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software

About us
Distributed is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. Employees and contractors, as well as prospective employees and contractors, will all be treated equally and fairly. Distributed is committed to ensuring no less favourable treatment is experienced by any current or prospective employee because of any of the protected characteristics under the UK Equality Act 2010 or equivalent local equality legislation.
By submitting your application you give us permission to store and use the information from your CV and your answers to application questions. Senior PHP Developer

Job descriptionCore Creative is a long-established Design Agency based in the heart of Somerset. We have a national client base of B2B clients with a strong demand for digital marketing services. We are a small but dynamic studio that punches well above its weight.Junior Web DeveloperWe are currently expanding our web team and are looking for a Junior Web Developer with a passion for coding. This role will be ideal for either a College or University leaver who has studied the relevant courses and has a real passion for coding and developing. Or for a Junior Developer who has some experience (2 years plus) and wants to push their career further and take the next step up. Either way, you will be obsessed with Web Development and love the challenge of problem-solving and creating.Key Responsibilities: You'll be working alongside a Senior Developer managing your own projects including web updates, site population plus key roles such as email marketing coding. You will be a keen all-rounder and even more keen to make your mark and prove yourself as a web developer superstar.Key responsibilities of Junior Web Developer: Supporting our Lead Developer and working closely with the design team to produce ongoing email marketing campaigns.Carrying out updates to existing sitesThe population of new sitesLearning to efficiently build complete sitesWorking with the team and managing your schedules to help us deliver exceptional websites and projects on timeSkills and experience required: Basic understanding and knowledge of WordPress1 years’+ experience as a Web Developer in a commercial environmentUnderstanding of HTML5An understanding of CSS 3Understanding of responsive web design techniquesExperience using Adobe PhotoshopA keen eye for detail and accuracy/consistency in layout and informationGood communication skills as well as being comfortable dealing with clients on a range of levelsWillingness to learn, open to new ideas and challenging our processes to constantly improveNatural problem solverBeneficial but not essential: Some knowledge of JavaScript / jQueryExperience with third-party APIsSome use of Woo CommerceAbility to identify and fix bugs across browsersJob Type: Full-timeSalary: £20,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsOn-site parkingSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Martock, TA12 6RR: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Experience:Web Development: 1 year (preferred) Job descriptionCore Creative is a long-established Design Agency based in the heart of Somerset. We have a national client base of B2B clients with a strong demand for digital marketing services. We are looking for a Junior Front end developer to help develop and maintain a range of interactive web sites for new and existing clients.Applicants should have experience writing custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Expertise in writing semantic, modular front end code using HTML5, CSS3, and W3C coding practices a must. Understanding of the concepts of progressive enhancement, mobile first (RWD) and future friendly design highly encouraged. Experience with Front end frameworks such as Bootstrap also desirable.You will be working with around 20 others in a long established team. Location
Cardiff, Glasgow, London
About the job
Summary
Use your Tech superpowers to help shape our environment for future generations.

Ofgem is at the heart of UK life. As the regulator for the energy industry, we are tasked with ensuring that there is a safe, sustainable and affordable energy supply for the nation, with the right storage facilities and infrastructure in place to realise this ambition. Now, more than ever, our work is under intense scrutiny. Rising bills are understandably a deep concern for everyone, and as such, it is vital that we have an innovative team in place to help us secure our goals of achieving a Net Zero energy system by 2050.

You will find plenty of opportunity to learn and make best use of new technologies as you deliver digital solutions. With the support from a supportive manager and experienced team will be comfortable working at pace as you provide a technical and application perspective to every challenge, making recommendations on how we could improve. From identifying and fixing bugs to writing code and working with build and release pipelines, you will take technical ownership at every stage of our business application requirements.

This is a great opportunity to further your knowledge in a highly collaborative environment. We’re looking for full-stack capability in technologies including MS .NET (C#), SQL Server Development, and ASP.Net MVC. You must be an accomplished debugger of faults, and have a sound understanding of Object-Oriented Design. Some experience of writing unit and integration tests, continuous integration, build and deployment automation and /or API development would be a definite asset, as would knowledge of SOLID development techniques and design patterns. Strong candidates will also be familiar with one or more of Microservices, .NetCore, Entity Framework and Dependency Injection; and experience of writing SQL for commands and software development would set the best candidates apart.
Candidates must bring excellent work planning, time management, and change management skills, and must be comfortable prioritising (and sometimes reprioritising) their workload. In return you’ll be joining a great team which prides itself on developing and supporting new talent.
We know we achieve our best work when we have a broad cross section of opinions and skills within our team. We therefore welcome candidates from all backgrounds, and especially welcome individuals from underrepresented groups. While this is a full-time role, flexible working patterns and job shares are welcome, so we will see to it that you are able to achieve the work-life balance that is best suited to your lifestyle commitments. We will also provide you with a generous benefits package.
Job description
Ofgem works on behalf of energy consumers to ensure that every household and business in the UK can rely on a safe, affordable and environmentally sustainable energy supply. We are playing a vital part in accelerating the transition to Net Zero and a carbon neutral energy system – a goal that everyone wants to achieve. Whatever your role, you’ll be playing your part in creating new energy solutions that are great for customers, and for the environment.

Our Delivery & Schemes Directorate is our delivery arm, and manages a number of high-profile environmental programmes. It’s a fast-paced and dynamic place to work, and you can expect to be involved in ground-breaking work. Our flexible working career opportunities are incredibly varied, so we are committed to recruiting talented people from a diverse range of professional and personal backgrounds – bringing different perspectives and experiences to our work.

In this varied and absorbing role, you’ll bring your skills to the full range of Ofgem schemes, gaining exposure to brand new technology, as well as valuable experience in de-bugging legacy software – skills which are at a premium. Collaborating with project managers, technical leads and subject matter experts you’ll develop, maintain, and support key applications, including maintaining technical documentation, diagnosing faults and working to clear or refer support tickets. In addition, we’ll expect you to write code that meets standards, take technical ownership of applications and undertake unit and integration tests. You’ll work with the IT Infrastructure team, Service Desk and Application Support and Product Development teams to resolve customer issues.
You will support the Application Support Manager and the wider team, developing and maintaining the delivery of digital solutions and services that support Ofgem in its regulatory duties. Working closely within a formal delivery team providing a technical and application perspective throughout, in an agile manner.
Apply technology to achieve efficient and effective business outcome, with a view to continuous improvement and to maintain effective training to support changing technologies.
Successful candidates will have the role title of Developer within Ofgem.
ResponsibilitiesDiagnosis of faultsMonitor site uptime and site reliabilityStewardship and ownership of work items, work from support tickets and then action or refer to appropriate 3rd line teamsWrite code according to standards, and security review toolsMeet individual and contribute to the Applications Teams SLAsWorking with project managers, technical leads, and subject matter experts to development, maintain, and support of key Ofgem scheme applications.Complete personal training as per learning objectives relating to technical skills with the objective of becoming a full stack developer and undertake greenfield development of Ofgem schemesGain a good understanding of our bespoke web applications to increase knowledge to aid the analysing of issues and understand of requirements
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Changing and Improving
Working Together
Delivering at Pace
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
Please see candidate pack for details.
Benefits
Ofgem can offer you a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes; up to 30 days annual leave. Excellent training and development opportunities. The opportunity to join the Civil Service pension arrangements which include a valuable range of benefits. Flexible working hours and family friendly policies. Restaurant and subsidise gym (London only). Interest free season ticket loan.
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Experience and Technical skills.
When you press the ‘Apply now’ button, you will be asked to complete personal details (not seen by the sift panel), your career history and qualifications.
You will then be asked to provide three answers to technical questions evidencing how you meet the essential and desirable skills and capabilities listed in the role profile. Please ensure you demonstrate clearly, within your answers, how you meet each of the essential and desirable skills and capabilities.
Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
This job is broadly open to the following groups:
UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
The Civil Service also offers a Redeployment Interview Scheme to civil servants who are at risk of redundancy, and who meet the minimum requirements for the advertised vacancy.
Apply and further information
This vacancy is part of the Great Place to Work for Veterans initiative.
The Civil Service welcomes applications from people who have recently left prison or have an unspent conviction. Read more about prison leaver recruitment.
Once this job has closed, the job advert will no longer be available. You may want to save a copy for your records.

Whatever your role, you’ll be playing your part in creating new energy solutions that are great for customers, and for the environment.

Our Delivery & Schemes Directorate is our delivery arm, and manages a number of high-profile environmental programmes. It’s a fast-paced and dynamic place to work, and you can expect to be involved in ground-breaking work. Our flexible working career opportunities are incredibly varied, so we are committed to recruiting talented people from a diverse range of professional and personal backgrounds – bringing different perspectives and experiences to our work.

In this varied and absorbing role, you’ll bring your skills to the full range of Ofgem schemes, gaining exposure to brand new technology, as well as valuable experience in de-bugging legacy software – skills which are at a premium. Collaborating with project managers, technical leads and subject matter experts you’ll develop, maintain, and support key applications, including maintaining technical documentation, diagnosing faults and working to clear or refer support tickets. In addition, we’ll expect you to write code that meets standards, take technical ownership of applications and undertake unit and integration tests. You’ll work with the IT Infrastructure team, Service Desk and Application Support and Product Development teams to resolve customer issues.
You will support the Application Support Manager and the wider team, developing and maintaining the delivery of digital solutions and services that support Ofgem in its regulatory duties. Working closely within a formal delivery team providing a technical and application perspective throughout, in an agile manner.
Apply technology to achieve efficient and effective business outcome, with a view to continuous improvement and to maintain effective training to support changing technologies.
Successful candidates will have the role title of Developer within Ofgem.
ResponsibilitiesDiagnosis of faultsMonitor site uptime and site reliabilityStewardship and ownership of work items, work from support tickets and then action or refer to appropriate 3rd line teamsWrite code according to standards, and security review toolsMeet individual and contribute to the Applications Teams SLAsWorking with project managers, technical leads, and subject matter experts to development, maintain, and support of key Ofgem scheme applications.Complete personal training as per learning objectives relating to technical skills with the objective of becoming a full stack developer and undertake greenfield development of Ofgem schemesGain a good understanding of our bespoke web applications to increase knowledge to aid the analysing of issues and understand of requirements
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Changing and Improving
Working Together
Delivering at Pace
Technical skills
We'll assess you against these technical skills during the selection process:
Please see candidate pack for details.
Benefits
Ofgem can offer you a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes; up to 30 days annual leave. Excellent training and development opportunities. The opportunity to join the Civil Service pension arrangements which include a valuable range of benefits. Flexible working hours and family friendly policies. Restaurant and subsidise gym (London only). Interest free season ticket loan.
Things you need to know
Security
Successful candidates must pass a disclosure and barring security check.
People working with government assets must complete basic personnel security standard checks.
Selection process details
This vacancy is using Success Profiles, and will assess your Behaviours, Experience and Technical skills.
When you press the ‘Apply now’ button, you will be asked to complete personal details (not seen by the sift panel), your career history and qualifications.
You will then be asked to provide three answers to technical questions evidencing how you meet the essential and desirable skills and capabilities listed in the role profile. Please ensure you demonstrate clearly, within your answers, how you meet each of the essential and desirable skills and capabilities.
Feedback will only be provided if you attend an interview or assessment.
Nationality requirements
This job is broadly open to the following groups:
UK nationals
nationals of Commonwealth countries who have the right to work in the UK
nationals of the Republic of Ireland
nationals from the EU, EEA or Switzerland with settled or pre-settled status or who apply for either status by the deadline of the European Union Settlement Scheme (EUSS)
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals working in the Civil Service
relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals who have built up the right to work in the Civil Service
certain family members of the relevant EU, EEA, Swiss or Turkish nationals
Further information on nationality requirements
Working for the Civil Service
The Civil Service Code sets out the standards of behaviour expected of civil servants.

We recruit by merit on the basis of fair and open competition, as outlined in the Civil Service Commission's recruitment principles.
The Civil Service embraces diversity and promotes equal opportunities. As such, we run a Disability Confident Scheme (DCS) for candidates with disabilities who meet the minimum selection criteria.
The Civil Service also offers a Redeployment Interview Scheme to civil servants who are at risk of redundancy, and who meet the minimum requirements for the advertised vacancy.
Apply and further information
This vacancy is part of the Great Place to Work for Veterans initiative.
The Civil Service welcomes applications from people who have recently left prison or have an unspent conviction. Read more about prison leaver recruitment.

Location
Cardiff, Glasgow, London
About the job
Summary
Use your Tech superpowers to help shape our environment for future generations.

Ofgem is at the heart of UK life. As the regulator for the energy industry, we are tasked with ensuring that there is a safe, sustainable and affordable energy supply for the nation, with the right storage facilities and infrastructure in place to realise this ambition. Now, more than ever, our work is under intense scrutiny. Rising bills are understandably a deep concern for everyone, and as such, it is vital that we have an innovative team in place to help us secure our goals of achieving a Net Zero energy system by 2050.

You will find plenty of opportunity to learn and make best use of new technologies as you deliver digital solutions. With the support from a supportive manager and experienced team will be comfortable working at pace as you provide a technical and application perspective to every challenge, making recommendations on how we could improve. From identifying and fixing bugs to writing code and working with build and release pipelines, you will take technical ownership at every stage of our business application requirements.

This is a great opportunity to further your knowledge in a highly collaborative environment. We’re looking for full-stack capability in technologies including MS .NET (C#), SQL Server Development, and ASP.Net MVC. You must be an accomplished debugger of faults, and have a sound understanding of Object-Oriented Design. Some experience of writing unit and integration tests, continuous integration, build and deployment automation and /or API development would be a definite asset, as would knowledge of SOLID development techniques and design patterns. Strong candidates will also be familiar with one or more of Microservices, .NetCore, Entity Framework and Dependency Injection; and experience of writing SQL for commands and software development would set the best candidates apart.
Candidates must bring excellent work planning, time management, and change management skills, and must be comfortable prioritising (and sometimes reprioritising) their workload. In return you’ll be joining a great team which prides itself on developing and supporting new talent.
We know we achieve our best work when we have a broad cross section of opinions and skills within our team. We therefore welcome candidates from all backgrounds, and especially welcome individuals from underrepresented groups. While this is a full-time role, flexible working patterns and job shares are welcome, so we will see to it that you are able to achieve the work-life balance that is best suited to your lifestyle commitments. We will also provide you with a generous benefits package.

Salary: £40,000 to £80,000 (according to experience — see our remuneration policy)Experience: minimum three years in a related roleType: full-time/part-timeLocation: 100% remoteVisa: tier 2 sponsorship availableClosing date: 31 Aug 2022About NewsNowJoin us on our mission to make news serve people better — because a healthy society needs a healthy news diet.NewsNow — now in its 25th year — is a rare UK-based .com success story: a news organisation using technology to support and promote credible, independent and public interest journalism, via the extremely successful news aggregation and discovery platform NewsNow.co.uk.Founded in 1997 to democratise and disrupt the market for news, NewsNow has since become a global top 50 news website with millions of loyal users who discover news from thousands of publishers.NewsNow presents curated and breaking headlines from around the world for people who want to stay abreast of topics they are passionate about, weigh up differing presentations of the facts and viewpoints, and challenge their preconceptions all as they make up their own minds.We believe what we do helps make society better, but huge challenges remain. Now, in this era of fake news and polarisation, and as we proudly enter our 25th year, our social mission to support and promote credible, independent and public interest journalism is more important than ever.About the roleWe are seeking a highly-experienced developer to join our fully-remote multi-disciplinary product development and engineering team:Enhancing the functionality of the website through development of Vue.js components and the associated API backend;Collaborating with other members of our product development and engineering team in our lean and iterative development approach;Reviewing other developers' code.Our priorities for 2022 include:Building out and optimising our entirely new design built in Vue.js, which represents the biggest upgrade to NewsNow's format in its nearly 25-year history;Evolving into a social news site by crowdsourcing feedback and ratings from users to drive quality and user-centric improvements;Implementing various mobile initiatives, such as the development of a progressive web application (PWA) and push notifications to not only make accessing NewsNow easier, but also put us at the forefront of peoples' minds at critical moments;Continuing our social mission to provide a healthy news diet through publishing headlines linking to breaking and curated news from a diverse range of credible, independent and public interest news sources.You and your skillsYou will be able to quickly grasp our existing Vue.js app and server-side systems and be proficient in spoken and written English so that you can contribute authoritatively and collaborate effectively.Required skills:Prowess in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/ES6+ and responsive designVue.js (or solid experience working with React or Angular)In addition, some of these would be nice to have:Flexbox and CSS GridConfiguring and optimising Webpack buildsMeasuring and improving web page performance (Core Web Vitals and PageSpeed Insights)Vue.js SSRHTTP and CORSSEONode.js or other high-level languages such as PHP, Ruby, Python, Go, Java or PerlOO programming principlesMySQL/SQLFamiliarity with the Linux command line, bash and GitDesign skills (we use Figma)You’re also someone who:Is comfortable with fully remote workingIs open to new technologies and concepts, but isn’t a slave to them: you relish crafting elegant solutions to hard technical and business problems, using whatever is the best tool for the jobThrives in a small, open and collaborative team, where the best ideas can come from anyone. You’re confident and articulate about what you know and open about what you don’tIs passionate about any area of news or sport, or creating the best product for people who areAbout our development teamOur highly experienced multi-disciplinary development team runs lean. Our compact set-up lets us keep hierarchy and bureaucracy to a minimum. Which means today, we're still a company where everyone gets to make a massive impact.We’re a developer-driven company. Two of the company’s three directors are developers — and that includes the CEO. This means that development is core to the business, developers are appreciated for their creative input, and the importance of investment in development — and avoiding technical debt — is understood.We use a cutting-edge containerised development model, that makes agile development convenient and cheap, using Dockside, our online IDE. For each new task, Dockside lets us launch a disposable development container — aka a devtainer — which provides a self-contained fully-functioning development environment running a full live NewsNow stack (talking to a disposable live database clone) complete with high-end browser-based VS Code-compatible IDE. This makes forking, staging and code-review a breeze. From conception through roll out, branches and staged developments are continuously available as needed to developers, managers and testers for collaboration, feedback and review.We run Debian Linux, Apache, MySQL with Python 3, Perl 5, and Node on the server-side, with TensorFlow/Keras for ML, and HTML5, CSS3 (SASS/SCSS) and modern JavaScript (OO ES6+ & Vue.js framework) on the client-side.All our software is containerised and deployed using Docker Swarm services on our own co-located raw metal or in Google Cloud.Our cultureOpen: we share and collaborate within and across departmentsRigorous: We like to be clear about what we're doing, and why. Experimentation and peer-review are in our DNAOne team, one vision: no office politicsAn appreciative environment: expect to hear ‘thanks’ a lotRoom to grow: development of skills and responsibilities is encouraged and rewardedVirtual: we are today a fully-remote company with occasional in-person get-togethersFamily-friendly and flexible: we understand sometimes personal needs come firstOur remuneration policyNewsNow is an exceptionally stable business that values long-term relationships with its employees. As an incentive to join NewsNow, we will look to offer candidates their current market rate or above.Furthermore, we run a programme of annual (or even more frequent) appraisals and pay reviews, with the aim of ensuring our employees are motivated, fulfilled, and that their remuneration reflects and recognises their developing expertise (whether transferable skills, or knowledge of our particular stack), their value to NewsNow, and on the wider job market.BenefitsAll our positions are fully remote - work from home 100% of the time. We offer flexible working for all team members (we’re a family-friendly company) with occasional in-person meetups. Furthermore, we provide:UK-resident employees with an annual bonus, private health insurance, a competitive holiday allowance, home office equipment, and more - please ask.Non-UK-resident employees or contractors with benefits according to their location and employee status - please ask.More about NewsNowNewsNow is the UK’s largest independent news aggregation and discovery platform. A one-stop shop for news for 12m unique monthly visitors, NewsNow is a UK top 50 website, and a global top 50 news destination.Running stably and profitably since our start in 1997, since 2009 we've been ad funded — experiencing great commercial success as an industry leader in programmatic advertising technologies — however today we are actively exploring how, together with other news organisations, we can move towards a future where public interest news and journalism is funded sustainably by the people it serves.NewsNow is led by a gender-diverse technically-minded board. Of our three directors, two — including the CEO/Managing Director — are developers, and one is female.The company is proud of its place within the media ecosystem, providing a platform particularly for smaller and independent publications to reach their audience, and helping to grow media plurality. We are a driver of quality in the news media and today set editorial standards for much of the content we link to.NewsNow is also very proud to be the first digital member of the Disaster Emergency Committee’s Rapid Response Network, which helps alert the UK public efficiently to its vital humanitarian emergency fundraising appeals.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 monthsPart-time hours: 40 per weekSalary: £40,000.00-£80,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Yearly bonusBenefits:Company pensionPrivate medical insuranceWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday Salary: £40,000 to £80,000 (according to experience — see our remuneration policy)Experience: minimum three years in a related roleType: full-time/part-timeLocation: 100% remoteVisa: tier 2 sponsorship availableClosing date: 31 Aug 2022About NewsNowJoin us on our mission to make news serve people better — because a healthy society needs a healthy news diet.NewsNow — now in its 25th year — is a rare UK-based .com success story: a news organisation using technology to support and promote credible, independent and public interest journalism, via the extremely successful news aggregation and discovery platform NewsNow.co.uk.Founded in 1997 to democratise and disrupt the market for news, NewsNow has since become a global top 50 news website with millions of loyal users who discover news from thousands of publishers.NewsNow presents curated and breaking headlines from around the world for people who want to stay abreast of topics they are passionate about, weigh up differing presentations of the facts and viewpoints, and challenge their preconceptions all as they make up their own minds.We believe what we do helps make society better, but huge challenges remain. moments;Continuing our social mission to provide a healthy news diet through publishing headlines linking to breaking and curated news from a diverse range of credible, independent and public interest news sources.You and your skillsYou will be able to quickly grasp our existing Vue.js app and server-side systems and be proficient in spoken and written English so that you can contribute authoritatively and collaborate effectively.Required skills:Prowess in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/ES6+ and responsive designVue.js (or solid experience working with React or Angular)In addition, some of these would be nice to have:Flexbox and CSS GridConfiguring and optimising Webpack buildsMeasuring and improving web page performance (Core Web Vitals and PageSpeed Insights)Vue.js SSRHTTP and CORSSEONode.js or other high-level languages such as PHP, Ruby, Python, Go, Java or PerlOO programming principlesMySQL/SQLFamiliarity with the Linux command line, bash and GitDesign skills (we use Figma)You’re also someone who:Is comfortable with fully remote workingIs open to new technologies and concepts, but isn’t a slave to them: you relish crafting elegant solutions to hard technical and business problems, using whatever is the best tool for the jobThrives in a small, open and collaborative team, where the best ideas can come from anyone. You’re confident and articulate about what you know and open about what you don’tIs passionate about any area of news or sport, or creating the best product for people who areAbout our development teamOur highly experienced multi-disciplinary development team runs lean. Our compact set-up lets us keep hierarchy and bureaucracy to a minimum. Which means today, we're still a company where everyone gets to make a massive impact.We’re a developer-driven company. Two of the company’s three directors are developers — and that includes the CEO. This means that development is core to the business, developers are appreciated for their creative input, and the importance of investment in development — and avoiding technical debt — is understood.We use a cutting-edge containerised development model, that makes agile development convenient and cheap, using Dockside, our online IDE. For each new task, Dockside lets us launch a disposable development container — aka a devtainer — which provides a self-contained fully-functioning development environment running a full live NewsNow stack (talking to a disposable live database clone) complete with high-end browser-based VS Code-compatible IDE. This makes forking, staging and code-review a breeze. From conception through roll out, branches and staged developments are continuously available as needed to developers, managers and testers for collaboration, feedback and review.We run Debian Linux, Apache, MySQL with Python 3, Perl 5, and Node on the server-side, with TensorFlow/Keras for ML, and HTML5, CSS3 (SASS/SCSS) and modern JavaScript (OO ES6+ & Vue.js framework) on the client-side.All our software is containerised and deployed using Docker Swarm services on our own co-located raw metal or in Google Cloud.Our cultureOpen: we share and collaborate within and across departmentsRigorous: We like to be clear about what we're doing, and why. Experimentation and peer-review are in our DNAOne team, one vision: no office politicsAn appreciative environment: expect to hear ‘thanks’ a lotRoom to grow: development of skills and responsibilities is encouraged and rewardedVirtual: we are today a fully-remote company with occasional in-person get-togethersFamily-friendly and flexible: we understand sometimes personal needs come firstOur remuneration policyNewsNow is an exceptionally stable business that values long-term relationships with its employees. As an incentive to join NewsNow, we will look to offer candidates their current market rate or above.Furthermore, we run a programme of annual (or even more frequent) appraisals and pay reviews, with the aim of ensuring our employees are motivated, fulfilled, and that their remuneration reflects and recognises their developing expertise (whether transferable skills, or knowledge of our particular stack), their value to NewsNow, and on the wider job market.BenefitsAll our positions are fully remote - work from home 100% of the time. We offer flexible working for all team members (we’re a family-friendly company) with occasional in-person meetups. Furthermore, we provide:UK-resident employees with an annual bonus, private health insurance, a competitive holiday allowance, home office equipment, and more - please ask.Non-UK-resident employees or contractors with benefits according to their location and employee status - please ask.More about NewsNowNewsNow is the UK’s largest independent news aggregation and discovery platform. A one-stop shop for news for 12m unique monthly visitors, NewsNow is a UK top 50 website, and a global top 50 news destination.Running stably and profitably since our start in 1997, since 2009 we've been ad funded — experiencing great commercial success as an industry leader in programmatic advertising technologies — however today we are actively exploring how, together with other news organisations, we can move towards a future where public interest news and journalism is funded sustainably by the people it serves.NewsNow is led by a gender-diverse technically-minded board. Of our three directors, two — including the CEO/Managing Director — are developers, and one is female.The company is proud of its place within the media ecosystem, providing a platform particularly for smaller and independent publications to reach their audience, and helping to grow media plurality. We are a driver of quality in the news media and today set editorial standards for much of the content we link to.NewsNow is also very proud to be the first digital member of the Disaster Emergency Committee’s Rapid Response Network, which helps alert the UK public efficiently to its vital humanitarian emergency fundraising appeals.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contractContract length: 12 monthsPart-time hours: 40 per weekSalary: £40,000.00-£80,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Yearly bonusBenefits:Company pensionPrivate medical insuranceWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday Show more

AYKO is on the lookout for a Junior UI/Web Designer who’s looking to kickstart their career in web design! This role is perfect for a motivated graduate who is ready utilise their knowledge and skills in a thriving eCommerce agency.All of our team receive individually tailored training plans designed to help them progress their career at AYKO and we've designed a programme to support the right person with the knowledge, training and tools to thrive within this role.At AYKO we create and market high-quality eCommerce websites for well-known brands and we’re growing at an impressive pace thanks to our great reputation. We are proud to offer hybrid working, flexibility and continuous development opportunities to help you achieve your career goals. Working alongside our Creative Team, you’ll have the freedom to use your expertise to shape up our strategy as your ambitions and those of our clients demand.A Junior UI/Web Designer will…Create full site designs and take the initiative of the creative directionDesign for a variety of other projects including social media, email, audit documents - for both client and internal marketingBe able to stick to a brief and within any platform constraints, whilst offering innovative tweaks to keep designs modern and uniqueConfidently be able to discuss design decisions/reasonings both internally and to clientsHave the desire to expand their knowledge to other areas of outside of just design, including A/B testing, Pagebuilder, Theme Customisation, Email, WireframingOur ideal candidate will have…Confident experience working in Adobe Creative Suite Software (Photoshop, Illustrator etc)Some understanding of HTML and CSSKnowledge of current and upcoming digital design trends alongside knowledge of best-practice and complianceHave a keen eye for detailStrong organisational skills - someone who can manage their own time independently with support from the rest of the Creative TeamA good standard of English language and grammarOther desirable skills…Experience working in Figma, Sketch or InvisionSome understanding of Google Analytics, Google Optimise and/or Google Tag Manager or A/b testing in generalKnowledge of Shopify and Magento 2 e-commerce platforms, including a working knowledge of the admin/backend areasConfidence in leading the entire creative elements of a project/taskExperience working across multiple projects/clients at onceWe expect to be able to view a portfolio of your work, whether this be a URL link or PDF format, that highlights your skills and high quality level of work.What’s in it for you?!22 Days holiday + Bank Holidays as standardAdditional days holiday for each year in service (this is currently uncapped)Hybrid workingWork Anniversary GiftsBirthday GiftsTeam EventsEmployee Engagement ProgrammeCompany PensionMonthly Team HuddleChristmas GiftsEyecare VouchersAt AYKO we’re currently working with a combination of remote and face-to-face working. We are flexible with our people working from home, or our Leeds city centre HQ, providing candidates are able to travel to Leeds once or twice a week.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £20,000.00-£22,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsSick payWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Leeds, LS1 5EN: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Application question(s):Do you require a sponsorship visa to work in the UK?Language:Fluent English (required)Work authorisation:United Kingdom (required) AYKO is on the lookout for a Junior UI/Web Designer who’s looking to kickstart their career in web design! Junior Web Developer Hello.We are Oasis Studio.Oasis Studio is an award winning, multi-disciplinary visualisation company specialising in serving the built world, education, and experience sectors with immersive media.Services range from conceptual imagery through to marketing level visualisation, which we deliver in various digital formats including VR AR and associated web-based applications.We’re a mixed bunch...Musicians, gamers, runners, movie nerds, gym buffs, skiers, jugglers, & cyclists...We are family people, old people, young people.... but always aiming to be happy people!Our approach is to always employ staff that share our vision of excellence every time and we continually challenge the 'typical' ways of working so that we can deliver the most inclusive client experience.Principal duties and responsibilities: You will be part of a small but expanding Tech Department responsible for creating and launching interactive web-based products. From day one you will be given responsibilities and projects that challenge your skills, and you will be allowed creative freedom to develop these further.On OfferWe have a fantastic opportunity for a Junior Web Developer to grow existing skills as part of an excellent but small team. We are keen for applicants who are enthusiastic, self-motivated, and keen to develop. The successful applicant will hopefully become a key member of staff and grow with the company and the sectors it serves.FlexibleAs an applicant you may not have formal qualifications in all the areas required so we ask for some form of evidence of technical ability, ability to communicate with stakeholders and keeping up to date with wider industry technological developments as this is vitally important to the position.RequiredQualification in web development or similar proven skill setsHTML 5, JavaScript & CSSPHPMySQLFamiliarity with version control systems such as Git and Subversion.Good knowledge of web design with proven examplesGraphics software Photoshop and othersGood graphical interpretation skillsGood communication skillsExcellent written and spoken EnglishEnthusiasmPassion for the web and its delivery of servicesGood team working skillsDesired / Bonus Areas with and understanding / knowledge ofUser interface design skillsMainstream browsers / devicesTemplate based JavaScript frontend such as ReactJS / VueJSDatabase design and working with databasesLaravelStripe / payment gatewaysPersonal qualitiesPassionate about the digital media IndustryHow to tell a storyAttention to detailMotivatedDesire to succeedQualificationsProven qualifications in Web Development with Maths, English and ICT or equivalent evidence.We put employees first so...We want to make sure you look after yourself, so a healthcare cash plan is in place to give you money back on all the basic including the opticians, dentist, physio, health screeningWe all love a holiday, so we make sure you’ve got your holidays with an incremental entitlement starting at 28 days, increasing to 32 days the longer you’re here including, the bank holidays.No-one likes to work on their birthday, so after one years’ service we also make sure you get this day off too so you can go out and celebrate!We’ve also got all the usual bits and pieces including a company pension scheme, company sick pay after 2 years’ service, all other benefits to help ease your responsibilities.If you love social events, we have lots and have a great company social clubSalary is ultimately what you can prove you are worth and following the initial starting salary, it would reviewed after 6 monthsThis bit is IMPORTANT so please read the Application ProcessWork Location You must be UK based and able to work A Web Developer is responsible for the coding, design and layout of a website according to a company’s specifications. As the role takes into consideration user experience and function, a certain level of both graphic design and computer programming is necessary. Once a website has been created, a Web Developer will generally assist with the maintenance and upkeep of the website.Web Developer Duties and Responsibilities:Writing efficient codeCreating websites/a website using standard HTML/CSS practicesWorking closely with web designers and programmers to produce the websiteConstant communication with other colleagues in the business to develop and deploy their content – and ensuring there is a clear establishment of what can be created within what timeframeResearching different software programs, maintaining software documentationImplementing contingency plans in case the website goes downMaintaining and expanding/enhancing the website once builtManaging a team might also be part of the job roleDevelop front-end code for multiple online products using HTML/XHTML/CSS, XML/XSL, Javascript, and other technologiesCreate high-quality web applications from graphic design deliverables and functional specifications based on current Web standardsTest UI code in common browsers before releasing it to QA; troubleshoot and resolve front-end issuesWork with Web producers and implementation teams to meet business priorities and needs of end usersOffer suggestions and solutions to business problems proactivelyAct as a bridge between application developers and Web designers, both internally and externallyQualifications:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent2+ years experience developing rich Web applications requiredMust be an XHTML/CSS and Javascript expert (Jquery preferred)Proficiency in Web development technologies and tools requiredExperience with XML/XSL, .NET, Flash, and JSP strongly preferredGood visual design sense, an understanding of usability principles, and familiarity with database design and backend application-development principles preferredSensitivity to the needs of physician populations and/or familiarity with the publishing industry highly desirableExperience with database systems such as SQL and OracleBasic knowledge of Search Engine OptimisationAbility to multitask with strict time constraints, budgets and business goalsStrong communication skillsManagement experience or examples that show ability to manage a team, should this role involve team managementJob Type: Full-timeSalary: £24,671.57-£29,293.69 per yearAdditional pay:Loyalty bonusPerformance bonusBenefits:FlexitimeWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayWeekend availabilityAbility to commute/relocate:Chelmsford, CM1 1JR: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Application deadline: 19/08/2022Reference ID: Cloud-WEBExpected start date: 22/09/2022 A Web Developer is responsible for the coding, design and layout of a website according to a company’s specifications. listing_jobDesc: SummaryWe are seeking a Front-end Developer with an eye for detail and a passion for crafting responsive web applications using modern standards to join our team here at Historic England. We are looking for a dependable and motivated front-end developer to join our agile scrum team delivering secure, dependable code which does the best possible job, on time and on budget. We love coding, optimising and problem solving and want to work with people who feel the same! In return we offer a dedicated training day every sprint, flexible hybrid working and the chance to shape the website of a major national organisation. If you`d like to help people from all backgrounds across England learn about the rich and diverse history & heritage we have in our country, and how they can get involved, then this could be the role for you.What you will be doingYou will be responsible for implementing all front-end interfaces; from the main design layout, to managing media, applying different types of typography and font families, implementing animations, the flow of different pages, form interfaces, and more. You will ensure the website meets our mobile first, responsive design principles.You will act as connective tissue for designers and back-end developers, helping to avoid breakdowns in moving from design to implementation. Use your understanding of the principles of both design and back-end development to help provide that connection, aiding communication through the design and development process.What we are looking forPrior experience of working in a web development rolePossess a portfolio of demonstrable front-end development, via a GitHub profile for exampleAn expert user of CSS and HTML, Bootstrap in particularAn expert user of JavaScript, in particular ES6Knowledge of pre-processors, development frameworks and accessibility standardsAbility to work well in a teamExperience of working in an Agile environment, preferably Scrum-Please make clear reference to the key essential skills in the advert when you are completing your application and highlight examples of any related knowledge, skills and experienced based on these.We are an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusion. If you have a disability or neurodiversity, we would be happy to discuss reasonable adjustments to the job with you. Having just won the Gold Award from MIND, we also recognise the importance of a healthy work-life balance.Why work for Historic EnglandWe offer a wide benefits package including a competitive pension scheme starting at 26% contributions, a generous 28 days holiday, corporate discounts, free entry into English Heritage sites across the county and development opportunities to ensure you achieve your goals.We are committed to promoting equality of opportunity for everyone. Diversity helps us to perform better and attract more people to support our work. We welcome and encourage job applications from people of all backgrounds.We particularly encourage applications from Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic candidates and candidates with disabilities as they are underrepresented within Historic England at this level.Historic England want all of our candidates to shine in the recruitment process. Please tell us what we can do to make sure you can show us your very best self.Provisional interview date Monday 25th or 26th August 2022 by Microsoft Teams.Job Type: PermanentSalary: £30,983.00-£34,446.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to Friday SummaryWe are seeking a Front-end Developer with an eye for detail and a passion for crafting responsive web applications using modern standards to join our team here at Historic England. Harleys is looking for a web developer to join our expanding digital team, someone who can get stuck into a diverse range of projects and work closely with our in-house team of writers, designers and strategists.An exciting aspect of this role is the variety of projects you could have the opportunity to work on including CMS websites, single-page-applications, HTML5 apps or web-based 3D experiences. We’ll support your skills development by providing you with the latest hardware, software and training. If you have an interest in expanding your skills into other areas such as UX, video, 2D/3D animation or even VR development then this would be welcomed and nurtured as part of your progression.Here at Harleys the pace is fast, the client names are big and every day is different. We believe that collaboration and opinions enrich our work and therefore form the cornerstone of our project process. If this sounds exciting then we’d like to talk to you. It could be that you already have a CV packed with experience or maybe you’re looking for that break-through golden opportunity, either way Harleys is expanding and so we’re on the lookout for talented people to be part of that growth.We believe in a friendly and supportive work culture. We work hard and play hard, and beyond the creative buzz of the office there is a chance to let your hair down at our monthly socials (when we're allowed to again!).Skills we're looking for:· Knowledge and understanding of HTML5, CSS/SASS and JavaScript· Experience using a javasript framework, preferably Vue.js· WordPress - building themes and plugins· Experience in responsive design and mobile web development· Understanding of usability, web accessibility and cross-browser/platform issues· Strong verbal and written communication ability· Able to manage time and multiple projects effectively, both individually and as part of a teamIf you join Harleys, you will receive the following benefits: Competitive salary and holiday packageHybrid working – we work in the office three days a week and at home for twoA fun and stimulating working environment where everyone learns from each otherRegular socialsBig team days outIn-house creative talks, clinics and workshopsFree onsite parkingEmployee retail and entertainment discounts and perksAuto-enrolment pension schemeFree eye testsPlease send your CV to the HR Manager and indicate your salary expectations and current location.Strictly no recruitment agencies.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From £28,000.00 per yearBenefits:Employee discountOn-site parkingWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Clevedon BS21: reliably commute or be willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (required)Application question(s):Have you provided live links to work or personal projects? Founded in 1985, NHBS Ltd (www.nhbs.com) is a world leader in supplying natural history, ecology and conservation books and ecological survey equipment to institutions, retailers, companies, and private customers around the world. In addition to the retail business, NHBS manufactures equipment in an on-site workshop and publishes two magazines.We are looking for a Web Developer / IT Technician to work on-site in our offices in Totnes, Devon. Working as part of our small in-house Tech Team, the appointee will be responsible for supporting the IT needs of the company and the development and maintenance of web and IT projects. Working closely with the IT Administrator and the in-house software development team to create and support the best possible IT solutions and to ensure that the system runs efficiently and grows to meet company requirements. This is a great opportunity for someone new to the sector to develop their skills, be an important part of a great company, and make a difference.Our ideal candidate: -Has at least one year of web development or business IT experience and an interest in developing their skills across both arreasAwareness of web technologies and principlesUnderstands the concept of responsive web designHas excellent problem solving skillsHas the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with non-IT colleagues and customersIs hands-on, and has a get-the-job-done mentalityIs passionate about software developmentHas a willingness and ability to learn new skills on the jobOur offer to you: -This permanent position is available immediately. Salary range starting from £24,000 p.a. (depending on experience), based on a 37.5 hour week Monday - Friday. The position attracts 28 days holiday p.a including bank holidays, birthdays off, up to three paid days of conservation volunteering p.a. and a generous company pension, free parking and refreshments.How to apply: -To be considered for this position, please write a covering letter detailing why you are the right person for the position.Please email your CV and Covering Letter to the IT Manager, Luke Davis (recruitment@nhbs.com) by 20th August.About Us: -We are based in Totnes, South Devon, right next to the river Dart, halfway between Dartmoor and the coast. NHBS is passionate about making a positive environmental impact - our core purpose is to support those who work to understand, protect, and conserve the natural environment. job_title: Senior RPA Developer - UI Path - 100% Remote - Permanent - 60-80K
listing_jobDesc:
One of, if not the, main RPA player in Europe is looking to add to its world class team of RPA Developers. You will be developing some of the very best projects, with an unrivalled selection of organisations. If UIPath is your chosen route then this opportunity will give you exposure to some of the largest and most technically innovative solutions. Strong UI Path skills are key to this role, and whilst not essential, a strong FS background with a particular emphasis on credit and lending would be a bonus.

100% remote work is offered, as is a hybrid, or fully office-based role. The choice is yours.

This is a rapidly expanding business stemming from an ever-growing set of exciting programmes currently being developed. These solutions use the latest technology to resolve some of the most complex requirements for a stimulating group of global customers.

As you would expect with such an organisation a salary of £60-£80K is complimented by an excellent benefits package. One of, if not the, main RPA player in Europe is looking to add to its world class team of RPA Developers. You will be developing some of the very best projects, with an unrivalled selection of organisations. If UIPath is your chosen route then this opportunity will give you exposure to some of the largest and most technically innovative solutions. Strong UI Path skills are key to this role, and whilst not essential, a strong FS background with a particular emphasis on credit and lending would be a bonus.

Frontend Developer
Job details
Posted 25 July 2022
Salary £25000 - £40000 per annum
LocationLeeds
Job type Permanent
DisciplineDevelopment
ReferenceAD-16
Contact NameAna Da Silva
Job description
Are you a Frontend Developer looking for the next exciting challenge within the Media Industry?

Our client is a small software company that builds play-to-air systems for the TV Broadcast & Media Industry. Their software has a real-time element and is built to be distributed, cloud-native and agnostic (we can run in AWS, Azure, Google, etc) They run on Kubernetes, on Docker and we use various open source tools, such as Kibana, Grafana, etc, for monitoring and deployment.

Role - Frontend Developer
Location - Leeds
Salary - Up to £40k plus benefits, including Hybrid/Remote working, Flexi hours + MORE!

About the role -
This is an incredibly exciting opportunity for a talented, Frontend Developer to join their growing development team. You’ll be working on our main web application UI, using the latest Angular framework and interfacing with their REST and Websocket-based APIs. You’ll have the opportunity to help design and develop UI components for new product features, grow with the company, and help shape its software development processes.

Required Experience -

2 years of commercial software development
Required Skills -

Excellent problem solving
Excellent communication
Solid understanding of Web Technologies (HTTP, REST, WebSockets, etc)
Good knowledge of HTML, Javascript & CSS.
Desired Skills -

Angular
Typescript
Node.js and Express
Build tools (webpack, npm, gulp, etc)
Kubernetes & Docker
Git
If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply with your CV. We will be in touch if your skills match the role. Frontend Developer

· Are you an experienced Web Developer looking to work on a wide range of web development projects for the B2B tech sector?My client is an extremely well-established, B2B marketing agency who are very proud of the marketing services they have offered to their clients in the IT sector over the past 20 years. They offer a fantastic, collaborative and encouraging working environment with masses of potential and excellent staff benefits.The Web Developer – Duties: · Wireframe, develop and test new websites.· Provide web support and maintenance servicing across existing clients projects.· Deliver client projects from small WordPress microsites to complex marketing driven portals.· Take and interpret a brief from a client and advise on best practice.· Consider and recommend websites bearing user experience, the marketing angle and desired outputs in mind.· Use innovation to redefine a brief within the constraints of cost and time.· Think creatively to produce new ideas/concepts/solutions that best fit the client’s requirements and present finalised ideas and concepts to clients.· Work with a range of media and software including PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, SSH, Git, Adobe Creative Cloud, a range of CMS platforms, and keep up to date with emerging technologies and techniques.· Develop, document and implement best practice processes; identify and improve developer efficiency and effectiveness in the teamWeb Developer - Essential Requirements: · Proficiency using PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, HTML and CSS, both vanilla and using popular frameworks.· Database creation and management.· Good interpersonal skills. About the RoleWe are currently looking for a Web Developer who will work with Head of Web Development to deliver improvements and new functionality for Queen Mary’s website and related microsites. The role will be responsible for delivering web development work from conception to delivery that meets good practice standards. The role will support the university to achieve student recruitment and marketing goals.Your responsibilities will include front-end development for the Queen Mary website, liaising with internal stakeholders and advising on industry best practice for a variety of student recruitment and research projects. You will have the opportunity to contribute to major projects currently being undertaken by the Queen Mary web team.About YouYou are ready for your next step where you can use your skills and experience for delivering outstanding user experience across all platforms, particularly focusing on mobile. You are looking to be part of a forward-thinking in-house web team bringing best practice and innovation to Queen Mary.BenefitsWe offer competitive salaries, access to a generous pension scheme, 30 days’ leave per annum (pro-rata for part-time/fixed-term), a season ticket loan scheme and access to a comprehensive range of personal and professional development opportunities. In addition, we offer a range of work life balance and family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements, and campus facilities including an on-site nursery at the Mile End campus.The is a hybrid role and the Professional Services office is based in Whitechapel, London. It is full time permanent appointment. The starting salary will be Grade 4, in the range of £34,733 - £40,797 per annum, inclusive of London Allowance.Queen Mary’s commitment to our diverse and inclusive community is embedded in our appointments processes. Reasonable adjustments will be made at each stage of the recruitment process for any candidate with a disability. We are open to considering applications from candidates wishing to work flexibly.To apply for the role, please visit our recruitment platform: https://www.qmul.ac.uk/jobs/vacancies/items/7406.htmlThe closing date for applications is 12 September 2022 with interviews expected to be held shortly thereafter.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £34,733.00-£40,797.00 per yearBenefits:Additional leaveCasual dressWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftWeekends onlyApplication deadline: 12/09/2022 About the RoleWe are currently looking for a Web Developer who will work with Head of Web Development to deliver improvements and new functionality for Queen Mary’s website and related microsites. The role will be responsible for delivering web development work from conception to delivery that meets good practice standards. The role will support the university to achieve student recruitment and marketing goals.Your responsibilities will include front-end development for the Queen Mary website, liaising with internal stakeholders and advising on industry best practice for a variety of student recruitment and research projects.
