Who we are

PwC’s Central Technology team (‘Tech Connect’) is responsible for identifying and deploying innovative machine learning use cases for PwC and its clients. Working across the health, financial services, and professional services industries, we use machine learning and natural language processing to build data-driven solutions which solve important problems.
We’re currently looking for an experienced Frontend Engineer who can lead and coach others to join us across one of our Manchester, Leeds, Birmingham, or London offices.
What we do
Software Engineers in our team work on a range of products, for example:
A risk and regulation application that helps subject matter experts (e.g. Risk, Auditing) to efficiently profile and analyse large amounts of data on an engagement
A natural language processing platform that accelerates and expands our ability to search large document sets for business insights
A real-time health and wellbeing platform to help employees understand and manage their body and mind
The Role
Responsibility for the end-to-end development of high end UIs for our applications
Designing, implementing, and reviewing high quality, maintainable code
Coaching and managing junior engineers on workstreams, including the tools and practices that we use
Working with experienced Engineers, Data Scientists and Product Managers to understand and develop our products
Core Skills
Fluency in implementing responsive, cross-browser UIs using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript/TypeScript
Proficiency with UI frameworks (many of our applications use React.js)
Experience working with JavaScript testing frameworks
Experience with optimising web performance of front end applications
Nice-to-haves
Practical knowledge of server-side JavaScript (for example, Node.js)
Experience with web analytics frameworks (such as getanalytics)
Exposure to other programming languages (for example, we use Python and Go on our backend)
Experience with other UI frameworks (such as Angular.js or Vue.js)
Process
For technical roles, we ask applicants to submit a short test related to the core skills above prior to the first interview and if successful will look to discuss the tests further.
Not the role for you?
Did you know PwC offers flexible career arrangements and contract work? Learn more.

Job Introduction

Corporate Digital & Applications (CDA) is a small team with a big impact. We make an exciting range of apps used by nearly every BBC staff member in their work to deliver content and value to the audience. We look after the BBC intranet, internal web and mobile apps and external corporate sites which receive millions of views from our audience every month.
We have a modern technology stack and use a range of AWS technologies such as Lambda, OpenSearch, S3, and Aurora. We mainly build services using JavaScript, with our front-ends typically being React and our primary API being serverless GraphQL.
As the BBC reaffirms its digital ambition, we have an opportunity for a Junior Software Engineer to join our team and work alongside other developers to improve and develop our suite of products. We are looking for someone who has a good basic understanding of web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript and with a passion to learn and develop their skills. There will be opportunities to gain experience in both front end and back end development.
We will take a genuine interest in your career and help you develop and grow with training, hands-on experience and regular feedback in a friendly and supportive atmosphere. We also want you to take regular personal development time to develop your skills in your own way.
Main Responsibilities
Learn and apply relevant technologies used by the team to make effective contributions to our code base.
Work closely with the product team
Participate in the development of effective software that meets given specifications.
Participate in the team's software development methodologies, such as pairing, code reviews, agile planning and continuous delivery
Write appropriate unit tests to ensure code-quality
Are you the right candidate?

We are keen to hear from you if you have:
A passion for web development and a willingness to learn and develop
Some experience in modern programming languages and/or frameworks
Excellent communications skills and a collaborative attitude
Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Basic knowledge of software code versioning and repositories (such as Git)
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

Band: C
Contract type: Permanent
Location: London
We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more. Job Introduction

We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more. Job Introduction

Corporate Digital & Applications (CDA) is a small team with a big impact. We make an exciting range of apps used by nearly every BBC staff member in their work to deliver content and value to the audience. We look after the BBC intranet, internal web and mobile apps and external corporate sites which receive millions of views from our audience every month.
We have a modern technology stack and use a range of AWS technologies such as Lambda, OpenSearch, S3, and Aurora. We mainly build services using JavaScript, with our front-ends typically being React and our primary API being serverless GraphQL.
As the BBC reaffirms its digital ambition, we have an opportunity for a Junior Software Engineer to join our team and work alongside other developers to improve and develop our suite of products. We are looking for someone who has a good basic understanding of web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript and with a passion to learn and develop their skills. There will be opportunities to gain experience in both front end and back end development.
We will take a genuine interest in your career and help you develop and grow with training, hands-on experience and regular feedback in a friendly and supportive atmosphere. We also want you to take regular personal development time to develop your skills in your own way.
Main Responsibilities
Learn and apply relevant technologies used by the team to make effective contributions to our code base.
Work closely with the product team
Participate in the development of effective software that meets given specifications.
Participate in the team's software development methodologies, such as pairing, code reviews, agile planning and continuous delivery
Write appropriate unit tests to ensure code-quality
Are you the right candidate?

We are keen to hear from you if you have:
A passion for web development and a willingness to learn and develop
Some experience in modern programming languages and/or frameworks
Excellent communications skills and a collaborative attitude
Troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
Basic knowledge of software code versioning and repositories (such as Git)
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here

Full Job Description
Immedia Creative is one of Berkshire’s leading Digital and Creative Agencies, building a reputation for providing high quality solutions over the past 15 years. As part of our on-going expansion, we are looking for a dynamic and experienced individual to join the company as a Web Designer/Developer.

Ideally the role will be based at Head Office in Windsor, Berkshire or at our new satellite office in Wells, Somerset. A flexible working pattern of office based and remote working will also be considered.
This role will suit a hands-on multi-disciplined graphic/web designer/web developer, who has the breadth of knowledge and experience to plan, wireframe, design, layout, and build websites, campaign microsites, and web pages, with a great understanding of UX and the visitor journey. Working with, and reporting to the Creative Director, who will provide brand assets and design concepts, this is a varied and exciting role in a growing agency.

Job Details

Job Title: Web Designer/Developer

Field: Digital Marketing

Location: Windsor or Wells, United Kingdom.

Full-time role: 35 hrs per week.

Salary: £35,000 – £45,000.

Salary is dependant on experience.

The role will involve but is not exclusive to:
Being responsible for the design, layout, and coding of client websites, both new and updates.
Working with our major clients directly to manage their web projects and respond to requests.

Responsibilities include:
Working with the client to understand their requirements and challenges.
Communicating design ideas using site maps, wireframes, and prototypes.
Creating initial design concepts including UX and customer journey flows
Working alongside our Creative Director to produce and deliver design ideas.
Designing and building pages and websites in line with brand guidelines.
Working with our Web Development team to provide high-level custom-built solutions and integrations into 3rd party systems.
UX design, using A/B testing and reporting for continuous improvement of services.
Using in-house and client project management tools such as Osana and Harvest.

Skills and Experience required:
5+ years’ experience in a Web Design/Development role.
Expert knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, CSS, MYSQL, PHP, Python, and WordPress/WooCommerce.
Proven experience as a Web Designer/Developer with strong UI/UX skills for a range of devices.
Create code that works consistently across different browsers and platforms.
Solid experience in creating wireframes, sitemaps, and functional prototypes.
Up to date with the latest Web trends, techniques and technologies.
Good understanding of Content Management Systems.
Up-to-date experience with international web protocols, standards, and technologies.
Strong grasp of SEO principles.
A Knowledge of Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and Indesign.

Personal Attributes:
Must take a proactive role in mastering any new skills required to complete the job.
The candidate must be organised, self-motivated, have good attention to detail, a flexible attitude and a strong work ethic.
Excellent literacy and strong communication skills. Full Job Description

Responsibilities

Web Developer

Each year, millions enjoy Tate’s digital products and content.

We’re seeking talented developers who will help us continue improving our website, deliver digital experiences in our galleries, grow sales through our e-commerce platform, and reinforce Tate’s standing as a leading digital presence within the cultural sector. Reporting to our Senior Web Developer, you will develop applications and features for the Tate website and other visitor-facing projects, from technical design through to production deployment.

With the support of a multi-disciplinary Product and Development team, you will focus on meeting user needs, ensuring that our digital products are effective, reliable, accessible and pleasing to use. The team takes a collaborative approach to projects, with lively discussion and fresh thinking very much at the heart of how we do things.

The last year has underlined the critical importance of Tate’s website: a constant point of access to the museum’s collection and programme, even when our galleries had to close their doors. We have an ambitious road map ahead for delivering an enhanced user experience, better tools for site editors and more tailored content to our audiences, while acting to reduce the climate impact of Tate’s digital presence.

Are you a developer comfortable supporting high-traffic websites and passionate about delivering great experiences to a diverse global audience? If so, we would love to hear from you.

Prior art knowledge is not a requirement. We welcome applications from those who have taken unconventional career routes into tech. Though based at Tate Britain, the Digital team has embraced remote working and would consider applications from outside the London area.

The team takes a collaborative approach to projects, with lively discussion and fresh thinking very much at the heart of how we do things.

The last year has underlined the critical importance of Tate’s website: a constant point of access to the museum’s collection and programme, even when our galleries had to close their doors. We have an ambitious road map ahead for delivering an enhanced user experience, better tools for site editors and more tailored content to our audiences, while acting to reduce the climate impact of Tate’s digital presence.

Are you a developer comfortable supporting high-traffic websites and passionate about delivering great experiences to a diverse global audience? If so, we would love to hear from you.

Prior art knowledge is not a requirement. We welcome applications from those who have taken unconventional career routes into tech. Though based at Tate Britain, the Digital team has embraced remote working and would consider applications from outside the London area.
 Web Developer

Each year, millions enjoy Tate’s digital products and content.

We’re seeking talented developers who will help us continue improving our website, deliver digital experiences in our galleries, grow sales through our e-commerce platform, and reinforce Tate’s standing as a leading digital presence within the cultural sector. £30K - £35K plus benefits (remote work, profit share scheme, private health care, personal development plan)
Three reasons why this is the role for you…
A profit share scheme and private health care shows the values of this employee-centric company.
Working with some of the world's biggest brands including; Microsoft, Xbox, Minecraftand the Premier League.
Flexible hybrid work means you only have to head into the office to see your amazingly welcoming colleagues 3 times a week in central Leeds, saving plenty of £ on that petrol that has shot up in price!
The Company
A unique Digital Agency full of web and mobile marketing specialists. A culture first approach is essential in this companies growth and direction. They have been working with Microsoft for years and have recently secured several new contracts with them, meaning that they need more hands on deck. You'll be joining a lively and collaborative Front End team of 5 who love a beer after work to discuss all things design and creative.
The Role
You will be responsible for front end development using modern development tools and frameworks including:
HTML & CSS / Sass
JavaScript - including ES6
js
Tailwind
Webpack
Web services and API integrations
You'll be writing clean code while following best practice and modular building techniques, working in cross-functional project teams to provide timely solutions to challenges and working closely with the design team to problem solve and create lean and modular interfaces. It's also important that you are able to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical people. £30K - £35K plus benefits (remote work, profit share scheme, private health care, personal development plan)

job_title: Frontend Developer - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery
listing_jobDesc:
Frontend Developer - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery

Please note that this role is not open to candidates requiring work permit sponsorship.

My client is a growing and well-established eCommerce company with major international growth plans. They have recently won a number of accolades and recognition for their use of technology & innovative approach and have been included in the recent Sunday Times Tech Track 100.

The role:

Working closely alongside a team of Back End developers (both PHP and Python/Django stacks) they are looking for an ambitious and inquisitive Frontend Developer to join their team and take responsibility for all things Front End within the team. You will have a strong eye for look and feel and will be able to grasp any issues the Back End developers may be facing. Therefore some sort of Back End knowledge would be helpful. Ideally, this will take the form of some commercial PHP/Python/Ruby on Rails, however, private or university based experience would also acceptable as long as you can talk with confidence around the principles of OOP.

Essential Skills:

An eye for detail when converting designs into usable, highly performant and resilient Front End code.
Deep knowledge of the latest tools and techniques in the world of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, SASS, LESS etc.
The maturity to take ownership of Front End projects and a drive to support a team of Back End developers.
Strong grasp of Agile, Kanban, SCRUM, CI/CD, TDD/BDD etc.

Desirable Skills:

Knowledge of working on AWS based platforms.
Exposure to ReactJS. Frontend Developer - HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery

Please note that this role is not open to candidates requiring work permit sponsorship.

job_title: Senior Web Developer - Manchester Based Remote Working
listing_jobDesc:
We are looking to hire a UI focused web developer to join Citi’s FX STIRT development team. This role is a UK based remote working role
Our team is driven by passion for technology and developing its people. You will work with development teams with a lot of room to learn and grow; we are committed to offering as many opportunities as we can to our team members to help them develop both their technical and leadership qualities. You will take on a hands-on role in developing the future state of our platforms while contributing to our development, testing and deployment best practices.
No previous FX or finance knowledge is required as we will work together to teach you everything you will need on that front.
The Development role is an intermediate level position responsible for participation in the establishment and implementation of new or revised application systems and programs in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to applications systems analysis and programming activities
Key Responsibilities:
Build and maintain our state-of-the-art platforms ensuring timely delivery of work items in an agile environment.
Develop and safeguard our code quality and testing standards.
Work closely with our colleagues to understand requirements and ensure the end product matches expectations.
Evaluate and perform POCs on new strategic technical products and applications.
Serve as advisor or coach to new or lower-level analysts
Build and enhance advanced web applications and services for our clients
Work closely with product owners to develop client solutions for new and existing channels
Grow our catalogue of common assets, such as code templates, libraries, utilities, services, etc.
Skills & Qualifications:
Experience building web UIs.
Good knowledge of UI/UX design and implementation in React, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML5 and Angular8+.
Proficient in standard SDLC tools such as git, bitbucket, Jira, Openshift etc
Very high development standards, especially for code quality, code reviews, unit testing, continuous integration and deployment.
An appetite for taking on challenges and leveraging new technologies.
You are an adaptable, resourceful, well organised team player with a strong work ethic
-

Technology
-
Job Family:
Applications Development
-
Time Type:
Full time
-

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

We are a fast growing, reputable and innovative company with a successful hybrid working style in this digital age. Hood Group is a dynamic, forward thinking customer management business that provides outsourced customer services for well-known UK trusted brands.Following on from some fantastic new client wins, we have an incredibly exciting opportunity within our marketing team for a Junior Web Designer. You’ll get stuck into working on some exciting projects for an enviable list of big-name brands including RAC, Sainsbury’s Bank and Virgin Money.As a Junior Web Designer, you will report into the Senior Marketing Manager and join the wider marketing team. We work as an extension of our brand partners’ Marketing teams to deliver fully branded marketing and seamless customer journeys. The team works together to create market-leading customer journeys to drive conversion and increase customer satisfaction. The role will work closely with our Lead UX Designer to design a range of digital solutions, including wireframes, websites, email campaigns and web-based documents.What will I do in the role?Create Calling all Wordpress Web developers!Are you a Wordpress Web Developer experienced in bespoke, responsive and search engine friendly websites in an agency environment?Join the team at Unity!We’re a multi-award-winning digital agency that creates innovative, functional and market-leading digital platforms that form a critical part of our client's marketing strategies and we’re looking for a confident, creative, and experienced Web Developer to join our team and be part of our continued growth strategy.In a nutshell, you will be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of our client's websites from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and function.We have on offer a creative, person-centered work environment with a team that truly thrives and clients who genuinely value our work and want to engage with you to embrace consultative business development - all in an exciting industry that has a reputation for continued growth.As a Web Developer at Unity, you’ll have the opportunity to: Independently control and create awesome marketing strategies through stunning front end development coupled with functional back-end systems.Involve yourself in the team strategy development of digital marketing campaigns in line with our SEO, PPC, and Social Media team.Working alongside our in-house design team to execute the development of web platforms.Deliver project roadmaps integrating with the client's wider marketing strategy.Have the opportunity to lead innovation on new ideas, techniques and methodology.Support our agency partners for ‘white label’ projects.We’re looking for an experienced Web Developer that’s: Experienced in developing bespoke, responsive and search engine friendly websites in an agency environment.Experienced in design and development within platforms such as WordPress (Shopify and Magento preferably but not essential).Demonstrate strong skills in HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, MySQL and other web technologies.Digital design experience is preferable but not essential.ability to work on multiple projects and demonstrate good critical thinking abilities.An understanding of branding, marketing, UX and CRO.Portfolio of brochure websites with experience in more technical development projects.Working knowledge of server-side hosting and email management.Our people are our service, so we like to reward our team as much as possible! Front End Developer
Knutsford
As a Barclays Front End Developer, you will be supporting web applications that utilise the latest technologies across the stack. This is a very important position in the team which requires a talented developer with a good understanding of programming, excellent front end development skills, aesthetic sensitivity, and lots of tech savvy. You will also be used to following Agile methods and be motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

We are currently operating in a hybrid working environment, meaning that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
• Taking ownership of an internal application within the bank
Influencing solutions for new features in the applicationBreaking new features/work into stories and tasksOffering help & guidance to peers whenever requiredReviewing code and approve/merge PR requestsDeploying any new features or updates to testing environmentsAiming to deliver any new feature work within the agreed timescales

What we’re looking for:
• Good skills in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Next, Node JS, GIT, SCSS, HTML, Webpack, Babel, Jest, React Testing Library
Proven application development experience designing scalable front-end web applicationsCommitment to code quality with experience of unit, integration and automation testing techniques and performance optimizationAdvocate for clean, well-written, accessible code

Skills that will help you in the role:
• BSc degree in relevant software engineering discipline – or equivalent work experience
Experience working in a large organisation / financial services environment

Where will you be working?
The Barclays Technology Campus, just outside Manchester, is our transatlantic tech command centre for information security in the UK. It’s the vital strategic powerhouse behind our global operations. Radbroke is a place where big ideas become realities. Where the talent in the world can build careers full of scope, variety and reward, by creating the technical solutions that meet today’s demands, answer tomorrow’s questions and redefine the future of finance. If you’re a front-end developer looking to take the next step and join a busy digital marketing agency then we’d love to hear from you!

We’re looking for the right person to expand our front-end development team. As a FeD with at least 12 months experience already under your belt, you’ll be able to demonstrate your work with a strong portfolio of coded sites.
As a Front-end Developer at Adtrak, you’ll use your skills to build amazing sites that really perform for our clients, based on a user-focused and beautiful design from our internal UX designers. You’ll primarily work from home but enjoy our hybrid approach to work where you’ll join your team once a week in our Nottingham City Centre office.
Here’s what you’ll do:
You’ll code Wordpress themes from scratch based on a UX-focused Figma design. We don’t use page builders such as Divi, so if that’s your only experience this might not be for you.
You’ll use your skills in HTML, PHP, JS, TailwindCSS and Twig & Timber to build sites to specification and to deadline.
You’ll also flex your skills on content marketing projects, adding additional value and functionality to our existing portfolio of client sites.
You’ll be dealing with support tickets from clients.
Here’s what we’re looking for:
You’ll have great communication skills because you’ll be talking to clients and our internal account managers.
You’ll be an empathetic person who enjoys working with a large multi-disciplinary team.
You’ll be able to focus on your projects when required, but able to work on multiple project concurrently.
You’ll be adept at keeping our internal systems updated in a timely manner.
You’ll have 12 months industry or agency experience.
You’ll be a problem-solver, able to work through issues to find solutions autonomously, but know when to ask for help when required.
You’ll take feedback from managers and colleagues gracefully and in the spirit of improvement that it's intended.
Here’s what will REALLY make you stand out:
Experience in WooCommerce, and / or Shopify Liquid theming.
Experience in ReactJS or NextJS.
Experience in Gatsby or similar static site generators.
Here’s what we’ll give you:
A supportive learning environment with monthly 1:1 and annual appraisal.
A salary of £24,000.00 - £35,000.00.
Great offices in Nottingham City Centre for your hybrid ‘team day’, with a great work area and social space.
Flexible working hours.
Company pension scheme.
Community server space for hosting your own sites.
A generous freelance policy.
Health top-up scheme for dental, optical and more.
Rewards scheme for discounts of high-street and online stores.
Kudos employee recognition scheme.
Ongoing social events.
If you think this all sounds great, then please apply with your CV and covering letter telling us more about yourself. We don’t just look for skills, so your personality and willingness to join and be part of the team is really important to us.
No agencies, please. If you’re a front-end developer looking to take the next step and join a busy digital marketing agency then we’d love to hear from you!

We’re looking for the right person to expand our front-end development team. As a FeD with at least 12 months experience already under your belt, you’ll be able to demonstrate your work with a strong portfolio of coded sites.
As a Front-end Developer at Adtrak, you’ll use your skills to build amazing sites that really perform for our clients, based on a user-focused and beautiful design from our internal UX designers. You’ll primarily work from home but enjoy our hybrid approach to work where you’ll join your team once a week in our Nottingham City Centre office.
Here’s what you’ll do:
You’ll code Wordpress themes from scratch based on a UX-focused Figma design. We don’t use page builders such as Divi, so if that’s your only experience this might not be for you.
You’ll use your skills in HTML, PHP, JS, TailwindCSS and Twig & Timber to build sites to specification and to deadline.
You’ll also flex your skills on content marketing projects, adding additional value and functionality to our existing portfolio of client sites.
You’ll be dealing with support tickets from clients.
Here’s what we’re looking for:
You’ll have great communication skills because you’ll be talking to clients and our internal account managers.
You’ll be an empathetic person who enjoys working with a large multi-disciplinary team.
You’ll be able to focus on your projects when required, but able to work on multiple project concurrently.
You’ll be adept at keeping our internal systems updated in a timely manner.
You’ll have 12 months industry or agency experience.
You’ll be a problem-solver, able to work through issues to find solutions autonomously, but know when to ask for help when required.
You’ll take feedback from managers and colleagues gracefully and in the spirit of improvement that it's intended.
Here’s what will REALLY make you stand out:
Experience in WooCommerce, and / or Shopify Liquid theming.
Experience in ReactJS or NextJS.
Experience in Gatsby or similar static site generators.
Here’s what we’ll give you:
A supportive learning environment with monthly 1:1 and annual appraisal.
A salary of £24,000.00 - £35,000.00.
Great offices in Nottingham City Centre for your hybrid ‘team day’, with a great work area and social space.
Flexible working hours.
Company pension scheme.
Community server space for hosting your own sites.
A generous freelance policy.
Health top-up scheme for dental, optical and more.
Rewards scheme for discounts of high-street and online stores.
Kudos employee recognition scheme.
Ongoing social events.
If you think this all sounds great, then please apply with your CV and covering letter telling us more about yourself. We don’t just look for skills, so your personality and willingness to join and be part of the team is really important to us.
No agencies, please.  If you’re a front-end developer looking to take the next step and join a busy digital marketing agency then we’d love to hear from you!

job_title: Junior / Graduate Front End Web Developer
listing_jobDesc: We’re seeking an attentive front end super hero to join our dev team. Yay.com enables the web for small businesses through a suite of cloud based SaaS products.If you dream in HTML, CSS & Javascript, you’ll be the perfect fit for us. Working alongside a talented design team, rock solid backend dev guys and a DevOps team/environment to dream of, we always run before we can walk.We are keen to hear from Computing, Physics or Maths faculty grads, but we'll be sure to measure you on the skills you've acquired and would love to hear from all applicants! We aren't interested in candidates with text book knowledge only, we want to hear from those with oodles of passion, a curious personality and an ability to show off your your hobby code to date; telling us what it means to you.We don’t like “experienced in” lists but below is how we currently like to work. We hope you’ll be familiar with the basics, but very much welcome the innovation, ideas and change we hope you can bring to our business:Our "Experienced in" list..We use HTML/CSS together with their version 5 and 3 cousins for the basics.Who doesn't use JavaScript and cool frameworks like ReactJS, Typescript & NextJS nowadays? We do, so hope you’ll bring some science to the role here.CSS Preprocessors like SASS have become a staple part of how we like to work.Responsive device design is important to us and we work with 5 separate break points right now; constantly “debating” between us on whether we need more or less.We integrate with a variety of partner API’s/Web Services. We have a wealth of experience within the team to do that and work together delivering and managing those integrations often using REST knowledge.SEO and SEM is a vital prerequisite for any front end code nowadays. We have a team focused on that, but we try to get the basics right up front for them.We work in a scrum agile framework with short sprints. Lots of tools help us manage and keep track along the way.Source control for us all centers around GIT and we run an automated docker containerised deploy environment. We seamlessly roll out at any time of night or day with zero downtime precision to our fault tolerant and load balanced platform.We’ve grown fast from a standing start to an exciting loved business in just a few years. As part of an entrepreneurial team, in a fast-paced environment, we’ll make sure you're looked after with private health cover, a pension and the latest Macbook Pro and tech.Whats next..Please call Matt on 01483 399399 to discuss the role or apply here. No recruitment agencies please!Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany eventsCycle to work schemeDiscounted or free foodFlexitimeOn-site parkingPrivate medical insuranceSick payWellness programmesSchedule:Monday to Friday We’re seeking an attentive front end super hero to join our dev team. We aren't interested in candidates with text book knowledge only, we want to hear from those with oodles of passion, a curious personality and an ability to show off your your hobby code to date; telling us what it means to you.We don’t like “experienced in” lists but below is how we currently like to work. We hope you’ll be familiar with the basics, but very much welcome the innovation, ideas and change we hope you can bring to our business:Our "Experienced in" list..We use HTML/CSS together with their version 5 and 3 cousins for the basics.Who doesn't use JavaScript and cool frameworks like ReactJS, Typescript & NextJS nowadays? We do, so hope you’ll bring some science to the role here.CSS Preprocessors like SASS have become a staple part of how we like to work.Responsive device design is important to us and we work with 5 separate break points right now; constantly “debating” between us on whether we need more or less.We integrate with a variety of partner API’s/Web Services. We have a wealth of experience within the team to do that and work together delivering and managing those integrations often using REST knowledge.SEO and SEM is a vital prerequisite for any front end code nowadays. We have a team focused on that, but we try to get the basics right up front for them.We work in a scrum agile framework with short sprints. Lots of tools help us manage and keep track along the way.Source control for us all centers around GIT and we run an automated docker containerised deploy environment. We seamlessly roll out at any time of night or day with zero downtime precision to our fault tolerant and load balanced platform.We’ve grown fast from a standing start to an exciting loved business in just a few years. As part of an entrepreneurial team, in a fast-paced environment, we’ll make sure you're looked after with private health cover, a pension and the latest Macbook Pro and tech.Whats next..Please call Matt on 01483 399399 to discuss the role or apply here. PHP- CodeIgniter Developer
Job details
Posted 15 August 2022
Salary £40000 - £45000 per annum
LocationBirmingham
Job type Permanent
DisciplineDevelopment
ReferenceSM-13
Contact NameStuart Manser
Job description
We are looking for an experienced PHP Developer to join our team and help us to continue building great software for our client network. This development revolves around our 2 core products which we build and maintain for companies daily to suit their varying needs.

Location: Birmingham/UK-based remote working
Salary: £40-£45k
About the role

Planning new features and bringing these ideas to life in a way that really helps our clients. The software you develop will make a real difference as you will see from the feedback received when your work is released.
Adding new features and developing the products. As part of a small development team you will be making changes to software that is used daily by people around the UK and increasingly across the world
Skills/Experience:

Strong knowledge of PHP and CodeIgniter framework.
Excellent testing methodology (ideally Unit testing)
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript & MySQL
If you are interested please apply right away, interviews are taking place immediately! PHP- CodeIgniter Developer
Job details
Posted 15 August 2022
Salary £40000 - £45000 per annum
LocationBirmingham
Job type Permanent
DisciplineDevelopment
ReferenceSM-13
Contact NameStuart Manser
Job description
We are looking for an experienced PHP Developer to join our team and help us to continue building great software for our client network. This development revolves around our 2 core products which we build and maintain for companies daily to suit their varying needs.

Location: Birmingham/UK-based remote working
Salary: £40-£45k
About the role

Planning new features and bringing these ideas to life in a way that really helps our clients. The software you develop will make a real difference as you will see from the feedback received when your work is released.
Adding new features and developing the products. As part of a small development team you will be making changes to software that is used daily by people around the UK and increasingly across the world
Skills/Experience:

Strong knowledge of PHP and CodeIgniter framework.
Excellent testing methodology (ideally Unit testing)
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript & MySQL
If you are interested please apply right away, interviews are taking place immediately! PHP- CodeIgniter Developer

With great web design comes great responsibility…Calling all mild mannered web developers with an eye for design. Are you looking for the opportunity to become a fully fledged web design hero without the hassle of exposure to all that toxic waste?Planit Scotland is shining the Bat Signal for a heroic web developer and designer to join our growing team of marketing and digital superheroes.Do you have what it takes to defeat the forces of evil and save our clients from the clutches of terrible design? Do you care about more than just throwing together a quick Wordpress site – and instead obsess over the SEO, UX, design and usability?Then we want to hear from you!We’re looking for a web design superhero to fly in and…Report to the managing director on a day-to-day basis while working for a number of clients across a variety of industries.Build and update websites for clients across multiple CMS platforms.Work seamlessly with our copywriting, SEO, content marketing, online advertising and graphic design teams to ensure a joined-up approach for all clients.Have a keen attention to detail and take pride in their work.Be a proactive problem solver.Work closely with our junior graphic designer on general design projects and answer any design queries.The Superman to our Lois Lane will…Be a master of Wordpress, with knowledge of common content builders including Elementor, WP Bakery and Divi – as well as having in depth knowledge of plugins.Have knowledge of Woocommerce and Shopify, and be comfortable with both platforms.Be a pro at web content management, web databases, MYSQL and servers – and be able to build a website from scratch.Be at home working in HTML and CSS.Have an understanding of technical and on-page SEO – including keywords, redirects, robot.txt, rich snippets, Google Schema, etc.Have an understanding of UX and UI.Have experience of design software (e.g. Photoshop, InDesign) and knowledge of design principles.We’ll pack away the kryptonite if you also…Know your way around Umbraco web design.Know what’s what with Google Tag Manager and Facebook Conversion API.Have an understanding of Javascript.Is it a bird? Is it a plane?No, it’s your new career with Planit Scotland!If you have strong interpersonal skills, are polite and approachable, have excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) and a great sense of humour – we would LOVE to hear from you. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about developing their skills and who doesn’t shy away from new challenges.Our clients come to us because they see us as an extension of their team. When they want things done (and done properly) they #JustAskPlanit. It’s very important to us that if you join the Planit family, you are ready to hit the ground running and make a memorable first impression for your clients every time.So what’s in it for you?Comfort of remote working (a flexible approach as long as the work gets done).Shiny new MacBook – we believe in embracing technology.28 days holiday per annum – including public holidays .Getting to work with the best team – we’ll work closely with you to ensure you have all the content you need to make websites and design stand out.The opportunity to work with an interesting, diverse and – let’s face it – the BEST bunch of clients.We also close over the festive period which means a well-deserved break with the family!Access to the Adobe Creative Cloud and anything else you need to ensure you can do your role the best way possible.If you’re ready to start the next chapter in your career and are passionate about making a difference in the workplace, we would love to hear from you!Salary dependant on experience (£24-28K pro rata)(Scotland-based for when we have our superhero team-ups)(Willing to accept Part-Time for the right candidate)To apply, have another read over the job description and check we tick all your boxes. Hours:  Full Time Permanent, Business Hours Mon-Fri 08:30 - 17:30We purposely write this job advert in our language, which is straight forward, honest and to the point. It's who we are and how we communicate with every client we work with.We are a Payroll business (good with numbers but not so good in understanding website and web applications), so please bear with us in our description of what we require for this role.So we need ideally a full time (part time could be a possibility) in house web developer to not only maintain and develop our website but also help with our own custom built web applications and web forms.What we call our ‘Web based visibility area’ is a web based area we have had built from the ground up, it’s a system that links into Monday.com and allows our clients (our clients are Accountants) to log into a secure area, and track the progress of where we are with each of their clients payroll cycle - we have also delivered within the system a reports areas where clients can view PDF reports that have been saved down on our internal server.We also have web forms that have been designed, for example forms for capturing new starter details ready for us to process within the payroll.Both our website and the web based portal are built in wordpress.In the background we also use the sendgrid platform to link into Monday and send out automated emails.Feel free to head over to our website, on there you will see whats been designed, along with some of the functionality that we have built on there.In a nutshell what we are looking for in this role is a web designer that when we say can we build that on our website or can we build this or that web based area or form - the answer 9 out of 10 times is ‘yep, i can build that…’ They will also be there to support and improve on our existing systems and forms as and when required.Please only apply if you have experience, proper experience… meaning building websites, your have built web based capture forms, interactive calculators - that type of experience.What Next? Sounds interesting? Then why not head over to our website, find out what we’re all about and see if we are the type of company you could see yourself working at before submitting your CV.If it does, then what are you waiting for…. We are a SaaS company with over 5,000 registered users and managing over 1M servers in total.We are looking to hire someone to work for 20 hours/week (Negotiable) on our website: createproxy.comThe working hours are completely flexible (You decide your schedule) and all work is remote (No commute will ever be required)Required Skills: PHP, HTML/CSS, SQL, JavaScriptPreferred Skills: Linux System AdminThis will be a long term relationship, so we would prefer someone who has a high attention to detail and really cares about the final product and its value to potential customers.Immediate term tasks would include optimizing website load times, fixing bugs/errors and implementing new payment gateways and plans. Some front-end development will also be required, changing website layouts to be more user friendly, adding additional guides and making pricing clearer for new users.The most important skill here will be to be able to identify problems yourself to resolve. This will require being able to think from the customers perspective. So prior knowledge of the proxy industry is preferred.This SaaS is coded in Core PHP with a custom framework. It is composed of 100s of PHP files each around a thousand lines long. The database is MariaDB with 193 tables and millions of entries. So prior knowledge of working on large complex projects is also preferred.Please note also, that this is just the starting salary. This salary will increase over time as you become more familiar with the company and how everything functions here.Please include in your cover letter (if possible): 1. Prior industry knowledge (Have you worked on anything related to proxies before?)2. Our team of highly skilled, experienced and motivated professionals are committed towards harnessing technology for providing the best solutions to our customers. Our clients trust our deep experience and proven approaches - all around the world.Web Design and DeveloperThe closing date for this job posting is 02.09.2022As a Web design and developer you will work alongside front-end developers, graphic and digital designers to ensure all elements of web creation are consistent takes ownership of consulting and client activity by advising and defining solutions innovating propositions. which will include :Ability to troubleshoot and handle requests, which may include updating code, content, and functionality.Understanding of HTML, CSS and coding standards.Understanding of JavaScript.Knowledge of responsive design builds. Familiarity with multi-stage deployment. Knowledge of CMS’s a plus. Familiar with WordPress.Basic server administration skillsAble to work independently and efficiently to meet deadlines.Self-motivated, detail-oriented and organized.Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills.Responsibilities and DutiesConsistently create well-designed, tested code using best practices for website development, including accessible mobile and responsive site designCreate websites, web applications and user interfaces, using standard HTML/CSS/Javascript/React practices, while incorporating data from back-end databases, services and plugins. Our people work differently depending on their jobs and needs. From home working to job sharing, visit the remote and flexible working page on our website to find out more.
This role is based in the United Kingdom and as such all normal working days must be carried out in the United Kingdom.
Join us as an Apprentice
Join our apprenticeship programme, where you’ll be completing an externally accredited programme, Software and Web Development Level 6&8 which will take you up to 24 months to complete both programmes and will set you up with excellent career prospects
Joining our cutting-edge Technology function, you’ll be taking the first step into a long and fulfilling career
Along with valuable exposure to a wide array of technologies, you’ll be perfectly positioned to develop your IT skills, gain qualifications, and build your professional profile
You’ll be part of our growing community of apprentices, benefitting from a supportive and collaborative working environment
You’ll start with us in October 2022
What you'll do
Taking on an apprentice role could be a fantastic starting point or change for your career. You’ll receive support every step of the way, with guidance, training and mentoring to help you reach your full potential. Your line manager will set you up with goals and an individual learning plan, to help you to complete professional qualifications or technical training that you’ll need to be successful in your role.
Once established in the programme, we’ll look to you, to support other new apprentices, using your experience to guide and support them.
You’ll also:
Completing your learning plan on time, which may include passing exams, submitting workbooks and providing evidence of your development
Working closely with your apprenticeship learning provider and developing positive relationships with a wide range of colleagues
Developing your knowledge and capabilities to undertake the job
Work with various teams, systems and applications and the work you do will drive significant technology change
Work in a hands-on, analytical, or project-based environment, depending on your skills and interests
Throughout your programme you’ll embed knowledge and skills in –
Investigating and defining customer requirements,
Software design fundamentals, computer programming testing IT and Telecoms systems
Web development and software
The skills you'll need
We’re looking for a strong communicator with the ability to build great working relationships. You’ll be a good problem solver, with an added ability to think analytically and logically and adapt well to change. Crucially, we’re looking for people with a passion for learning and high levels of determination, motivation and drive to succeed.
It would be ideal if you can provide evidence of your grade A-C or Level 4, Maths and English GCSE or equivalent results, but this is not necessary to start with us as an apprentice. If you didn’t manage to achieve the desired grades or cannot provide evidence of your qualifications, then we will help you to attain them during your apprenticeship.
You’ll also need:
The ability to manage your time effectively and prioritise your work
A proactive and inquisitive mindset, with the ability to challenge and offer solutions
Strong numerical and logical skills
The ability to maintain a strong customer focus
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills,
A keen interest in technology
A great eye for detail
Motivated with a passion for driving customer-focused change
How we'll reward you
You’ll join on a competitive salary of £20,000 and in addition you’ll receive money to help you save for retirement. You can choose from a range of protection, healthcare or lifestyle benefits from RBSelect, our fully flexible reward programme.
You'll have a generous holiday entitlement of 33 days – you may be required to work Bank Holidays.
Visit our reward and benefits page for more information on the benefit packages we offer.
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats or special requirements to access our buildings, or if you’re eligible under the Disability Confident Scheme please contact us and we’ll do everything we can to help. We are currently recruiting for a Web Developer to join our growing Marketing TeamBransby Horses was founded in 1968 by Peter Hunt; his lifelong passion for horse welfare continues as the charity works hard to be flexible in its approach to meet the growing demands on horse welfare charities. We continue to rely entirely on voluntary income which is derived predominantly from long term relationships with our supporters. As the needs and behaviour of our supporters change, we must plan and adapt to ensure good quality communication that considers the platform and is consistent with our culture and brand.With the Bransby Horses website at the forefront of our online presence, it serves as a wealth of information on our welfare and rescue work, site events, numerous ways visitors can support us, and a whole lot more. Recently rebranded, there is now a focus on developing the website’s functionality to meet the immediate and future needs of the charity. Working alongside the Communications and Marketing Manager, this role will develop and maintain the current website, producing a roadmap for improvements over the next 18 months to meet the charity’s objectives.The post holder will ensure the website keeps pace with the latest digital fundraising and engagement opportunities, and where appropriate, that these are integrated seamlessly with our site. They will also keep abreast of web and digital developments that will help support the Communications and Marketing team to deliver their objectives. Responsible for the maintenance of the existing website, and when appropriate the implementation of a new website, the post holder will work with different areas of the charity to provide support in all aspects of the site, from design to functionality, ensuring best practice and relevant compliance.The ideal candidate is likely to be educated to Bachelor’s degree level in an appropriate subject, with evidence of specialism, CPD, further study and/or additional qualifications in a relevant subject such as computer science, informatics, software engineering or web design and development would be desirable. They must have previous experience in a similar role with strong knowledge and skills as outlined in the job description.This hybrid role is offered on a permanent basis and working 30 hours per week, Monday – Friday. We offer a competitive salary package; with a part time salary between £23,150 - £26,200 (dependent on experience) and many employee benefits, including a free health and wellbeing package and a day off for your birthday.We pride ourselves in offering our employees a caring and inclusive community, supportive leadership, plenty of development opportunities. We are also a disability confident and an equal opportunities employer, whom proactively seeks to ensure that candidates and employees are treated equitably regardless of their protected characteristics.To find out more and to apply, please visit https://bransbyhorses.co.uk/jobs. This advert will close on receipt of a selection of suitable candidates. We are looking for a full-stack developer with extensive experience in building WordPress themes and plugins. The ideal candidate must be very familiar with industry standards when it comes to developing for WordPress. The developer must have strong JavaScript, CSS and HTML skills.Working as part of the dev team you will report directly to the CTO. Job Description
Contract Summary
Frontend Developer / FE Developer / React DeveloperRemote / Hybrid working available
Endeavor Streaming, part of Endeavor, is building the world’s most advanced content distribution platform for Content Creators, Global Brands, TV Broadcasters and Sports Federations.
The role:
We are looking for front-end developers to join our brilliant client side development teams. The teams responsibilities include web (desktop, mobile/tablet, 10ft), native (mobile/tablet, 10ft) and playback (all devices) development.
We build and maintain a variety of modern apps, including cross-platform and multi language user facing streaming (live and on demand) applications, a number of custom back office portals to support them, our very own player engine (across all platforms), and everything in between (e.g. common private packages, lambdas).
Our stack is based on TypeScript, React, Node.js and AWS.
Required Skills:
JS (ES6)
CSS
React knowledge
Nice to have skills:
TypeScript
eye for design
React Native

We build and maintain a variety of modern apps, including cross-platform and multi language user facing streaming (live and on demand) applications, a number of custom back office portals to support them, our very own player engine (across all platforms), and everything in between (e.g. common private packages, lambdas).
Our stack is based on TypeScript, React, Node.js and AWS.
Required Skills:
JS (ES6)
CSS
React knowledge
Nice to have skills:
TypeScript
eye for design
React Native

Position – Website Developer & DesignerFull Time – 40 Hours a weekEmployer – EbMCsquaredSalary - £30,000/yearStart Date – Aug/September 2022Contract – Permanent subject to 3 Month ProbationJob Description: The World Council for Health is looking for a dynamic, positive, and experienced Website Developer & Designer. This role would involve maintaining key websites for WCH, BiRD, EbMCsquared and Source. This is a multi-faceted and at time pressurised project and as such would need to be taken on by someone who is driven, committed to the cause and has fine attention to detail. The Websites that are the most active and updated are WCH and Source (the latter is yet to be launched). All our websites are WordPress sites.You will ideally be experienced in Website Development, Website Security and Content Optimization. Everyone that works with WCH has to be a ‘captain and a soldier’ i.e. willing to pick up the work where the gaps are and when deadlines need to be met. Flexibility is needed as our online events are at varying and sometimes unsociable hours, and we will need tech support for these.The ideal candidate would be grounded with the ability to get tasks done quickly and a can-do attitude.Having good boundaries is a must. You will be working closely with the WCH Manager, Director, Content Manager and Translation Co-ordinator. Ideally you will have some branding knowledge and be able to help steer the sites in the direction they need to go.About the WCH: EbMCsquared is a community interest, non-profit start-up organization that is funded by grassroots donations. Since launching, our achievements have been profoundly impactful on a global scale, and it is imperative that we keep the same momentum as we grow. The WCH is in the process of decentralisation, so this role is key to the success of that. You will have the opportunity to contribute to real change in the world and to people’s lives with this role.The role includes but is not limited to: Developing the website – Making key improvements to the site to help improve useability and accessibility.Design – Keeping the sites ‘on brand’ to fine tune our brand and image to aid growth and accessibility.Maintaining the website – Uploading key content each week, videos, articles and statements as well as any new campaigns, blog posts etc. Maintaining the speed of the site.Security – Ensuring the website is regularly backed up and secure from threats.Ensure assets look good across all devices, mobile being the primary visitors to our sites.SEO – Technical Optimisation, Search Engine Marketing and viewership and performance reports.Ensure compliance with Data protection and privacy regulations.Familiarity with cloud solutions such as Microsoft 365Daily IT management functions for our usersExpected: +2 years’ experience in a similar role.Website Development experience.IT skills – a solid understanding of primary front-end technologies – HTML, CSS and JavaScript.WordPress experience.Ability to work well under pressure.Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint.Website Design experience.Strong communication and team collaboration skills, involving working with a remote team.Confidence and an interest in finding and learning new technologies.Experience using Kadence Blocks.Desirable:Coding ExperienceProven understanding of typography, layout, and consistence.Graphic Design SkillsVideo Editing SkillsIf you can for health, human rights, and accountability.Opportunity to be at the forefront of new research, legal actions, humanitarian issues etcFree access to courses.Potential travel opportunities.The Better Tech-For-Good/ Web Developer/ Full Stack Developer/ Health Tech

I am looking for a Junior/ Mid-level Web Developer with experience in Vue.JS and or React.JS, to join a Tech-for-good start up. You will be working on a prototype healthcare platform, helping to bring it into the market. You will be responsible for design improvements on the platform and creating new interactive features. You will be given opportunities to influence the company’s direction and the platform being developed. As an early stage start up you will be able to grow within the company and take on new responsibilities as the company grows and blossoms.

Skills Required:
2+ years commercial experience

Vue and/or React

Git

Software development lifecycle

Desirable:
Experience with patient-facing products in the healthcare settings

Knowledge of cloud environment – AWS

Experience with video/audio live communications

If you have any questions or would like to apply for the role, please contact me on 0161 388 2635.

Salary: £25-45k

Junior/Mid-Level Web Developer

For more information about Shift F5 and the opportunities we have to offer follow us on Twitter @F5_Jobs

job_title: Web development roles (all levels, including graduates)
listing_jobDesc:
We are always interested in hearing from talented and enthusiastic developers across all levels:

Graduate developers
Junior developers
Mid-level developers
Senior developers
We love growing talent and we love creative thinkers

Join our award-winning Development Team and help bring our great design work to life. Be one of the craftspeople developing beautiful, frictionless online experiences, pushing the boundaries of online technologies for the agency and our clients.

Regardless of level, you will be an integral part of the project delivery process, from inception through design, development, deployment and ongoing support. You will be working predominantly with open-source technologies and will have the opportunity to evolve the role as you develop your skills. We look for enthusiasm, potential and a desire to progress.

Day-to-day life as a developer at 7DOTS
You will work alongside designers, project managers, account managers and strategy experts to build websites, apps and campaigns for 7DOTS’ clients.
Programme, test, optimise and deploy fully responsive, dynamic, future proofed and performant websites and apps.
Writing clear, performant and re-usable code in the following areas: HTML, CSS/SASS, JavaScript (ES6+), PHP and MySQL.
Help plan and organise your own work packages to meet deadlines and milestones in collaboration with our delivery leads.
Work with colleagues to analyse client requirements, proposing scalable and flexible “future-proofed” solutions and estimating development work accordingly.
Work on various platforms including Silverstripe, Magento, WordPress as well as Git and tooling such as Webpack and Yarn package manager.
Exploring new approaches and technologies to improve our development process and commercial offering.
Respond to support tickets and client requests.
Maintain commercial awareness through all projects and think strategically.
Junior
developers

£20-30k pa
Minimum of 1 years’ experience

Get in touch

Mid-level
developers

£30-40k pa
Minimum of 3 years’ experience

Get in touch

Senior
developers

Starting from £40k pa
Minimum of 5 years’ experience

Get in touch

Skills and experience
Commercial experience building CMS powered, “mobile first”, websites with a PHP based platform such as WordPress, Drupal, Silverstripe.
Good proficiency in HTML, CSS, Javascript (ES6+), PHP and MySQL and ideally experience with Git, Webpack and SASS – always looking to exploit new technologies.
A good understanding of commercial implications of deadlines and budgets.
A keen eye for detail and a robust approach to QA.
Able to analyse requirements and translate them into scalable and flexible solutions.
A good team player and communicator; happy engaging with clients when required.
Knows when to call senior colleagues for support.
Graduate developers

We are seeking IT, engineering or technically gifted graduates with a thirst to learn new technologies looking for their first step towards becoming a fully-fledged web and app developer. Potential, enthusiasm, and personality are as important to us as your technical skills.

Graduate starting salary: £21k

Get in touch

Location

All roles are full time, permanent roles based in our offices in Kingston upon Thames. We are now operating hybrid home/office working with people coming in to the office for 3+ days a week.

Working hours: Mon-Fri, 9.00am - 5.30pm

Get in touch

If you are interested in a role, please email your CV and a cover letter to careers@7dots.co.uk

Please note that, owing to the volume of enquiries, we are unable to reply to everyone. We do not accept introductions from recruiters other than those already contracted and briefed by 7DOTS. We are always interested in hearing from talented and enthusiastic developers across all levels:

Join the vibrant and growing team at DiCE Creative. Working across industries to support brand development, marketing, software development and customer success. A diverse team, working on diverse projects, with a singular mission for high quality project delivery and support.Situated in the industrial oasis that is The Village, Trafford Park, Manchester we’re easily reached by road and tram with copious free parking right on the doorstep. We embrace flexible and remote working tailored to each roll, provide training and professional certification, 28 days holiday inc. bank holidays, generous pension contributions, annual team events and invest heavily in equipment and services to help us all enjoy our work.The RoleOwn the front end implementation of projects, bringing designs to life in exciting and innovative ways. Work closely with the design team to establish suitable ambitions for projects ensuring expectations can be met and goals delivered. Build on core technologies and knowledge, continuing to grow your own and the team’s capabilities. Follow development standards and best practices consistently, while contributing to their evolution. Driven by an inexplicable need to create compelling user experiences with near flawless execution. Can offer pragmatic solutions and compromise when necessary (but always slightly reluctantly). employee_residence: Swindon, Wiltshire, South West England, England
listing_jobDesc: We're looking for a front-end developer to take on the challenge of creating amazing website experiences for the many SMEs and their customers that we serve across the South West.Are you looking for a new and exciting development challenge?We're looking to recruit a highly motivated front-end developer, who is passionate about their craft and has a real eye for detail - to work from our Swindon office with an option for a remote blend. (Min 3 days a week in the office).Think you're up to the challenge? Please read this next section carefully, as it’s not just some corporate puffery we've cut and paste - we have taken care to list the qualities we are looking for.Requirements for the role:2/3 years experience (personal or professional) of working with HTML, CSS and Javascript,Experience with Bootstrap and/or Foundation frameworks,Great communication skills,A pixel-perfect attention to detail,Able to demonstrate your best work! (Portfolio, links to previous projects etc.)Desirable: Previous work in an agency or similar working environment,Working knowledge of design software such as Photoshop, Illustrator or XD,Working understanding of SASS/LESS e.t.cConfident in communicating directly with clients,Working knowledge of MySQL, NGINX / Apache.Finding the right person is far more important than skill set to us at GEL Studios, so if you feel you'd be a great fit, however, you might not have everything listed above, please still get in touch.What does a typical day look like?Honestly - it's varied! Typical activities would include:Working closely with the whole team to create brilliant designs, in compliant code,Assisting with support requests from our clients,Working on client accounts and responding to varied queries and/or work requests,Participating in regular project meetings and client updates.Your input would also be valued with other business-wide activities such as: Assisting with and contributing towards our own internal change management,Presentations from the team about what they are working on,Collaborating with the development team to provide time estimates for quoted pieces of work.Communication and teamwork: We're a close-working team at GEL, and good communication from start to finish - is key. You will not get handed a design and told to “go develop it“ - there is a detailed handover process where your input - matters.Our clients are part of our team as well. We work with them to understand their needs and proactively engage with suggested solutions and a different perspective on how to achieve their goals. They also commit to our work, so we can rely on their input and help in the project.High quality: As an award-winning agency, we are not interested in supplying a bare-minimum service to our clients - we go above and beyond. We are looking for a candidate who has a passion not to supply the quickest or the cheapest - but the best. If you following scoping documents to the letter - without thinking about what could be done to push the boundaries - then chances are you're not right for us - however, if you read between the lines, look towards the future, and want to continually improve yourself, then please, carry on!An ideal candidate should have exceptional, pixel-perfect attention to detail, and double (triple!) checking all aspects of your work should come as second nature. Are there differences between the designs and your HTML? If things are even a pixel out of place, or not working as intended - our Creative Director will be sure to let you know! You should be passionate and proud to shout about the work you're producing.Why work for GEL Studios?Not all agencies are created equal - and we're proud of that. We've got to where we are because of our passion for customer service, and above all else, being experts in our field. Because of this approach, we're a three-time AWWWard winner and national winner of the DEA Web Development project of the year 2017.No idea is a bad idea, and we welcome new and exciting ways of doing things. This is a role that can grow with you and your skill set, where every day is varied and fun. Keys points however are...Room to grow.This position has a competitive salary, and the room to grow in whatever direction it takes you. We highly encourage ongoing development - with lots of training potential.Lots of holidays.Unlimited holiday, yes, that's right - unlimited. We work hard, and we play even harder. We also operate flex time, so if you want to leave a few hours early one day, that's fine!Fun environment.A relaxed working environment will ensure that you have a great time when you're at the office. Nerf guns and video games are the norms.Awesome pension.Planning for the future can be boring, but at least have the comfort in knowing that you can have an above-average pension with lots of options, provided by AVIVA.Applicants.Please send all CVs along with some examples of your best work, and a covering letter.We understand that not all developers are the same, so if you feel you fit the bill, please send us your CV along with a few reasons as to why you feel you should be considered for the position.GEL Studios is an equal opportunities employer.Strictly no recruiters.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany pensionFlexitimeOn-site parkingUnlimited paid holidaysWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication question(s):The successful candidate will be required to work from our Swindon office at least 3 days a week.Are you able to commute to Swindon 3 days a week?Reference ID: 1 We're looking for a front-end developer to take on the challenge of creating amazing website experiences for the many SMEs and their customers that we serve across the South West.Are you looking for a new and exciting development challenge?We're looking to recruit a highly motivated front-end developer, who is passionate about their craft and has a real eye for detail - to work from our Swindon office with an option for a remote blend. (Min 3 days a week in the office).Think you're up to the challenge?
