We highly encourage ongoing development - with lots of training potential.Lots of holidays.Unlimited holiday, yes, that's right - unlimited. We work hard, and we play even harder. We also operate flex time, so if you want to leave a few hours early one day, that's fine!Fun environment.A relaxed working environment will ensure that you have a great time when you're at the office. Nerf guns and video games are the norms.Awesome pension.Planning for the future can be boring, but at least have the comfort in knowing that you can have an above-average pension with lots of options, provided by AVIVA.Applicants.Please send all CVs along with some examples of your best work, and a covering letter.We understand that not all developers are the same, so if you feel you fit the bill, please send us your CV along with a few reasons as to why you feel you should be considered for the position.GEL Studios is an equal opportunities employer.Strictly no recruiters.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressCompany pensionFlexitimeOn-site parkingUnlimited paid holidaysWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication question(s):The successful candidate will be required to work from our Swindon office at least 3 days a week.Are you able to commute to Swindon 3 days a week?Reference ID: 1 Show more

Enterprise Applications
Location: Egham

Salary: £37,467 per annum - including London Allowance

Post Type: Full Time

Closing Date: 23.59 hours BST on Wednesday 31 August 2022

Reference: 0822-378

Full-Time, Permanent
Applications are invited for the post of Web & Application Developer in the IT Department.
This post will work across both the Student Administrative Systems Team and the Web & Mobile Apps team helping to design and implement elegant and compelling web-based experiences that enable colleagues and students to interact with the University’s digital services.
The post holder will continue their personal development journey at Royal Holloway by assisting with the design of interactive prototypes, participate in the daily scrums and help turn the prototypes into working solutions using a wide range of front-end and back end technologies such as HTML5, Angular JS, Bootstrap, Sass, MS Graph and other vendor / platform specific APIs and workflow solutions.
There are plenty of training opportunities as the post holder will have opportunities to be engaged in developing across the Microsoft Power platform and within a new MS Dynamics implementation. There is access to Microsoft subscriptions, a Pluralsight licence and knowledge from seasoned team members.
In order to be considered for this role, a passion for web and application development is a must have, along with knowledge of programming using a language such as JavaScript, C#, Python or Java.
Prior experience of building websites / applications using HTML5, CSS 3 and JavaScript is essential, either at an academic level or in industry, and whilst education to degree level or equivalent is beneficial, a demonstrable portfolio of projects or completion of industry relevant course would be an acceptable alternative.
Knowledge of Angular JS or a server side language such as ASP.Net or PHP or of the Microsoft Power platform and Graph APIs is desirable but not essential as training can be provided if necessary.
The successful candidate will also possess excellent attention to detail as they will be creating elements for use on the public website and business critical services, they will have clear written and verbal communications skills and will be able to demonstrate a logical approach to problem solving.
In return we offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including generous annual leave and training and development opportunities. The post is based in Egham, Surrey where the College is situated in a beautiful, leafy campus near to Windsor Great Park and within commuting distance from London.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk.
The College is unable to obtain permission to work in the UK for this post. Therefore all applicants must be able to demonstrate their right to work in the UK if they wish to apply.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk

Kwalee is one of the world’s leading multiplatform game publishers and developers, with well over 750 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let’s Be Cops 3D, Traffic Cop 3D and Makeover Studio 3D. Alongside this, we also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope and Die by the Blade.
With a team of talented people collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, the Philippines and many more places, we have a truly global team making games for a global audience. And it’s paying off: Kwalee games have been downloaded in every country on earth! If you think you’re a good fit for one of our remote vacancies, we want to hear from you wherever you are based.
Founded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters for many years, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts. Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee’s success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we’re proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle. Could your idea be the next global hit?
What’s the job?
As our Frontend Web Developer you’ll be designing and producing excellent web interfaces, working closely with the server and analytics teams.
What you tell your friends you do
“I make really powerful web-based tools and ensure that everyone in the company has the software that they need, especially when they don't actually know what they need!”
What you will really be doing
You'll be working directly with the server and client teams to create our games server admin interfaces. And closely with the analytics team developing features for our analytics platform.
A portion of the work involves maintaining/improving our extensive games server admin interface and our in-house Analytics platform.
You will be working with a lot of different technologies that make up our worldwide cluster where we support millions of daily players.
On some projects specific gameplay features rely on server side counterparts and complex web UI interfaces making for a good change of pace from Analytics and Data entry interfaces.
How you will be doing this
You’ll be part of an agile, multidisciplinary and creative team and work closely with them to ensure the best results.
You'll think creatively and be motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best.
You’ll work with cutting edge technology, if you need software or hardware to get the job done efficiently, you will get it. We even have a robot!
Team
Our talented team is our signature. We have a highly creative atmosphere with more than 200 staff where you’ll have the opportunity to contribute daily to important decisions. You’ll work within an extremely experienced, passionate and diverse team, including David Darling and the creator of the Micro Machines video games.
Skills and Requirements
Minimum 2 years browser-based programming experience
A proven track record of programming high quality and innovative web pages using Javascript, HTML5 & CSS3 and relevant frameworks (ideally ReactJS but could also be others e.g. AngularJS, NodeJS, Handlebars, jquery, gulp)
An excellent working knowledge of various programming languages, databases and scripting tools including at least one of bash, MySQL, CouchBase, Python, Java, C#, JSP, PHP
A creative mindset motivated by challenges and constantly striving for the best
Interest in mobile games
Desirable:
Knowledge of the Unix, Linux, MacOS or equivalent development environments
Working knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)
2:1 or higher degree in a related discipline e.g., computer science, programming, maths
We offer
We want everyone involved in our games to share our success, that’s why we have a generous team profit sharing scheme from day 1 of employment
In addition to a competitive salary we also contribute to your pension, offer private medical cover and life assurance
Creative Wednesdays! (Design and make your own games every Wednesday)
A dog friendly office - bring your favourite pooch! (There’s dog-free areas too)
Hybrid model available depending on the department and the role
Access to on site gym - no more skiving!
25 days of paid holidays plus bank holidays
Relocation support available
VISA Sponsorship available
Great work-life balance with flexible working hours
Quarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!
Entertainment area with consoles, pool table, tennis table and darts!
Monthly employee awards
Free snacks, fruit and drinks
Our philosophy
We firmly believe in creativity and innovation and that a fundamental requirement for a successful and happy company is having the right mix of individuals. With the right people in the right environment anything and everything is possible.
Kwalee makes games to bring people, their stories, and their interests together. As an employer, we’re dedicated to making sure that everyone can thrive within our team by welcoming and supporting people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances. With the inclusion of diverse voices in our teams, we bring plenty to the table that’s fresh, fun and exciting; it makes for a better environment and helps us to create better games for everyone! This is how we move forward as a company – because these voices are the difference that make all the difference. The successful candidate will be leading a small team of Front-End Developers to maintain and further improve the organisation's customer-facing platform and associated systems.
Experience required:
Extensive experience working with React
Knowledge of React Native (Highly desirable - not required)
Experience with testing frameworks such as Jasmine, Jest or Mocha

Are you a Front-End Developer with experience of JavaScript, looking to enhance your skills with React? Are you looking to join an industry leading legal organisation offering brilliant career opportunities in a fully remote role? We are looking for 2 Front End Devs to continue enhancing the UI of our current and new applications.
Role: Front End Developer
Salary: up to £42k plus Benefits
Location: Remote / Work From Home – Offices in Hull, Leeds, Birmingham and Glasgow. If you would like to work from any of the offices you are more than welcome to.
What our Front-End Developers work with:
Experience working closely with The wider Product and UX team to convert their ideas into tangible visible awesomeness.
JavaScript, HTML, CSS and responsive design
Experience of React framework would be great but is not a necessity
Git version control system
Agile working
You love working as part of a team and on individual projects.

We’re looking for a graduate web developer to join our team and to help us build award winning online experiences for our customers. You’ll benefit from working with a small and friendly team on a hybrid basis from our office on Nottingham Science Park.What you’ll be doing day-to-day: Building Wordpress websites from Figma designsCoding in HTML, Twig, PHP, Javascript & CSS (based on TailwindCSS)Liaising with our internal team and external stakeholders client-sideContributing to the high standards that we hold ourselves to as a companyWhat we’re looking for…Our essentials: Evidence of a creative flair and an eye for detailGood knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavascriptExperience/knowledge of using version control systems such as gitAn enthusiastic and ambitious attitudeGood time management skillsAbility to work to deadlinesOur desirables: Design ability – we’d love somebody that’s creative and wants to own whole projects from design through to developmentAn understanding of PHP and LaravelAn understanding of MySQLYou’ll notice that we didn’t mention “at least X months of experience”. That’s because we’re open to all experience levels and we prefer to hire based on whether you have the attributes and skills to enhance the team, not just that you’ve worked somewhere for a couple of years.What we’re offering…A very competitive salary based on experience – feel free to contact us for the salary rangeAn ultra modern workspace which is being built as we speakFlexible working hoursHybrid workingA pension scheme which you’ll become a part of as soon as you’ve passed your probationary periodTop of the range Apple equipmentCasual dress policyEarly finish on Friday’s (start at 9, finish at 4)Self development budget to attend conferences/trainingDiscount scheme across major retailers21 days holiday + bank holidaysCompany eventsBirthday off -- if your birthday falls on a working day, you’re allowed to take it off without impacting your holiday entitlementTo apply, please send us a covering letter, your CV and a link to your portfolio or github link and your salary expectations.Recruitment agencies: please don’t contact us, we prefer to source our own talent.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: £20,000.00-£30,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Yearly bonusBenefits:FlexitimeWork from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayNo weekendsAbility to commute/relocate:Nottingham, NG7 2RF: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Education:Bachelor's (preferred)Work authorisation:United Kingdom (required)Expected start date: 01/10/2022 We’re looking for a graduate web developer to join our team and to help us build award winning online experiences for our customers. We’re looking for a Web Developer to work on a variety of goDonate Implementations for many well-known charities such as: Stroke Association, Parkinson’s UK, NSPCC and Royal British Legion. If you are looking for a rewarding role then this is the right position for you!goDonate is an exciting and fast-growing next generation donation fundraising platform. Using the latest technology and best practice UX, goDonate helps charities raise more money online to help them deliver more of their good work. You can see more information on our product website https://go-donate.uk/Although we are London based in Soho, most of our developers work mainly from home and come into the office twice a month, some of our team are 100% remote. We welcome applicants who are looking to work remotely full-time or who may want the best of both worlds of working from an office and at home!Our goDonate product comes in a variety of forms, from our serverless Essential and Plus products, to our Umbraco CMS-based enterprise solutions. Our front-ends integrate with a variety of payment gateways, postcode lookup services and other APIs. Prior knowledge of specific integrations is not essential. No client is the same and require many customisations to their installation to fit their needs.Your core technology knowledge should include HTML 5, CSS, JS, and exposure to frameworks and tools such as Vue, Typescript, Webpack and SASS. You may also be required to manage configuration settings in JSON format as well as configure and test backend reporting of custom fields implemented on the front-end.As such your role will require you to:· maintain and develop front-ends for transactional websites, payment pages, custom solutions and serverless applications· consume third party APIs such as payment gateways and postcode lookups, using client-side JavaScript· effectively use Vue, HTML5, JavaScript and CSS to enhance user experience, validate user input, and manage the user journey· be comfortable with asynchronous coding techniques, dependency injection and ORMs· be comfortable using database technologies such as MS SQL Server· working primarily with JSON as well as other common data formats such as CSV and XML· develop with an eye to data protection, code and data security, performance, and scale· work with the design team to implement designs targeting a variety of mobile, tablet and desktop devices· use a mix of open-source libraries, as well as versioning tools such as Git· pick up and learn new techniques, technologies, and 3rd party products· discuss and suggest solutions together with clients and other team members· be able to assess appropriateness of third-party libraries, plug-ins, and servicesA strong theoretical foundation is desirable for this role, especially around the areas of interface development, common programming design patterns, and asynchronous coding.We would expect candidates to have:· at least 2 years real-world development experience· an eye for detail and high-quality standards· proven ability implementing accessible rich user interfaces· demonstrable experience in integrating front-ends with external systems· good communication skills for liaising with clients and colleaguesExperience in the following areas would be desirable, but is not essential:· Integrating with Braintree, Stripe, PayPal or other Payment Gateway· Experience with payment wallet solutions like Google Pay and Apple Pay· Experience developing with .NET Core and Node.js· Using Google Firebase, Google Cloud functions· Umbraco CMS· Working within cloud platforms such as Google Cloud· Progressive Web Apps including offline· Common front-end frameworks such Vue, Angular, React· Common platforms such as Dotdigital, MandrillA relevant degree is desired; but we are open to non-graduates who can demonstrate having an equivalent theoretical understanding.The company behind goDonate is an established 45-person agency based in Soho, London with 10 people in the development team and working alongside the UX, design and project management teams. The working environment is very friendly, supportive, and sociable.BenefitsCompetitive salary, flexible home/office base that suits you. Plus 22 days holiday rising to 27 days holiday after the first 12 months, duvet days, your birthday day off, training budget, discounted private healthcare, social events, cycle to work scheme, discounted home computer scheme.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £35,000.00-£42,000.00 per yearBenefits:Cycle to work schemeSick payWork from homeSchedule:HolidaysMonday to FridayExperience:HTML 5, CSS, JS: 2 years (required)JSON: 1 year (preferred)MS SQL Server: 1 year (preferred)working with payment gateways: 1 year (preferred)Vue.js: 1 year (required)Work authorisation:United Kingdom (required) We’re looking for a Web Developer to work on a variety of goDonate Implementations for many well-known charities such as: Stroke Association, Parkinson’s UK, NSPCC and Royal British Legion. Company Description
We are Bosch and “Made by Bosch” stands for outstanding quality of a global player.
Within the worldwide Bosch Group we have 4 business sectors: Consumer Goods, Energy and Building Technology, Industrial Technology and Mobility Solutions.
The current role sits within the Mobility Solutions sector, under the Bosch Automotive Service Solutions, responsible for the worldwide aftermarket business and services.
Bosch Automotive Service Solutions was founded in 1925 and since then we've been continuously developing our Diagnostic Competence. In more than 140 countries, we offer spare parts, technical information, as well as diagnostic hardware, software and services for analysis, upkeep and repair of vehicles. Our mission is to create powerful solutions servicing the world's vehicles and while vehicle complexity and mobility user service expectations continually increase, we help our customers close the gap between current capabilities and future service needs.
At Bosch, we strive to make Bosch – and the world – a bit better through solutions “Invented for life”. If you want beneficial technologies being shaped by your ideas, you landed in the right place. You will have the chance to improve quality of life all across the globe. Profit from the multitude of career opportunities in an internationally positioned company. Welcome to Bosch!

Job Description
We are looking for a candidate with a combination of IT know how and automotive domain knowledge to join our expending development team. The team designs, develops and maintains web based automotive diagnostics data analysis systems.
Your tasks & responsibilities
Deliver Software solution designs to meet customer requirements (front end & back end)
Ensure software solutions meet security standards, performance, and scalability targets
Develops ideas into efficient, reliable, and maintainable code
Follow Bosch quality standards for all deliverables including Automotive SPICE
Perform peer code reviews, unit test
Work in collaboration with project manager, software architect and development team, including:
 Building trust within project and customer teams
 Deliver work packages on time
 Work in an agile way, so that you can react quickly to changing environments

Qualifications

Experience as a software developer
Working knowledge of enterprise IT architecture
Understanding in:
Front end web development experience: Typescript, JavaScript, JSON, CSS, HTML, Angular
Backend development experience: Java, Spring boot, XML, Rest API
Cloud development experience covering design, development, maintenance, and documentation:
AWS (Amazon Web Services): lambda, DynamoDB, gateway, s3, and VPC
GCP (Google Cloud Platform): Cloud functions, Cloud Storage, Big Query, and VPC
Azure (Microsoft cloud): App Functions, Blob Storage, Cloud SQL, and VPC
Proven ability to absorb complex & technical information
Must be highly motivated and driven to succeed in a demanding business environment
Proven written & verbal communication skills
Desirable:
Dashboard content design and creation experience
Automotive domain knowledge including diagnostics data, Vehicle Communication Interface and diagnosis process
Six Sigma / Statistics Analysis
Qualified in Agile
Additional Information
What we offer:
Holiday: 25 days plus Bank Holidays
Pension: Company matched contribution
GIP (Group Income Protection)
Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Programme
Many other perks and benefits
Hybrid working (60%-40%office- home arrangements)

Spend your days making a difference.

FourthRev builds world class online learning programmes that lead to qualifications from leading universities, certifications from the world's best technology companies and digital technology jobs with a global network of employer partners.

It's our vision to become the world's leading enabler of employability outcomes for students and lifelong learners. In doing so, and helping close the digital skills gap, our purpose is to create social and economic value on a global scale.
Your Mission

The Front-End Web Developer is a Marketing team member responsible for designing, building and maintaining websites and landing pages to support FourthRev's marketing efforts. In this role, you'll work closely with key marketing stakeholders to optimise web layouts, undertake testing and build new landing pages aligned to specific style guidelines.

You'll work mainly in both WordPress and Hubspot, where you'll be expected to implement industry best practices and remain committed to proactive and continuous improvement through learning

What you'll need to succeed
Bachelor's degree or similar
3-5 years work experience as a web developer within a marketing team.
Proven design, development and customisation abilities using WordPress CMS, with HubSpot experience as a bonus.
Comfortable using core front-end languages HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Full-stack knowledge is beneficial but not essential.
Understanding of responsive design principles, accessibility and UX best practices.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and the ability to multitask effectively.
Ability to perform in a fast-paced work environment and upskill as required.
Openness to feedback, self-reflection and ongoing personal development.
Able to document thoughts and plans well
Exposure to / has worked in team who do education/EdTech marketing or teams with a very strong lead gen and lead nurturing focus
Data-driven approach to UX

What your day to day will look like with us

Web Development

Maintain and update the current website, including layout updates, content adjustments, page optimisations, etc., using custom widgets and up-to-date approaches for accessibility and general website performance.
Ensure marketing tools and tracking integrations are working properly and aligned to industry best practices.
Build landing pages in HubSpot for paid traffic, while engaging with the relevant FourthRev team members and HubSpot resources to implement efficient practices and undertake rigorous testing and reporting.
Stay up to date on user experience (UX), accessibility and web best practices, and ensure these practices are implemented.
Proactively seek opportunities for gains in efficiency and scalability in your function.
Reference and abide by the brand guidelines of both FourthRev and its partners.

Project Management

Manage project timelines through FourthRev's chosen project management system to ensure tasks are prioritised and completed on time.
Undertake multiple projects simultaneously while keeping communication open and transparent to ensure an accurate team view of progress
Communicate effectively with the relevant marketing stakeholders to ensure proper adherence to process and deadlines
Work to establish strong relationships with team members and stakeholders, including the ability to give and receive feedback.

Trends, Best Practices and Personal Improvement

Stay on top of industry trends, products and practices in the areas of digital marketing, UX and web development, and apply learnings to your work.
Proactively improve your knowledge of the capabilities of FourthRev's marketing tools and platforms.
Demonstrate the ability for self-reflection, and make measurable efforts to build on current knowledge, behaviours and skills gaps.

Why you'll love working here

At FourthRev, we are deeply passionate about work being a meaningful, fulfilling part of life. We are proud to be a remote first company that offers flexible working arrangements and ongoing professional growth and development. We place staff health and happiness at the core of strategy and operations as a critical component of our high performance culture. We are deeply passionate about work being a meaningful, fulfilling part of life.

Get ready to:

You'll tackle unique and challenging opportunities and embrace the unknown, supported by an amazing and talented team of professionals who genuinely care and want you to succeed.
Your voice matters. We believe that people matter and that our success as an organisation is driven by the people within it.
You'll become part of a greater community. We're passionate about enabling the growth of others, mentorship, lifelong learning, supporting learners in the digital economy and other causes.
We are a globally diverse team with colleagues spanning different time zones including the U.K. Australia and South Africa. Let us know where you are, we will see if we can make it work! Spend your days making a difference.

Front-End Developer
Salary up to £45,000

Are you an enthusiastic Front-End Developer, who is passionate about all things web and new technology?

It's an exciting time to join our Digital Platform Team! We're building innovative ways to engage with new and existing customers, on a portfolio of products that reach out to 17 million customers globally. The digital team sits at the forefront of delivering our strategy, they create not only brand-new experiences, but also make small changes to continually evolve existing products and to enhance code quality against our core development principles.

A bit about the job:
As a Front-End Developer, you will be involved with translating creative visions into beautiful implementations, whilst working within a highly skilled team to produce the best solutions possible. You'll need to be an expert in HTML, CSS and JavaScript, as well as having experience with producing accessible and responsive layouts and a strong appreciation of core software engineering principles.

Skills and experience we're looking for:

Excellent understanding and experience of both HTML5 and CSS2 and their interpretation by various modern and legacy web browsers

Solid understanding of JavaScript and associated common libraries (High charts knowledge would be beneficial)

A good level of understanding of source control tools, preferably Git

Excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team within an Agile setting

What you'll get for this role:

Salary up to £45,000 (depending on location, skills, experience, and qualifications)

Generous pension (starting level Aviva contributes 8% when you contribute 2%)

Eligibility for annual performance bonus

Family friendly parental and carer's leave

29 days holiday per year plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

Up to 40% discount for Aviva products

Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars

Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme

21 volunteering hours per year

Aviva is for everyone:

We are inclusive - we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Excited but not sure you tick every box? Research tells us that women, particularly, feel this way. So, regardless of gender, why not apply. And if you're in a job share just apply as a pair. We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you.

Most of our people are smart working - spending around 60% of their time in our offices and 40% at home.

To find out more about working at Aviva take a look here

We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you've applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we'll interview you.

We'd love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Lacey Lane Mckoy a call on 07385425912 or send an email to lacey.lane-mckoy@aviva.com Front-End Developer
Salary up to £45,000

Are you an enthusiastic Front-End Developer, who is passionate about all things web and new technology?

It's an exciting time to join our Digital Platform Team! We're building innovative ways to engage with new and existing customers, on a portfolio of products that reach out to 17 million customers globally. The digital team sits at the forefront of delivering our strategy, they create not only brand-new experiences, but also make small changes to continually evolve existing products and to enhance code quality against our core development principles.

A bit about the job:
As a Front-End Developer, you will be involved with translating creative visions into beautiful implementations, whilst working within a highly skilled team to produce the best solutions possible. You'll need to be an expert in HTML, CSS and JavaScript, as well as having experience with producing accessible and responsive layouts and a strong appreciation of core software engineering principles.

Skills and experience we're looking for:

Excellent understanding and experience of both HTML5 and CSS2 and their interpretation by various modern and legacy web browsers

Solid understanding of JavaScript and associated common libraries (High charts knowledge would be beneficial)

A good level of understanding of source control tools, preferably Git

Excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team within an Agile setting

What you'll get for this role:

Salary up to £45,000 (depending on location, skills, experience, and qualifications)

Generous pension (starting level Aviva contributes 8% when you contribute 2%)

Eligibility for annual performance bonus

Family friendly parental and carer's leave

29 days holiday per year plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

Up to 40% discount for Aviva products

Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars

Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme

21 volunteering hours per year

Aviva is for everyone:

We are inclusive - we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Most of our people are smart working - spending around 60% of their time in our offices and 40% at home.

We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you've applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we'll interview you.

We'd love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Lacey Lane Mckoy a call on 07385425912 or send an email to lacey.lane-mckoy@aviva.com Front-End Developer

Up to £40,000
Great opportunity for a PHP developer to join a well-established and talented team. This is a Remote working role and the candidate must be able to manage their own work load effectively and be willing to work remotely and multiple projects.The company is based in Stoke on Trent.

Junior PHP Developer
About You

We are looking for a Junior PHP Developer that has a genuine passion for technology.
The Junior PHP Developer role opens the opportunity to learn whilst working with an experienced and growing development team.

This role will suit anyone searching to break into the tech industry and aid in developing creative in-house products.
The successful candidate will work directly with our Principal Systems Developer, learning from them whilst supporting the business and client needs.
Alongside development search engine optimization tasks and IT queries when required is also considered a huge advantage.
We strongly believe in the importance of good communication and require a Junior PHP Developer that values team work.

Essential Key Skills
The Junior PHP Developer should have the ability to write clean HTML and CSS
You will have basic knowledge of JavaScript / jQuery
The ability to write clean and clear PHP code is essential
You will also be testing code and solving problems
MySQL database structure
Ad-hoc customer support when required
You hold the following skills and experiences:
Knowledge of object orientated PHP
Basic server administration skills
Clear and Professional telephone manner
An understanding of XML and JSON
An understanding of computer networking

Benefits
Huge training opportunities
25 days paid holiday + bank holidays
Company pension
Health care scheme
Life insurance
Staff discount scheme
Flexibility to work from home or the office
Varied and interesting clients and work

Building our future

We believe the work we do really matters, so we’re serious about investing in you.
If you are a PHP Developer that is looking to develop your skill base, gain exposure to new areas of business and want to join a forward-thinking business, this is the place for you.

Junior PHP Developer, PHP, Developer, Web, Software, application

If you have any questions or you want to discuss, please email Jonathan.cornell@jarrettandlam.com Junior PHP Developer

The University of Chester is seeking to appoint an enthusiastic Web Developer to contribute to the design, development, and implementation of web-based practice placement evaluation systems for a range of healthcare programme providers across the Midlands.This post is based on the Birkenhead Site, with a flexible option to work from home. You will contribute to developing online assessment and audit documents and processes to support a range of users including students, academics, clinicians, and managers and provide information management and statistical data functionality to a range of stakeholders. This is an exciting time to join the team, as the next step is to branch into a range of other practice related fields, ranging from education and engineering to art therapy.You will have experience within a Web Development role, including experience of programming using Object Oriented PHP and MySQL, in addition to knowledge of HTML5, Javascript / JQuery, CSS, W3C Standards and other authoring and enhancing tools.You will have an ability to problem solve, with excellent communication skills. Knowledge and understanding of Higher education and/or Health Service provision would be an advantage but not essential. Full awareness training of the PARE system and functionality will be provided, and the University actively encourages continued professional development.Part-time and job share working arrangements will be considered for this post.We encourage applications from a diverse range of applicants. At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Lincoln is on the lookout for talented .NET/C# Developer who are passionate about developing innovative automation solutions that enhance creative workflows. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in the heart of Lincoln.

WHAT WE DO
We design and build tools to support Rockstar's worldwide QA and Localisation teams. Our tools streamline common QA and Localisation processes and workflows. We also provide ways for users to view and analyse business data in a variety of formats.
We maintain a variety of existing tools and systems to ensure the continued smooth running of day-to-day operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Write quality, maintainable, and testable code, following the team's coding guidelines, to fix bugs and implement new features.
Work with users to gather requirements and debug problems.
Review other developers' code.

QUALIFICATIONS
A degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience.
We are hiring across all levels of experience, from Associate (0/1+ year) to Mid (2+ years) and Senior (5+ years).

SKILLS
Strong .NET/C# skills.
Experience writing and debugging asynchronous code.
Experience writing unit tests.
SQL / relational database skills.
Strong communication skills.
Experience working with the MVVM design pattern.
An understanding of different architectures and design patterns.
Ability to work well within a cross-studio team.
Ability to work within a schedule and deliver effectively to deadlines.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
NET Core (Web API).
Knowledge or prior experience with WPF.
Familiarity with Entity Framework or similar ORM.
Knowledge of XAML and/or Angular.
Passion for development and games, especially Rockstar products.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race. Job reference

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Lincoln is on the lookout for talented .NET/C# Developer who are passionate about developing innovative automation solutions that enhance creative workflows. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in the heart of Lincoln.

WHAT WE DO
We design and build tools to support Rockstar's worldwide QA and Localisation teams. Our tools streamline common QA and Localisation processes and workflows. We also provide ways for users to view and analyse business data in a variety of formats.
We maintain a variety of existing tools and systems to ensure the continued smooth running of day-to-day operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Write quality, maintainable, and testable code, following the team's coding guidelines, to fix bugs and implement new features.
Work with users to gather requirements and debug problems.
Review other developers' code.

QUALIFICATIONS
A degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience.
We are hiring across all levels of experience, from Associate (0/1+ year) to Mid (2+ years) and Senior (5+ years).

SKILLS
Strong .NET/C# skills.
Experience writing and debugging asynchronous code.
Experience writing unit tests.
SQL / relational database skills.
Strong communication skills.
Experience working with the MVVM design pattern.
An understanding of different architectures and design patterns.
Ability to work well within a cross-studio team.
Ability to work within a schedule and deliver effectively to deadlines.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
NET Core (Web API).
Knowledge or prior experience with WPF.
Familiarity with Entity Framework or similar ORM.
Knowledge of XAML and/or Angular.
Passion for development and games, especially Rockstar products.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race. Job reference

Job Ref: REC1007
Branch: Recruit Genie
Location: Recruit Genie, Leeds
Salary/Benefits: £30,000 - £40,000
Contract type: Permanent
Hours: Full Time
Hours per week: 40
Posted date: 12/08/2022
Closing date: 13/09/2022
Recruit Genie is a cloud-based HR Management platform used in over 1000+ locations by some of the UK’s biggest brands. In the last few years our prominence has been in the hospitality sector but our client range includes governmental. We understand that the different skills and experiences that our colleagues from different backgrounds bring to us allow us to make better decisions, consider different views and be an altogether more interesting and cohesive place to work.

We are now recruiting for Web Developers to join our existing team.

You will work within our highly skilled development team on a variety of exciting and new projects.

We’re looking for someone who can bring the same enthusiasm and energy into every project and grow their experience and skills through working on projects and collaborating with the development team.

This role is a hybrid remote role where you will be working from home and at our head office in Leeds.

This role is diverse and will mainly require you to work on developing client microsites based on a template driven system and helping when required with new and existing projects. The role will be more front-end focused, but the applicant will need a working understanding of OOP, C#, ASP.NET and MS SQL Server.

Your skill set should include:

Experience of web languages, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery.
Understanding/experience of OOP, C#, ASP.NET and MS SQL Server.
Understanding/experience working with Rest APIs, .NET Core and Web Forms is a bonus.
Passion for coding, designing and an eagerness to learn.
Image editing skills.

The approach you need to bring to the role:

Excellent problem solving and communication skills.
Exhibit a passion for digital excellence.
Ability to work quickly and flexibly, with the mental agility to make good decisions and embed learning.
A natural collaborator who enjoys working with the internal team.
Willing to embrace all aspects of working in a growing business, from strategic thinking to creating processes and training guides.

What will be expected of you?

At first, you will most likely be:

Assisting with project setup – learning processes and how things fit together.
Making amends to existing projects and microsites based on client and internal feedback.
Participating and supporting creating new microsites.
Learning

Eventually, you will be:

Taking ownership of projects from start to finish.
Working closely with the rest of the team to deliver these projects.
Working on a wider variety of projects with a larger scope.
Still learning.

In time, we think you should be:

Writing high-quality code that is understood by others and runs within any performance requirements.
Being solely responsible for delivering the technical parts of a project.
Fixing bugs and sharing what was learned from these occasions.
Liaising with project management team when technical input is required.
Providing technical guidance to the wider team.
Always learning!

What we offer

As well as the usual suspects, including a pension plan and a competitive salary, we also offer:

28 days holiday, plus bank holidays and extra time off for Christmas (including Christmas Eve)
A relaxed working atmosphere at our office in Leeds with great transportation links and free parking.

This is a great opportunity for an enthusiastic and ambitious person to join a team where your ideas and opinion will be valued!

Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00 - £40,000.00 per year

Benefits:

Company events
Company pension

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

Leeds: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Job Introduction

BBC iPlayer is one of the UK’s most well-known and loved brands, and we’re looking for passionate developers to join our collaborative, cross-discipline, agile team. We welcome applications from all, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexuality, social background, religion and/or belief.

It is an exciting time to join the team, as our mission is to be the future of BBC TV. This is a place where your work impacts millions of iPlayer users every day. You will have the opportunity to work on a website that operates at a huge scale.

As a Web Developer, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of technologies that drive our products forward. You will also have the opportunity to work with User Experience Designers, Delivery Managers and Product Managers to influence the future of BBC iPlayer, and make it the indispensable video destination!
Main Responsibilities
Design, develop & release working software using best practices
Pair-program with other team members
Learn new technologies and adapt to change
Promote skills and knowledge sharing
Work in a cross-discipline environment
Understand and contribute to product goals/priorities

Why choose us?
We care a lot about our technology, for example keeping our stack up-to-date, following best practices and industry standards. Our current stack utilises ReactJS, React Router, Redux, Typescript and NodeJS on AWS, and all team members have the opportunity to steer our technical direction.

We also care a lot about the people in our teams. There are great opportunities to grow your career within the team and BBC, and a mentorship programme to make sure you are well-supported. We believe strongly in developing talent from within the team. We have training and conference budgets, and 10% of your time is dedicated for you to explore, innovate and learn new technologies. There are also regular opportunities to collaborate with other teams around the BBC.
We are happy to consider flexible work based on your personal situation, such as part-time, term-time and hybrid working.
Are you the right candidate?

Essential Skills & Experience
Creating engaging and performant UIs (e.g. CSS and animations)
Building modern web applications (we use ReactJS but open to experience with others)
Server-side development (we use NodeJS but open to experience with others)
Learning new software skills and working with new technologies
Being curious, kind and a great team-worker

Desirable Skills & Experience
Developing software with Redux or similar state managers
Developing software with security and accessibility in mind
Developing software using TDD/BDD techniques
Working with Cloud technologies
Working and collaborating in cross-discipline teams

The attached Job Description is a BBC standard Software Engineer Job Description. The relevant details of the role are in the body of this advert.
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

Band: C
Contract type: Permanent
Location: London
We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.

The situation regarding the coronavirus outbreak is developing quickly and the BBC is keen to continue to ensure the safety and wellbeing of people across the BBC, while continuing to protect our services. To reduce the risk access to BBC buildings is limited to those essential to our broadcast output. From Wednesday 18th March until further notice all assessments and interviews will be conducted remotely. For more information go to https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/

I gael mwy o wybodaeth, ewch i https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/ Job Introduction

BBC iPlayer is one of the UK’s most well-known and loved brands, and we’re looking for passionate developers to join our collaborative, cross-discipline, agile team. We welcome applications from all, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexuality, social background, religion and/or belief.

It is an exciting time to join the team, as our mission is to be the future of BBC TV. This is a place where your work impacts millions of iPlayer users every day. You will have the opportunity to work on a website that operates at a huge scale.

As a Web Developer, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of technologies that drive our products forward. You will also have the opportunity to work with User Experience Designers, Delivery Managers and Product Managers to influence the future of BBC iPlayer, and make it the indispensable video destination!
Main Responsibilities
Design, develop & release working software using best practices
Pair-program with other team members
Learn new technologies and adapt to change
Promote skills and knowledge sharing
Work in a cross-discipline environment
Understand and contribute to product goals/priorities

Why choose us?
We care a lot about our technology, for example keeping our stack up-to-date, following best practices and industry standards. Our current stack utilises ReactJS, React Router, Redux, Typescript and NodeJS on AWS, and all team members have the opportunity to steer our technical direction.

We also care a lot about the people in our teams. There are great opportunities to grow your career within the team and BBC, and a mentorship programme to make sure you are well-supported. We believe strongly in developing talent from within the team. We have training and conference budgets, and 10% of your time is dedicated for you to explore, innovate and learn new technologies. There are also regular opportunities to collaborate with other teams around the BBC.
We are happy to consider flexible work based on your personal situation, such as part-time, term-time and hybrid working.
Are you the right candidate?

Essential Skills & Experience
Creating engaging and performant UIs (e.g. CSS and animations)
Building modern web applications (we use ReactJS but open to experience with others)
Server-side development (we use NodeJS but open to experience with others)
Learning new software skills and working with new technologies
Being curious, kind and a great team-worker

Desirable Skills & Experience
Developing software with Redux or similar state managers
Developing software with security and accessibility in mind
Developing software using TDD/BDD techniques
Working with Cloud technologies
Working and collaborating in cross-discipline teams

The attached Job Description is a BBC standard Software Engineer Job Description. The relevant details of the role are in the body of this advert.
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

Band: C
Contract type: Permanent
Location: London
We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.

The situation regarding the coronavirus outbreak is developing quickly and the BBC is keen to continue to ensure the safety and wellbeing of people across the BBC, while continuing to protect our services. To reduce the risk access to BBC buildings is limited to those essential to our broadcast output. From Wednesday 18th March until further notice all assessments and interviews will be conducted remotely. For more information go to https://www.bbc.co.uk/careers/

Enterprise Applications
Location: Egham

Salary: £37,467 per annum - including London Allowance

Post Type: Full Time

Closing Date: 23.59 hours BST on Wednesday 31 August 2022

Reference: 0822-378

Full-Time, Permanent
Applications are invited for the post of Web & Application Developer in the IT Department.
This post will work across both the Student Administrative Systems Team and the Web & Mobile Apps team helping to design and implement elegant and compelling web-based experiences that enable colleagues and students to interact with the University’s digital services.
The post holder will continue their personal development journey at Royal Holloway by assisting with the design of interactive prototypes, participate in the daily scrums and help turn the prototypes into working solutions using a wide range of front-end and back end technologies such as HTML5, Angular JS, Bootstrap, Sass, MS Graph and other vendor / platform specific APIs and workflow solutions.
There are plenty of training opportunities as the post holder will have opportunities to be engaged in developing across the Microsoft Power platform and within a new MS Dynamics implementation. There is access to Microsoft subscriptions, a Pluralsight licence and knowledge from seasoned team members.
In order to be considered for this role, a passion for web and application development is a must have, along with knowledge of programming using a language such as JavaScript, C#, Python or Java.
Prior experience of building websites / applications using HTML5, CSS 3 and JavaScript is essential, either at an academic level or in industry, and whilst education to degree level or equivalent is beneficial, a demonstrable portfolio of projects or completion of industry relevant course would be an acceptable alternative.
Knowledge of Angular JS or a server side language such as ASP.Net or PHP or of the Microsoft Power platform and Graph APIs is desirable but not essential as training can be provided if necessary.
The successful candidate will also possess excellent attention to detail as they will be creating elements for use on the public website and business critical services, they will have clear written and verbal communications skills and will be able to demonstrate a logical approach to problem solving.
In return we offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including generous annual leave and training and development opportunities. The post is based in Egham, Surrey where the College is situated in a beautiful, leafy campus near to Windsor Great Park and within commuting distance from London.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk.
The College is unable to obtain permission to work in the UK for this post. Therefore all applicants must be able to demonstrate their right to work in the UK if they wish to apply.
To view further details of this post and to apply please visit https://jobs.royalholloway.ac.uk. For queries on the application process the Human Resources Department can be contacted by email at: recruitment@rhul.ac.uk

Job Summary

We are looking for a Web and Applications Developer to provide technical expertise and resource to support and develop web services and applications within the University.

As part of this role you will participate in the support of existing services, development of application software using appropriate current technologies and programming languages, as well as providing internal support for third-party applications, as well as receiving and resolving reported faults with the University’s application development and web environment.

You will provide technical expertise and resource to participate directly in the planning and delivery of web/application development and delivery projects, which may be related to expansion, upgrading or rationalisation or associated with developments within the University.

You should hold a First Degree in a relevant subject as well as having significant knowledge and experience of developing applications for the web including an understanding of Object Oriented coding concepts and techniques. A strong understanding of one or more leading web application technologies is also essential.

Salary on first appointment is normally to the bottom of the scale, although in exceptional circumstances an appointment further up the scale may be considered.

The advertised salary includes a market supplement of £7,761 per annum (pro rata). This supplement is reviewed biennially and may be amended or withdrawn in line with agreed University pay policies.

Relocation assistance is available for this role, subject to conditions.

To apply, please submit your CV along with a covering letter detailing your suitability for the post as set out in the person specification.

Interview date: 6 October 2022


Job Description

RESPONSIBLE TO: Web and Applications Team Lead

RESPONSIBLE FOR: No Supervisory Responsibility

PURPOSE OF POST: To provide technical expertise and resource to support and develop web service and applications within the University.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES:

To participate in the development and support in-house and third-party application software using appropriate current technologies.

To maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies and methodologies across the application development lifecycle and how they could be applied within the University environment.

To receive and resolve reported faults with the University’s application development and Web environment.

To work with the Web and Application Team Leader and Senior Web and Applications Developer to contribute to the analysis of reported faults, to contribute to the development of Web and application monitoring procedures and to contribute to the analysis of these systems.

To provide technical expertise and resource to participate directly in the planning and delivery of web/ application development projects, which may be related to expansion, upgrading or rationalisation or associated with developments within the University.

To participate and assist in the definition of detailed technical standards for web / application developments working under the guidance of the Lead Web Applications Developer.

To participate and assist in the definition of a comprehensive set of procedures through which the operating performance and capacity utilisation of the IT Web Infrastructure can be monitored either automatically or by junior technical staff.

To assist the Web & Application Team Leader and Senior Web & Applications Developer in the analysis of the Web / Applications performance measures and to use these measures along with an understanding of technology trends, the University’s IT Strategy and user growth projections to contribute to forward Web / Applications Infrastructure design and planning.

To ensure work is delivered in accordance to the current IT security and quality standards and procedures, and as technical resource to directly contribute to the ongoing development of these standards and procedures.

To ensure that all relevant documentation is maintained to reflect ongoing changes to the University’s development environment.

To share and disseminate information and understanding about different technologies and systems across the web development team, through one-to-one meetings or team workshops.

To act as a mentor to colleagues, developing their technical expertise and understanding.

Ensure that staff work to agreed health and safety systems of work. Carry out risk assessments and audits as required.

Person Specification

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

First Degree or for exceptional candidates, significant working experience and a demonstrable track record will be accepted as an alternative.

Knowledge

Job Description

RESPONSIBLE TO: Web and Applications Team Lead

RESPONSIBLE FOR: No Supervisory Responsibility

PURPOSE OF POST: To provide technical expertise and resource to support and develop web service and applications within the University.

PRINCIPAL DUTIES:

To participate in the development and support in-house and third-party application software using appropriate current technologies.

To maintain an awareness of current and emerging technologies and methodologies across the application development lifecycle and how they could be applied within the University environment.

To receive and resolve reported faults with the University’s application development and Web environment.

To work with the Web and Application Team Leader and Senior Web and Applications Developer to contribute to the analysis of reported faults, to contribute to the development of Web and application monitoring procedures and to contribute to the analysis of these systems.

To provide technical expertise and resource to participate directly in the planning and delivery of web/ application development projects, which may be related to expansion, upgrading or rationalisation or associated with developments within the University.

To participate and assist in the definition of detailed technical standards for web / application developments working under the guidance of the Lead Web Applications Developer.

To participate and assist in the definition of a comprehensive set of procedures through which the operating performance and capacity utilisation of the IT Web Infrastructure can be monitored either automatically or by junior technical staff.

To assist the Web & Application Team Leader and Senior Web & Applications Developer in the analysis of the Web / Applications performance measures and to use these measures along with an understanding of technology trends, the University’s IT Strategy and user growth projections to contribute to forward Web / Applications Infrastructure design and planning.

To ensure work is delivered in accordance to the current IT security and quality standards and procedures, and as technical resource to directly contribute to the ongoing development of these standards and procedures.

To ensure that all relevant documentation is maintained to reflect ongoing changes to the University’s development environment.

To share and disseminate information and understanding about different technologies and systems across the web development team, through one-to-one meetings or team workshops.

To act as a mentor to colleagues, developing their technical expertise and understanding.

Ensure that staff work to agreed health and safety systems of work. Carry out risk assessments and audits as required.

ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

First Degree or for exceptional candidates, significant working experience and a demonstrable track record will be accepted as an alternative.

Knowledge

Strong understanding of PHP and one or more leading web application technologies such as ASP.NET, C# or Coldfusion, and their associated technologies such as HTML, CSS, Javascript and XML, and development frameworks. Good understanding of Object Oriented coding concepts and techniques

Understanding of working in a development team, with Integrated development environments and Source Control systems, such as Subversion (SVN) or GIT.

Demonstration of positive self-motivated attitude towards learning and development.

Experience

Significant knowledge and experience of developing applications for the web, through design to implementation.


DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS

Qualifications and Professional Memberships

Other Professional Qualifications in programming or associated technologies.

Knowledge

Knowledge of the Sharepoint Online would be advantageous.

Familiar with concepts of Agile development methodology, including sprints/iterations, scrums etc.

Familiar with concepts of Unit Testing and Test Driven Development.

An understanding of working with mobile platforms.

Experience

Working experience of Windows Operating Systems. Working experience of Linux Operating Systems.

Experience providing application development and support services in an environment servicing 500+ users.

Experience of mixed server operating systems, including Windows NT/2000/2003/XP, Netware and Unix/Linux.

Experience of working within the context of formally defined and managed implementation projects, working to strict deadlines, deliverables and objectives.

Someone who’s serious about front-end technologies but also has a keen eye for good design and really cares about how the things they make end up looking on screen.We like to challenge ourselves, so we’re looking for someone who’s really open to testing out new technologies when the opportunity presents itself.The stuff we’re expecting: You can write semantic, accessible HTML and modular, scalable CSS. Semantic are a leading digital agency for attractions, theme parks and zoos. We're looking to grow our team to help deliver awesome new websites and site roll outs for a variety of attraction clients in the UK and worldwide.As a Front End Developer at Semantic you will be responsible for bringing designs to life online... focusing on building high-performance, best-practice modules, websites, pages, templates and features for new and existing clients, as part of our growing development team.You’ll work closely with other Semantians to ensure smooth delivery on all work we undertake, according to deadlines and budgets. You’ll have the satisfaction of helping clients achieve great results, creatively solving problems and helping them over many months and years to come.You’ll need to be a great problem solver, with strategic approach to solving clients' online challenges. We need someone the whole team can rely on to deliver exception designs, templates and features that engage users online and delight our clients. You will have the confidence and experience to make quick decisions, ensuring that the team is kept informed on task progress across teams and clients.You will work with the Account/Project Managers to ensure clients are happy and work is exceeding their expectations. Given this could be a fully remote role, we’d be looking for someone that’s super organised, energetic, proactive and able to keep on top of a variety of tasks/priorities simultaneously.Ideally you will have a several years’ of Frontend/UX experience under your belt, either in an agency or inhouse role with a some understanding of digital, websites and marketing – attitude will take preference over experience.This is a great opportunity to join a growing agency on an exciting journey as we look to transform how attractions take advantage on online tools and systems. Introduction
Our client is one of the Defence and Aerospace companies in the world and they are looking for Principal Software Engineering with a background in developing applications (web based ideally).

They work within a behavioural driven environment and create GIS/mapping web applications for the MOD.

Technology wise they are looking for candidates who have worked on the Java stack, but can be very flexible across other technologies.

You will be expected to travel to the office in Wiltshire a couple of times per month so you will need to be near enough to this location! The rest of the work can be done remotely.
Key responsibilities
Development of Java software for web applications
Working with test teams on test driven development
Skills & experience
This role is working in a SAFE/Agile environment so an understanding of this is imperative.

Key Technologies (but the client can be very flexible):

Java 8/11
Spring and its sub-projects
Hibernate (or other ORM framework)
JUnit (or other Unit Testing framework)
Web Services, particularly REST, and JSON
Apache/Adobe Flex and/or Google Web Toolkit (or Java Swing, AWT, Java FX, or other UI framework, AJAX, or modern JavaScript framework)
JBoss (or other Application Server)
Windows platforms (Oracle or SQL Server)

Techniques, Concepts or Methodologies:

Scrum and/or Kanban (or other Agile frameworks)
TDD
OO Design and UML
Enterprise Service Bus
Continuous Integration (and, optimally, Continuous Deployment)
DevOps (including DevSecOps, or other Dev*Ops variant)
Mapping, Geolocation, Symbology and Geographic Information Systems

You will be required to hold a minimum of SC or Willing to Undergo. If you do not hold an active SC or Willing to Undergo please familiarise yourself with the vetting process before applying.
Additional benefits
25 days holiday + statutory holidays
37 hour week
Hybrid working model
Contributory Pension Scheme
Life Assurance
Flexible Benefits
Enhanced sick pay scheme Introduction

Tech-For-Good/ Web Developer/ Full Stack Developer/ Health Tech

I am looking for a Junior/ Mid-level Web Developer with experience in Vue.JS and or React.JS, to join a Tech-for-good start up. You will be working on a prototype healthcare platform, helping to bring it into the market. You will be responsible for design improvements on the platform and creating new interactive features. You will be given opportunities to influence the company’s direction and the platform being developed. As an early stage start up you will be able to grow within the company and take on new responsibilities as the company grows and blossoms.

Skills Required:
2+ years commercial experience

Vue and/or React

Git

Software development lifecycle

Desirable:
Experience with patient-facing products in the healthcare settings

Knowledge of cloud environment – AWS

Experience with video/audio live communications

If you have any questions or would like to apply for the role, please contact me on 0161 388 2635.

Salary: £25-45k

Junior/Mid-Level Web Developer

For more information about Shift F5 and the opportunities we have to offer follow us on Twitter @F5_Jobs

Our mission is great open source

It is our mission to make open source software available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of people every day.

The web team works in a multi-disciplinary environment with visual designers, UX designers and other developers to bring exciting new web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and constantly strive to improve both our work and our processes.

Required skills and experience
Demonstrable experience of work on modern web applications
A strong understanding of HTML, CSS with SCSS and JavaScript
Experience with Javascript components libraries
Experience with TypeScript
Experience with responsive user interfaces for a wide range of devices and browsers
Experience with Git or other version control systems
Awareness of SEO best practice
Consideration of accessibility in all aspects of your work
A strong understanding of web performance in complex user interfaces
Ability to interact with UX, designers and server-side developers
Curiosity about technology and a thirst to learn
Based in EMEA timezones (Europe, the Middle East and Africa)
University degree or equivalent education
Useful experience if you have it
Familiarity with Linux desktop technologies
Server-side languages, such as Python or NodeJS
Experience working on a large scale React (with TypeScript) project
A history of open source contributions
Relevant work experience
Who you are

We want a Web Developer who loves what they do. You are passionate about web standards and keep abreast of new developments in our industry. You always look for opportunities to improve your skills. You like to show off what you're working on and also learn from others. You have strong attention to detail and value the design of a product as much as you value the code. You have strong communication skills and maybe even blog once in a while. You're aware of the latest CSS techniques but also know the limitations that developing for a broad audience can bring - actually, you embrace the challenge.

In this team
You'll create high fidelity websites and web apps using the latest incarnations of HTML, CSS (SCSS) and Javascript (React and TypeScript)
You'll help maintain existing projects including updating content and adding new pages
You'll manage incoming requests for updates and liaise with or delegate to other people as necessary
You'll ensure the standard of our output remains high and consistent across our whole product portfolio
You'll ensure new pages are published according to specification and in compliance with our web style guide
You'll participate in and contribute to our living style guide, Vanilla Framework.
Work closely with UX designers and visual designers to implement exemplary user experiences.
What we offer
An opportunity to help shape a company and products with a strong influence in the open source community
An inclusive work environment within a team of friendly people with a broad range of skill sets, from UX designers to copywriters
Learning and development
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual leave
Priority Pass for travel

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.
