About The Role
We are recruiting for PHP Developers to join our expanding IT department- from entry level developers to those leading several teams. Our PHP developers contribute to improvements, new features and maintenance of our Symfony 4/5 based web applications.

Working as a member of our agile development team, new features are written using Object Oriented (OO) PHP, MySQL, HTML5 and JavaScript in an environment that encourages learning and the advancement of your technical skills as a developer.

There will be genuine opportunities to progress your career. We’re constantly investing in growing our business, including big plans to add more showrooms across the UK plus other global locations! The opportunities within our Technical Hub are huge. We have a clear progression path for you to strive towards increasing your salary accordingly.

As a PHP Developer you have the opportunity to be based remotely or work from our state-of-the-art Head Offices in Barton Upon Humber.

Main responsibilities:

Build and maintain Wren’s custom built, cutting edge applications (Symfony 4/5 based)
Write clean code that is clear and understandable by others
Contribute to project estimations
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle
Work with senior developers and business stakeholders to understand the initial scope for a new project
In addition to any other duties, as a responsible person you must ensure that you have read, understood and adhere to polices and procedurerelating to Health and Safety, and your responsibilities located in the Integrated Management System (IMS) Responsibilities document.


What Wren offer:
Flexible hybrid or remote working options, with the latest equipment provided
Personalised progression plan with clear career opportunities
Individual training budget for personal development
Employee assistance programme
Regular social events
Staff discount on purchasing a kitchen after 1 year of continuous employment!
Free annual eye tests as well as a contribution to new glasses
Refer a Friend Scheme with the chance to earn up to £1500 for each referral
Quarterly bonus scheme
Free access to our onsite gym
Subsidised meals in our two fantastic restaurants
Free onsite parking
About You
Essential skills and knowledge:

At least 2 years’ experience in creating and maintaining object oriented PHP7 based systems
An understanding of the MVC approach to development
Experience of working with MySQL (We use v8 currently)
Demonstrable knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Ajax
Experience of using version control systems (such as Git) as part of a team
Beneficial skills and knowledge:

A working knowledge of the Symfony (or equivalent) framework
A working knowledge of the Doctrine ORM
Experience in creating and maintaining RESTFul APIs
Experience of automated testing (e.g. PHPUnit, Selenium, Behat)
Knowledge of design patterns, with practical experience of implementing them
Experience of agile project methodologies (and its impact on iterative design)
Experience of working in a continuous integration environment
Familiar with Linux or Mac OS
About The Company
Wren Kitchens are not only passionate about kitchens, we are passionate about our people! We have achieved incredible milestones over the years; opening over 100 showrooms, launching in the USA, and winning multiple awards including the UK’s Number 1 place to work!

This is thanks to our team, the Wren family, who have inspired us to push limits and make a difference. With our exponential growth, we are looking for incredible individuals to join us and continue our success story!. About The Role
We are recruiting for PHP Developers to join our expanding IT department- from entry level developers to those leading several teams. Our PHP developers contribute to improvements, new features and maintenance of our Symfony 4/5 based web applications.

Working as a member of our agile development team, new features are written using Object Oriented (OO) PHP, MySQL, HTML5 and JavaScript in an environment that encourages learning and the advancement of your technical skills as a developer.

There will be genuine opportunities to progress your career. We’re constantly investing in growing our business, including big plans to add more showrooms across the UK plus other global locations! The opportunities within our Technical Hub are huge. We have a clear progression path for you to strive towards increasing your salary accordingly.

As a PHP Developer you have the opportunity to be based remotely or work from our state-of-the-art Head Offices in Barton Upon Humber.

Main responsibilities:

Build and maintain Wren’s custom built, cutting edge applications (Symfony 4/5 based)
Write clean code that is clear and understandable by others
Contribute to project estimations
Contribute to all phases of the development lifecycle
Work with senior developers and business stakeholders to understand the initial scope for a new project
In addition to any other duties, as a responsible person you must ensure that you have read, understood and adhere to polices and procedurerelating to Health and Safety, and your responsibilities located in the Integrated Management System (IMS) Responsibilities document.


What Wren offer:
Flexible hybrid or remote working options, with the latest equipment provided
Personalised progression plan with clear career opportunities
Individual training budget for personal development
Employee assistance programme
Regular social events
Staff discount on purchasing a kitchen after 1 year of continuous employment!
Free annual eye tests as well as a contribution to new glasses
Refer a Friend Scheme with the chance to earn up to £1500 for each referral
Quarterly bonus scheme
Free access to our onsite gym
Subsidised meals in our two fantastic restaurants
Free onsite parking
About You
Essential skills and knowledge:

At least 2 years’ experience in creating and maintaining object oriented PHP7 based systems
An understanding of the MVC approach to development
Experience of working with MySQL (We use v8 currently)
Demonstrable knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Ajax
Experience of using version control systems (such as Git) as part of a team
Beneficial skills and knowledge:

A working knowledge of the Symfony (or equivalent) framework
A working knowledge of the Doctrine ORM
Experience in creating and maintaining RESTFul APIs
Experience of automated testing (e.g. PHPUnit, Selenium, Behat)
Knowledge of design patterns, with practical experience of implementing them
Experience of agile project methodologies (and its impact on iterative design)
Experience of working in a continuous integration environment
Familiar with Linux or Mac OS

job_title: Full Stack Developer London /UK Remote £60K to £85K
listing_jobDesc:
We are helping one of the UK’s brightest Tech companies whose aim is to become the leaders in the next era of data-driven high performance software and as a result need to hire a Full Stack Developer to join their team in London.

The remote working policy is flexible to suit you.

To be a successful Full Stack Developer, the ideal candidate will have
Good PHP (Symfony, Laravel)
Typescript/React
Strong experience with MySQL
Experience with AWS is a bonus
Confident communication skills
What is in it for you?
Great salary
Flexible working
Your choice of equipment

Please apply with your CV and we will be in touch for a confidential chat.

listing_jobDesc: UI Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, c £ 28- 32000 + benefits. Slough, Berkshire.Market leading technology company based in Slough, Berkshire are looking for a number of Frontend Developer to join their growing UI/UX Development team. You will be joining a small but growing team, focused on delivering solutions.This role will be accountable for skilfully producing software for the migration of the existing In-house application UI to a new modernised UI running under bootstrap as the primary framework. This is an excellent opportunity to get involved in developing complex systems and enhancing your skills in a fast-paced environment.Duties and responsibilities -Work with the UI/UX designer to ensure changes are implemented in accordance with the provided style guideWhere elements of the UI do not fit, within the UI style guide, work with the UI/UX designer to find solutionsCommunicate and work optimally within internal teams to ensure clear communication of technical issuesProactively investigate, potentially present options for implementing solutions and bug fixes in cooperation with development management and other internal teamsTake ownership and responsibility of components and processes within the team to make tactical and strategic changesExperience required -2+ years of development experienceFluency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, with a willingness to pick up and learn new languages and technologies as neededA full appreciation of configuration management & issue tracking management issues and systemsAptitude for UX / UI Design and an eye for detailA solid understanding of browser capabilitiesAny of the following is an advantage -Experience of Bootstrap, Foundation and/or other responsive frameworks.Systems integrationProgramming experience in .net using VB or C#Working knowledge of Cloud deployments, AWS, etc.Appreciation or experience in software or systems testingMobile/Tablet developmentThis is a great chance to join a growing company and work on a range of new and exciting projects. The short versionWhat we are looking for…A bright, curious and ambitious developer with solid experience of Shopify and a willingness to dive to deep in the world of eCommerce SEO.What we can offer…A 4-day week with no reduction in payOptional remote workProfit share available after 6 monthsA people-first company cultureDedicated engagement/wellbeing supportTime and space to focus on delivering great workSubsidised/free healthcare benefits through HealthshieldRegular (voluntary) events, online and in-personReal opportunities for career growth and developmentThe long versionWe have an opportunity for a Senior Web Developer to join our team, either remotely or based at our Norwich office. We’re open to hybrid or flexible working too – the important thing for us is to find the right person, no matter where they may be based.This is a fantastic opportunity to join a fast-growing company with a role that offers real flexibility and potential. We have an excellent record in developing our team, and our goal has always been to make Blink the best place to work that we can. Some more details on what this involves can be seen in the section below.The majority of our projects are based on Shopify, but we also work with other platforms such as WordPress/WooCommerce. Much of our work is around implementation of work to support the SEO team rather than site builds, so this position will suit someone that thrives on problem solving and analysis and has the willingness to continually learn in a field that is continually evolving.The successful applicant will have most or all of the following:Proven working experience with LiquidIn-depth knowledge of modern HTML/CSSA thorough grasp of Javascript (ideally in relation to SEO)Experience with PHP/WordpressSolid understanding of general SEO principles and the web-design process.Problem-solving skills, debugging and cross-browser testingIn addition, they will be hard working, curious, have a positive attitude, and be keen to help other members of the team.Working at BlinkBlink is an eCommerce-focused SEO agency that was founded in 2011. We are small but extremely ambitious, and we have delivered successful projects for a wide range of clients. There are also a few important benefits to joining us:- We are very proud of our company culture. We put our people first, and we’ve invested a lot of effort and resources into making Blink the best possible place to work. As a result we’ve been rewarded with a team that are positive, welcoming and share our vision for the business.- We were one of the first agencies in the UK to implement a 4-day week. Our hours are Monday to Thursday, 9-5.30pm, and home and flexible working options are always available.- To find out more about what it’s like to be a part of our team, see our Glassdoor page - https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Blink-SEO-Reviews-E3314924.htm- Remote working is an option. Being based within reach of our Norwich office would be an advantage, but we are open to remote applicants from across the UK.- Overall our team is largely remote. There are some advantages to office working (such of ease of communication, team building etc) , so to counter this we have a dedicated engagement manager. This involves working closely to make sure everyone has the support they need and feel part of the team.- We hold regular events, both online and person. Some example include a regular book club, boat trips, laser tag and the usual dinner and drinks. All are completely voluntary and there is no pressure to attend.- Wellbeing is very important to us. This is not just a loose idea or phrase that we use when we feel like it. It is essential to both our identity and our longer term goals as we grow.- Careful management of workload. We understand agencies can be fast-moving, but we are dedicated to making sure our team have the time and space to work without unnecessary pressure and distraction. You can read more on this here - https://www.blinkseo.co.uk/blog/why-were-limiting-our-online-hours/.- We run a profit share scheme. After six months of employment, you will be eligible for a monthly bonus. This is not performance related – instead, we want everybody to share in the rewards of the business as a whole.- Our team all have access to various subsidised and free healthcare benefits through Healthshield.- We pay careful attention to career growth and development. We hold fortnightly training sessions with industry experts that help us stay on top of emerging trends and build skills throughout the team, while feedback and collaboration is a constant part of our daily routine.- Our office is located in the city centre, and has a breakout space with table tennis, standing desks and showers and other various amenities.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: Up to £45,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus schemeBenefits:Additional leaveCompany pensionCycle to work schemeFlexible scheduleFlexitimeProfit sharingSick payWellness programmesWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shift The short versionWhat we are looking for…A bright, curious and ambitious developer with solid experience of Shopify and a willingness to dive to deep in the world of eCommerce SEO.What we can offer…A 4-day week with no reduction in payOptional remote workProfit share available after 6 monthsA people-first company cultureDedicated engagement/wellbeing supportTime and space to focus on delivering great workSubsidised/free healthcare benefits through HealthshieldRegular (voluntary) events, online and in-personReal opportunities for career growth and developmentThe long versionWe have an opportunity for a Senior Web Developer to join our team, either remotely or based at our Norwich office. We put our people first, and we’ve invested a lot of effort and resources into making Blink the best possible place to work. Our hours are Monday to Thursday, 9-5.30pm, and home and flexible working options are always available.- To find out more about what it’s like to be a part of our team, see our Glassdoor page - https://www.glassdoor.co.uk/Reviews/Blink-SEO-Reviews-E3314924.htm- Remote working is an option. Front-end Developer
Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.
Join us and you’ll have an opportunity to make an impact. To empower projects that deliver real-world benefits across Britain and internationally. To hear our customers say they couldn’t have done it without us. And to be central to OS’s vision: to be recognised as world leaders in geospatial services; creating location insight for positive impact.
About the role
As our projects continue to grow, we are looking for talented Front-end Developers to join our thriving team. You’ll collaboratively work within an Agile delivery methodology, to deliver customer solutions at pace and to high standards.
You will be encouraged to write code using best practices, to ensure it is clean and testable. As well as, work to ensure software is secure and well tested to optimise delivery; whilst liaising with stakeholders daily.
A varied role, where you will work on delivering customer requirements, debugging and testing applications. With a strong background in JavaScript programming, you will encompass a wide variety of technologies and frameworks such as: JavaScript (React), HTML, CSS and it would be desirable to have skills in Node.JS and exposure to Azure infrastructure.
We are keen to also invest in you, as such we encourage development and training to allow you to grow within your role. In addition, there are paths for development opportunities within the business as your expertise flourish.
What we’re looking for
If you’re interested in joining a team that lies at the heart of what OS is about, we’re looking for someone that can demonstrate skills and experience in:
Experience in JavaScript (React), HTML, CSS.
Experience in developing semantic, accessible
Track record in problem resolution, selection of technical solutions and applications
Experience of providing fully capable software development and configuration in your area of expertise.
Proven track record of delivering Front-end applications using JavaScript.
Knowledge of modern engineering best practice like TDD, BDD and Automated Testing
Proven track record in iterative and incremental development
Qualified to relevant development certification (or equivalent)
Experience in Redux, Node.JS and Azure infrastructure is desirable.
The rewards
We want you to love what you do. That is why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:
Salary: £36,414 - £42,840
Performance related bonus
A competitive pension scheme
37 hour working week (with flexible working options)
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Plus, a suite of excellent additional benefits
Location
We embrace a hybrid working model at OS and understand there is no one size fits all in relation to how we work. We have a fantastic HQ in Southampton, Hampshire where you will be required to spend 1 day a month with the remaining time being a personal choice as to whether you work from home, one of our regional offices or spend more time at OSHQ.
Ordnance Survey is also able to consider offering fully remote contracts in the appropriate circumstances.
Closing date: Sunday 28th August 2022
Due to growth within the organisation, we are looking to hire Engineers throughout the year, so please apply today.
We believe diversity and inclusion is about working together – in a supportive and respectful environment to reach our full potential. We think combining different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives will help us reach our vision and be trusted and admired across the globe for setting the standards and leading the way. We are looking for talented and experienced individuals from a range of backgrounds and welcome applications from any race, age, gender, background or religion.
We’re individually talented and collectively powerful and we give you the space to take your career in whichever direction you want. Front-end Developer

Experience of providing fully capable software development and configuration in your area of expertise.
Proven track record of delivering Front-end applications using JavaScript.
Knowledge of modern engineering best practice like TDD, BDD and Automated Testing
Proven track record in iterative and incremental development
Qualified to relevant development certification (or equivalent)
Experience in Redux, Node.JS and Azure infrastructure is desirable.
The rewards
We want you to love what you do. That is why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:
Salary: £36,414 - £42,840
Performance related bonus
A competitive pension scheme
37 hour working week (with flexible working options)
25 days annual leave - (30 days after five years) bank holidays and an extra 3 over Christmas
Plus, a suite of excellent additional benefits
Location
We embrace a hybrid working model at OS and understand there is no one size fits all in relation to how we work. We have a fantastic HQ in Southampton, Hampshire where you will be required to spend 1 day a month with the remaining time being a personal choice as to whether you work from home, one of our regional offices or spend more time at OSHQ.
Ordnance Survey is also able to consider offering fully remote contracts in the appropriate circumstances.
Closing date: Sunday 28th August 2022
Due to growth within the organisation, we are looking to hire Engineers throughout the year, so please apply today.
We believe diversity and inclusion is about working together – in a supportive and respectful environment to reach our full potential. We think combining different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives will help us reach our vision and be trusted and admired across the globe for setting the standards and leading the way. We are looking for talented and experienced individuals from a range of backgrounds and welcome applications from any race, age, gender, background or religion.
We’re individually talented and collectively powerful and we give you the space to take your career in whichever direction you want. Front-end Developer
Our growing Technology and Design team plays a key role in ensuring OS is at the cutting edge of geospatial capability and is looking for people to join them. Its mission is to work across the business to provide customer centric design and technology services.
Join us and you’ll have an opportunity to make an impact. To empower projects that deliver real-world benefits across Britain and internationally. To hear our customers say they couldn’t have done it without us. And to be central to OS’s vision: to be recognised as world leaders in geospatial services; creating location insight for positive impact.
About the role
As our projects continue to grow, we are looking for talented Front-end Developers to join our thriving team. You’ll collaboratively work within an Agile delivery methodology, to deliver customer solutions at pace and to high standards.
You will be encouraged to write code using best practices, to ensure it is clean and testable. As well as, work to ensure software is secure and well tested to optimise delivery; whilst liaising with stakeholders daily.
A varied role, where you will work on delivering customer requirements, debugging and testing applications. With a strong background in JavaScript programming, you will encompass a wide variety of technologies and frameworks such as: JavaScript (React), HTML, CSS and it would be desirable to have skills in Node.JS and exposure to Azure infrastructure.
We are keen to also invest in you, as such we encourage development and training to allow you to grow within your role. In addition, there are paths for development opportunities within the business as your expertise flourish.
What we’re looking for

Experience in JavaScript (React), HTML, CSS.
Experience in developing semantic, accessible
Track record in problem resolution, selection of technical solutions and applications
Experience of providing fully capable software development and configuration in your area of expertise.
Proven track record of delivering Front-end applications using JavaScript.
Knowledge of modern engineering best practice like TDD, BDD and Automated Testing
Proven track record in iterative and incremental development
Qualified to relevant development certification (or equivalent)
Experience in Redux, Node.JS and Azure infrastructure is desirable.
The rewards
We want you to love what you do. That is why our benefits package rewards a job well done. We’ll give you:

Front-End Developer
Salary up to £45,000

Are you an enthusiastic Front-End Developer, who is passionate about all things web and new technology?

It's an exciting time to join our Digital Platform Team! We're building innovative ways to engage with new and existing customers, on a portfolio of products that reach out to 17 million customers globally. The digital team sits at the forefront of delivering our strategy, they create not only brand-new experiences, but also make small changes to continually evolve existing products and to enhance code quality against our core development principles.

A bit about the job:
As a Front-End Developer, you will be involved with translating creative visions into beautiful implementations, whilst working within a highly skilled team to produce the best solutions possible. You'll need to be an expert in HTML, CSS and JavaScript, as well as having experience with producing accessible and responsive layouts and a strong appreciation of core software engineering principles.

Skills and experience we're looking for:

Excellent understanding and experience of both HTML5 and CSS2 and their interpretation by various modern and legacy web browsers

Solid understanding of JavaScript and associated common libraries (High charts knowledge would be beneficial)

A good level of understanding of source control tools, preferably Git

Excellent communication, negotiation and influencing skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team within an Agile setting

What you'll get for this role:

Salary up to £45,000 (depending on location, skills, experience, and qualifications)

Generous pension (starting level Aviva contributes 8% when you contribute 2%)

Eligibility for annual performance bonus

Family friendly parental and carer's leave

29 days holiday per year plus bank holidays and the option to buy/sell up to 5 additional days

Up to 40% discount for Aviva products

Brilliant flexible benefits including electric cars

Aviva Matching Share Plan and Save As You Earn scheme

21 volunteering hours per year

Aviva is for everyone:

We are inclusive - we want applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences.

Excited but not sure you tick every box? Research tells us that women, particularly, feel this way. So, regardless of gender, why not apply. And if you're in a job share just apply as a pair. We flex locations, hours and working patterns to suit our customers, business, and you.

Most of our people are smart working - spending around 60% of their time in our offices and 40% at home.

To find out more about working at Aviva take a look here

We interview every disabled applicant who meets the minimum criteria for the job. Once you've applied, please send us an email stating that you have a disclosed disability, and we'll interview you.

We'd love it if you could submit your application online. If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Lacey Lane Mckoy a call on 07385425912 or send an email to lacey.lane-mckoy@aviva.com Front-End Developer

Do you want to work for one of the fastest growing e-commerce brands in the UK? They are about to go global and have already expanded into a number of countries outside the UK.

With a turnover of over £20,000,000 these guys are already taking the market by storm and are rapidly becoming one of the most successful e-commerce companies in their particular sector.

They are now looking to hire an additional VueJS Front end Developer as they look to scale and ensure their technical product develops at the same pace as their growth.

You will be working on a customer focused e-commerce front end based subscription product where the user experience is at the heart of the system using VueJS, HTML, CSS (LESS/SASS)

More generally (primarily on the backend) they are redeveloping / redesigning a monolithic product into a more microservices based system and ensuring their technical offering is future-proofed and de-risked.

Coding in VueJS and CSS the Front end Developer will be joining an existing engineering team of 6 working alongside other backend PHP engineers and their other front end developers (VueJS). You will work closely with their senior devs and Software Engineering Manager / Scrum Master as well a their CTO who remains close to the code.

The company have won numerous awards for their product and have a collaborative and creative culture who welcome growth and learning in all their employees whilst putting the customer experience at the heart of everything they do.

they are now really looking to scale and also diversify their product offering so this is a chance to join a "non-risky" startup who have a tried, tested and established product before they really explode.

Key Skills:
VueJS

HTML / Javascript / CSS

LESS / SASS

API Development

Prototype Framework experience (Bootstrap, Foundation etc)

Nice to Have:
Expereince developing SaaS solutions

AWS

Ecommerce Experience

CMS Experience

Location: South West London
Salary: Up to £50,000
Benefits: All the usual (pension etc) plus some you wouldn't have expected!
If this VueJS Front End Developer role sounds of interest please submit your CV via the link and we will be in touch to arrange a call

Benefits:

Work from home opportunities
Flexible working hours Do you want to work for one of the fastest growing e-commerce brands in the UK? They are about to go global and have already expanded into a number of countries outside the UK.

With a turnover of over £20,000,000 these guys are already taking the market by storm and are rapidly becoming one of the most successful e-commerce companies in their particular sector.

They are now looking to hire an additional VueJS Front end Developer as they look to scale and ensure their technical product develops at the same pace as their growth.

You will be working on a customer focused e-commerce front end based subscription product where the user experience is at the heart of the system using VueJS, HTML, CSS (LESS/SASS)

More generally (primarily on the backend) they are redeveloping / redesigning a monolithic product into a more microservices based system and ensuring their technical offering is future-proofed and de-risked.

Coding in VueJS and CSS the Front end Developer will be joining an existing engineering team of 6 working alongside other backend PHP engineers and their other front end developers (VueJS). You will work closely with their senior devs and Software Engineering Manager / Scrum Master as well a their CTO who remains close to the code.

The company have won numerous awards for their product and have a collaborative and creative culture who welcome growth and learning in all their employees whilst putting the customer experience at the heart of everything they do.

they are now really looking to scale and also diversify their product offering so this is a chance to join a "non-risky" startup who have a tried, tested and established product before they really explode.

Key Skills:
VueJS

HTML / Javascript / CSS

LESS / SASS

API Development

Prototype Framework experience (Bootstrap, Foundation etc)

Nice to Have:
Expereince developing SaaS solutions

AWS

Ecommerce Experience

CMS Experience

Location: South West London
Salary: Up to £50,000
Benefits: All the usual (pension etc) plus some you wouldn't have expected!

About the Role
In this role, you’ll join our ever-growing development team at The Verve Group and have the opportunity to be hands-on with the industry-changing technology that we build, learn the processes of working in an agile team and help us make change through FinTech.
For this role, join our growing development team as a junior web developer and immediately get the chance to see our processes and play a part in building the web-based technology that our clients use every single day. We’ll support you every step of the way (supporting students is our bread and butter after all) with mentoring from other team members and your own tailored training and progression plan.
We put a huge importance on ‘making a difference’ and each of us likes to make that difference, in a different way. In your role, you’ll work closely with each member of the team to see our work and process in action and our ideas come to life – it’s here’s where you’ll find areas that interest you the most and begin to shape your own career. It could be testing, API development or working as a full-stack developer – so, why don’t we find out?
As your role develops, you have the opportunity to take a more active role in developing our applications and take the lead for features and planning how to best deliver them, working with external teams and partners to keep us at the very front of FinTech.
The Skills
Along with a tech related degree, you'll need an understanding of a programming language like php and javascript, a passion for building technology that makes a difference and the ability to work as part of a fast-moving team.
About Us
The Verve Group is combined of a number of companies, including Para-Sols (an outsourced paraplanning company), Apricity Compliance (providing compliance support to advisers), The Art of Finance (which provides training courses for those looking to develop a career in financial services) and finally, The Verve Foundation (a not-for-profit that invests in the future of finance). The Group of companies all work towards the same two missions; to help support good quality financial advice firms to grow and develop, and to attract new people into financial services and help train them up, for the good of the future of finance.
Across all companies, we approach financial services with a fun and positive outlook and offer a range of benefits to permanent employees to ensure our staff feel supported and motivated. We reward loyalty and offer enhanced benefits to long-service employees, but as standard (once you’ve successfully completed your 6 month probation) these include…
Standard benefits
26 days holiday (including days off at Christmas) PLUS bank holidays AND your birthday off (if it falls on a weekday)
Personalised salary structure to reflect your own effort and contribution
Death in Service cover
Personal Development budget (for exams, training, anything to help you excel!)
Company Pension Scheme
Optional working from home policy, 2 days per week (on completion of probation)
What makes us different benefits
Health and Wellbeing programme, including hoodie, drinks bottle and fitness tracker
Office snacks and refreshments
Open plan ‘living office’ environment – including rocking (or sometimes dubious) playlists, beer/wine fridge, breakout lounge and breakfast club
2 official annual company parties, plus ad hoc team nights out.
Office dogs – we’re not a place for people scared of dogs!
Did we mention there’s no lock on the beer/wine fridge?!
The Money
A starting salary of £20,000, increasing as your training develops, with £45,000+ for senior roles. About the Role

ABOUT JOURNEYJourney is a team of digital specialists based in Auckland, London, India and the Philippines.We create transformational digital experiences that build loyalty, drive sales, and deliver insight. Through a blend of consulting, design and development, we provide clients with strategic digital products, platforms, bespoke software, mobile apps and enterprise websites.We love what we do, and we do it well. We’ve won many awards for our work over the last few years and have expanded internationally, too – with a studio opening in London to support our clients in EMEA.We look after each other and have fun together. Our goal is to make Journey the place where you can do the best work of your career and enjoy yourself at the same time.OUR VALUESKnow the why.Be a radiator.Be prepared.Never settle.ABOUT THE ROLEAs a critical member of our team you’ll apply your impressive front-end skills to develop and deliver solutions for a variety of online projects. You’ll work directly with some great local and international companies as an architect, engineer and builder of tools that enable our clients to change and grow.Level: Experienced intermediate to senior.Ideal start date: Mid-September to early October.WHAT YOU’LL BE DOINGWeb-based and React Native development. The React Native work will be supporting an existing code base.Project planning.Software design and architecture.Writing clean, maintainable code based on SOLID principles.Reviewing pull requests.Bug fixing and support work.Testing your own work.Involvement in process improvement.Liaising with the design and development teams to ensure understanding of the initial feature requirements.Reviewing new features and improvements against their original requirements, including having an awareness of the interconnectedness of different functions within the product, and testing other relevant and related functions.Being able to lead technical solutions using your extensive experience and identifying opportunities for improvement.YOU WILLYou need to be a highly-motivated, organised and passionate person with a keen eye for detail.You’ll be willing to tackle demanding tasks and take responsibility for actions, using your initiative to make suggestions and work to make things happen.You have a curious and driven nature, always wanting to keep up-to-date with coding and technological trends.You’ll have a strong desire to learn and to share your knowledge with your team. In addition, you’ll be flexible enough to adapt your approach to different team members, helping to motivate and inspire with a positive attitude.You must excel at managing delivery, with a keen ability to define team and project objectives including expectations and deadlines and monitor the progress of your projects against targets.You will use your strong oral and written communication skills to build rapport with internal and external stakeholders on your projects. You will be a good listener, but also highly-persuasive, using facts, clear arguments and personal conviction to influence and persuade others.Essential skills and experience: JavaScript, HTML, SCSS and CSS.Experience in at least one front-end framework: React, Vue or similar.Experience with React Native and XCode.Managing multiple projects in a fast-paced, time-sensitive, results-oriented, web/mobile-based development environment and an understanding of what's required to get the job done.The entire lifecycle of digital development from Information Architecture to prototyping, to user testing to internal testing and bug-fixing.Ideal skills and experience: Complex front-end development.Experience in integrating with ASP.NET.Writing and executing unit and integration testing.OO design patterns and SOLID design principles.Software design and architecture.Jira/Confluence.Webpack.BENEFITSCompetitive salary.25 days’ holiday per year.Pension, with 3% contribution.Flexible working.Regular team socials and activities.A highly-supportive, people-oriented culture and working environment.Being an early part of Journey’s growth journey in EMEA.APPLY FOR THIS ROLETo apply you can visit jobs.journey-digital.com. You can also apply here on Indeed. We will then send you a link to complete a comprehensive online Journey Job Application Form, at which point you will be able to upload your CV and cover letter.Short-listed candidates will be asked to sit a coding test as the first stage in the interview process.If you have any questions, please contact Sarah Ritchie, People & Culture Manager, (jobs at journey-digital.com).For this role we can only accept applicants who have the legal right to live and work in the UK._______________________________ Journey-Digital.comDigital that elevates your customer journeyJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: £50,000.00-£60,000.00 per yearBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday ABOUT JOURNEYJourney is a team of digital specialists based in Auckland, London, India and the Philippines.We create transformational digital experiences that build loyalty, drive sales, and deliver insight. Want to do the best work of your life? Make your mark at Europe’s leading entertainment brand. Our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be yourself and let your skills shine.
Team Overview:
Our Global OTT team develops and supports technologies for Sky, globally. No matter the device, the time or the place, we make sure that engaging large, diverse audiences with premium entertainment is possible. Our vision is to deliver the world’s best entertainment.
“Our work relies on building and maintaining the strongest relationships with other delivery teams across Sky and Sky’s partners. Collaboration and continuous improvement are at the heart of what we do. We’re looking forward to welcoming more talented people in our team” – Senior Scrum Master
What you'll do:
Create extremely well-crafted front-end web applications using React.js and Redux
Write resilient code that will be continuously tested, deployed and performed at scale
Be part of a self-organising and cross functional Agile team
Be a leader within the team, actively improving overall software quality whilst also helping fellow team members
Contribute to the team’s technical direction and the improvement of its tools and processes
Be responsible for ensuring our website is highly performant, resilient, secure and monitored in production
What you'll bring:
Solid commercial experience in JavaScript (React) development
Good understanding of development best practices such as pair programming, TDD, continuous integration and continuous delivery
Good understanding of/experience with CI tools (Jenkins, Concourse) and testing frameworks
Experience with optimising web applications in areas such as performance, security and resilience
Ability and enthusiasm to push for new improvements across the code base and influence/learn from a large community of developers
Ability to help in coaching and mentoring junior members of the team
The Rewards:
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special. Here are just a few:
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place
Generous pension package and private healthcare plan
Discounted mobile and broadband
Access to thousands of LinkedIn Learning and Pluralsight courses
A permanent, secure contract from the start (no probationary period)
The Office:
Our Osterley campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Chiswick Park, Gunnersbury, Acton Town and Ealing Broadway tube stations. There’s also plenty of parking, bike shelters and showers.
On campus you’ll find six subsidised restaurants and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon.
Flexible Working:
We don’t just look at your CV. We’re more focused on who you are and the potential you’ll bring to Sky. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we’re happy to support our people as much as we can with flexible working.
Especially during these challenging times, we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. We’re currently recruiting through a fully remote interview process and you’ll also be able to start work with us remotely. But you’ll need to be living in the UK at the time of start and able to work freely in the country.
If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruiter, Wander Amorim, who will be happy to support you.
A job you love to talk about
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.
Why wait?
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about. Want to do the best work of your life? Make your mark at Europe’s leading entertainment brand. But you’ll need to be living in the UK at the time of start and able to work freely in the country.
If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruiter, Wander Amorim, who will be happy to support you.
A job you love to talk about
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.
Why wait?
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you.
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about. Want to do the best work of your life? Make your mark at Europe’s leading entertainment brand. Our people make Sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work – a place where you can be yourself and let your skills shine.  
Team Overview:  
Our Global OTT team develops and supports technologies for Sky, globally. No matter the device, the time or the place, we make sure that engaging large, diverse audiences with premium entertainment is possible. Our vision is to deliver the world’s best entertainment.  
“Our work relies on building and maintaining the strongest relationships with other delivery teams across Sky and Sky’s partners. Collaboration and continuous improvement are at the heart of what we do. We’re looking forward to welcoming more talented people in our team” – Senior Scrum Master  
What you'll do:  
Create extremely well-crafted front-end web applications using React.js and Redux 
Write resilient code that will be continuously tested, deployed and performed at scale 
Be part of a self-organising and cross functional Agile team 
Be a leader within the team, actively improving overall software quality whilst also helping fellow team members 
Contribute to the team’s technical direction and the improvement of its tools and processes 
Be responsible for ensuring our website is highly performant, resilient, secure and monitored in production  
What you'll bring:  
Solid commercial experience in JavaScript (React) development 
Good understanding of development best practices such as pair programming, TDD, continuous integration and continuous delivery 
Good understanding of/experience with CI tools (Jenkins, Concourse) and testing frameworks 
Experience with optimising web applications in areas such as performance, security and resilience 
Ability and enthusiasm to push for new improvements across the code base and influence/learn from a large community of developers 
Ability to help in coaching and mentoring junior members of the team  
The Rewards:  
There's a reason people can't stop talking about #LifeAtSky. Our great range of rewards really are something special. Here are just a few:  
Sky Q, for the TV you love all in one place 
Generous pension package and private healthcare plan 
Discounted mobile and broadband 
Access to thousands of LinkedIn Learning and Pluralsight courses 
A permanent, secure contract from the start (no probationary period)  
The Office:  
Our Osterley campus is a 10-minute walk from Syon Lane train station. Or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from Osterley, Chiswick Park, Gunnersbury, Acton Town and Ealing Broadway tube stations. There’s also plenty of parking, bike shelters and showers.  
On campus you’ll find six subsidised restaurants and a Waitrose. You can keep in shape at our subsidised gym, catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema, get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon.  
Flexible Working:  
We don’t just look at your CV. We’re more focused on who you are and the potential you’ll bring to Sky. We also know that everyone has a life outside work, so we’re happy to support our people as much as we can with flexible working.  
Especially during these challenging times, we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. We’re currently recruiting through a fully remote interview process and you’ll also be able to start work with us remotely. But you’ll need to be living in the UK at the time of start and able to work freely in the country.  
If you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process, speak to our recruiter, Wander Amorim, who will be happy to support you.  
A job you love to talk about  
Just so you know: if your application is successful, we’ll ask you to complete a criminal record check. And depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have, we might have to withdraw the offer.  
Why wait? 
Apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. We can’t wait to hear from you. 
To find out more about working with us, search #LifeAtSky on social media. A job you love to talk about.  Show more

Futureheads have partnered with a company who are not only an award winning media group but also a long standing client of ours. With the media group being a big and well known company, their digital offering are still a small and agile place to work with a huge amount of opportunity and plans for growth.

We have personally known the Head of Development for the last seven years and is a great person to work for as well as being super supportive and an advocate for developing his team. We are currently on the look out for a junior front end developer who has ambition and a pure passion for tech.

What you’ll need to be successful in this role:

Strong JavaScript, HTML, CSS experience
A good understanding of React
Able to perform quickly and accurately
Have worked on high traffic websites previously – would be a bonus

A genuinely amazing, close knit team who enjoy what they do, offices are central London based but have a hybrid working policy in place. If this sounds like something you’d be interested in, please apply now!
Here at Futureheads, we encourage applicants from all backgrounds, so if there is anything we can do to make our recruitment processes better for you and to allow you to show your best self, let us know. We also understand that some people require extra time to complete assessments, require alternative application methods and can also benefit from having interview questions or a guide to the type of questions pre-interview. We are open to any suggestions or requests that you may have and are always looking for creative ways to assess talent. Our commitment to you is that you should always feel safe and secure when you’re working with us. Introduction
Our client is one of the Defence and Aerospace companies in the world and they are looking for Principal Software Engineering with a background in developing applications (web based ideally).

They work within a behavioural driven environment and create GIS/mapping web applications for the MOD.

Technology wise they are looking for candidates who have worked on the Java stack, but can be very flexible across other technologies.

You will be expected to travel to the office in Wiltshire a couple of times per month so you will need to be near enough to this location! The rest of the work can be done remotely.
Key responsibilities
Development of Java software for web applications
Working with test teams on test driven development
Skills & experience
This role is working in a SAFE/Agile environment so an understanding of this is imperative.

Key Technologies (but the client can be very flexible):

Java 8/11
Spring and its sub-projects
Hibernate (or other ORM framework)
JUnit (or other Unit Testing framework)
Web Services, particularly REST, and JSON
Apache/Adobe Flex and/or Google Web Toolkit (or Java Swing, AWT, Java FX, or other UI framework, AJAX, or modern JavaScript framework)
JBoss (or other Application Server)
Windows platforms (Oracle or SQL Server)

Techniques, Concepts or Methodologies:

Scrum and/or Kanban (or other Agile frameworks)
TDD
OO Design and UML
Enterprise Service Bus
Continuous Integration (and, optimally, Continuous Deployment)
DevOps (including DevSecOps, or other Dev*Ops variant)
Mapping, Geolocation, Symbology and Geographic Information Systems

You will be required to hold a minimum of SC or Willing to Undergo. If you do not hold an active SC or Willing to Undergo please familiarise yourself with the vetting process before applying.
Additional benefits
25 days holiday + statutory holidays
37 hour week
Hybrid working model
Contributory Pension Scheme
Life Assurance
Flexible Benefits
Enhanced sick pay scheme Introduction

Our client is one of the Defence and Aerospace companies in the world and they are looking for Principal Software Engineering with a background in developing applications (web based ideally).

They work within a behavioural driven environment and create GIS/mapping web applications for the MOD.

You will be expected to travel to the office in Wiltshire a couple of times per month so you will need to be near enough to this location! The rest of the work can be done remotely.

About You:

A fantastic opportunity has become available for a talented front-end developer with a real passion for creativity within a multi award winning digital marketing agency.

We are looking for an exceptional individual who is immersed in digital, who understands the power of a technically great website and how to get it to the highest standard regardless of the platform. The ideal candidate would want to succeed so we’ll give you what you need to perform at your best, because we believe true growth starts from within our agency team.

About the Role:
As the front-end developer, you will provide support to our development team and other marketing departments across all areas of technical SEO, landing page building, and custom coding web pages and functionalities. You will be working with a broad range of CMS platforms across a range of projects and will help departments to achieve their campaign successes with quick turnaround times and well-communicated output.

Applicants should have experience writing custom HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Expertise in writing semantic, modular front-end code using HTML5, CSS3, and W3C coding practices a must. Understanding of the concepts of progressive enhancement, mobile first (RWD) and future friendly design highly encouraged. Experience with Front end frameworks such as Bootstrap also desirable.

Our new Digital PR Senior Executive will take responsibility and ownership for certain aspects of client activity, ultimately to lessen the workload of the Team Lead. The Digital PR Senior Executive will act as a point of contact of a select number of client accounts and be accountable for their ongoing Digital PR performance.
What we’ll need from you:

You’ll enjoy maintaining and modifying our client websites.
You’ll be supporting the development team with website launches and migrations (redirect strategies, content migration, crawl-budget optimisation).

You’ll need to collaborate with the UX Design Lead and support with implementation.
The ability to Resolve Core Web Vital issues.
The ability to structure Data implementation according to Google guidelines.
Building email templates with visual builder or using HTML / CSS
Build landing page with visual builder or using WordPress native script.
The ability to resolve technical SEO issues for websites.
Support our SEO, PPC, Content and PR team for content upload and formatting for different CMS platform.
Support SEO and PPC department with Ecommerce tracking setup/troubleshooting.
The ability to liaise directly with clients where required, and to professionally handle client feedback.
The ability to provide accurate estimates for tasks and timescales.
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritise tasks and remain adaptable to changing priorities based on client and internal demand.
Knowledge of structured data, site speed optimisation, core web vitals and how these intertwine with SEO best practice.

Key skills you’ll need:
You’ll enjoy maintaining and modifying our client websites.You’ll be supporting the development team with website launches and migrations (redirect strategies, content migration, crawl-budget optimisation).

Knowledge of various CMS platforms and frameworks, such as WordPress, Shopify, Joomla, Magento, Lavarel and Drupal
Experience using and implementing Google Analytics, Search Console, Tag Manager and other tracking tools
Core technical skills with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and expertise in writing semantic, modular front-end code.
Understanding of browser-based development tools (Lighthouse, Tag Assistant, Chrome dev tool etc).
Willingness to learn about other areas in the marketing mix and how digital fits together.
A good understanding of UX and conversion best practice
Working knowledge of Adobe XD & Photoshop desirable.
Proactivity, forward thinking and the ability to take the initiative is essential
Advanced technical knowledge such as usage of log files for SEO analysis and familiarity in working with popular JS frameworks such as AngularJS, React and Vue.j
Fully remote working in the UK (opportunities to work from anywhere within Europe – exceptions apply).
Free Private Medical Health Insurance (with cash back option on Vision & Dental care & 40% off Nuffield Health gym Membership)
3 Wellness days provided each year.
Company Pension Scheme.
Opportunities to progress if you’re up for the challenge.
Training sessions galore across multiple disciplines.
Opportunities to speak at industry events and conferences if you want to.
A library, where you can select a book of your choice and we will send it to you for free.
The opportunity to be involved in our charity fundraising events.
A birthday gift and the afternoon off on us.
Extra treats on your work-versary (annually)
Opportunity to take part in a professional PT session each week.
Absolute Early Bird (8am-5pm) OR Absolute Owl (9am-6pm) working hours offered to suit your lifestyle.
Regular social events and team building activities provided for free (online and in person).
Annual festivals
Monthly company-wide “feel good” meetings.
Early finish on the last Friday of every month.
Quarterly in person meet ups for the whole company. About You:

Job Introduction

In Core Services, we are building a unified platform for delivering the BBC's digital content. WebCore serves over 2 billion requests a month for BBC Homepage, News and Sport, with more BBC products joining the platform in the future.
Our challenge is to manage and maintain a high-quality, shared, accessible web-based Design System that is used by and contributed to daily by colleagues across all the BBC products on the WebCore platform.
The Design System team interacts frequently with a thriving community of contributors. A large part of our work focuses on collaborating with the audience experience teams to understand their needs and support them in their goals. We also aim to systemise support where possible – this allows teams to get the most value out of our time.

We host guilds, run internal user research and join up often with developers, UX, product and delivery roles in audience facing teams. We provide technical steer and guidance and aim to make creating amazing experiences with the Design System as easy as possible, acting as catalysts for sustainable delivery at scale.
Main Responsibilities

You will be working with a talented, friendly and welcoming multi-disciplinary team on all aspects of the Design System, including future vision and strategy. How we work is shaped by all members of the team, and we review our ways of working regularly to ensure all processes are helping us be our best.
The Design System is closely linked with a cloud-native web framework and with a CI/CD pipeline that allows teams to deploy changes quickly. We can offer you a multitude of opportunities to hone your skills and stretch yourself in new directions, and we’ll offer you support and training to help accelerate your development. Our team gives you the opportunity to be at the centre of a Design System where your efforts will positively impact all teams and products working on WebCore.

Your main responsibilities will include:

Technical:
Building well engineered, maintainable, accessible front-end solutions and tooling to benefit Design System users and contributors
Technical steering and knowledge-sharing within the team and with our collaborative partners.
Reviewing code contributions and providing constructive feedback to product teams.
Always learning about new technologies and approaches, and then championing them to ensure our products and processes are world class.
People:
Working cross-discipline to get things done in a pro-active and positive way.
Working with and understanding the needs of the teams building on the WebCore platform, enabling them to deliver high value to the audience.
Collaborating with the BBC GEL (Global Experience Language) team to facilitate the consistency and quality of WebCore-based experiences.
Collaborating closely with the other Core Services teams to achieve success, including working with the web framework and developer experience teams.
Contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement.
Are you the right candidate?

The team will be happy to mentor you in these areas, so you do not need to be an expert to apply.
The latest features in the Web platform (HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Web APIs)
JavaScript that runs both on the client (i.e. web browsers) and on the server (Node.js)
JS frameworks and libraries:
- React.js: Web page renderer
- Emotion: A React plugin for writing CS
- Storybook: visual presentation and discovery of React components
Testing and tooling:
 - Chromatic - visual regression testing in components
 - Jest & jsdom - unit and integration testing
 - Puppeteer - browser testing
 - Axe-core - accessibility testing automation
 - Google Web Vitals - web page performance metrics
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here
Package Description

Band: C
Contract type: Permanent
Location: Salford
We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application. There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.
Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more. Job Introduction

We provide technical steer and guidance and aim to make creating amazing experiences with the Design System as easy as possible, acting as catalysts for sustainable delivery at scale.
Main Responsibilities

You will be working with a talented, friendly and welcoming multi-disciplinary team on all aspects of the Design System, including future vision and strategy. How we work is shaped by all members of the team, and we review our ways of working regularly to ensure all processes are helping us be our best.
The Design System is closely linked with a cloud-native web framework and with a CI/CD pipeline that allows teams to deploy changes quickly. We can offer you a multitude of opportunities to hone your skills and stretch yourself in new directions, and we’ll offer you support and training to help accelerate your development. Our team gives you the opportunity to be at the centre of a Design System where your efforts will positively impact all teams and products working on WebCore.

Your main responsibilities will include:

Technical:
Building well engineered, maintainable, accessible front-end solutions and tooling to benefit Design System users and contributors
Technical steering and knowledge-sharing within the team and with our collaborative partners.
Reviewing code contributions and providing constructive feedback to product teams.
Always learning about new technologies and approaches, and then championing them to ensure our products and processes are world class.
People:
Working cross-discipline to get things done in a pro-active and positive way.
Working with and understanding the needs of the teams building on the WebCore platform, enabling them to deliver high value to the audience.
Collaborating with the BBC GEL (Global Experience Language) team to facilitate the consistency and quality of WebCore-based experiences.
Collaborating closely with the other Core Services teams to achieve success, including working with the web framework and developer experience teams.
Contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement.
Are you the right candidate?

The team will be happy to mentor you in these areas, so you do not need to be an expert to apply.
The latest features in the Web platform (HTML, CSS, JavaScript and Web APIs)
JavaScript that runs both on the client (i.e. web browsers) and on the server (Node.js)
JS frameworks and libraries:
- React.js: Web page renderer
- Emotion: A React plugin for writing CS
- Storybook: visual presentation and discovery of React components
Testing and tooling:
 - Chromatic - visual regression testing in components
 - Jest & jsdom - unit and integration testing
 - Puppeteer - browser testing
 - Axe-core - accessibility testing automation
 - Google Web Vitals - web page performance metrics
About the BBC

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.
Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.
We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.
We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.
To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here

Benefits- We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more. Job Introduction

In Core Services, we are building a unified platform for delivering the BBC's digital content. WebCore serves over 2 billion requests a month for BBC Homepage, News and Sport, with more BBC products joining the platform in the future.
Our challenge is to manage and maintain a high-quality, shared, accessible web-based Design System that is used by and contributed to daily by colleagues across all the BBC products on the WebCore platform.
The Design System team interacts frequently with a thriving community of contributors. A large part of our work focuses on collaborating with the audience experience teams to understand their needs and support them in their goals. We also aim to systemise support where possible – this allows teams to get the most value out of our time.

We host guilds, run internal user research and join up often with developers, UX, product and delivery roles in audience facing teams. We provide technical steer and guidance and aim to make creating amazing experiences with the Design System as easy as possible, acting as catalysts for sustainable delivery at scale.

We have a brand-new vacancy for a highly capable Frontend Developer to work for a fast growing start-up that is creating new security technologies to deliver trust, provenance and meaningful ownership in the digital world. With solid financial backing and a rapidly growing client list they are expanding their development team and urgently need an experienced Frontend Developer.
The Frontend Developer will have the opportunity to create and mould digital assets, taking concepts and turning those into user facing features with the backend teams to deliver engaging experiences for customers. You will be involved in creating entirely new classes of interfaces to go along with this ground-breaking technology.
You can expect an excellent working environment with a culture that celebrates and encourages idea generation. With a very agile mindset in keeping with the explorative, ground-breaking nature of the work, they allow their people the time and resources needed to make those ideas real.

Frontend Developer Responsibilities

Taking proof of concept mock-ups and turn those into new slick user-facing features
Interfacing with and editing digital media assets, including still image, video and audio
Build reusable code and libraries for future use
Ensure the technical and practicality feasibility of UI/UX designs
Ensure that the application is optimised for maximum speed and scalability
Assure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-end
Working proactively and effectively with other team members and stakeholder

Frontend Developer requirements

A self-starter and proactive with 4+ years’ experience working as a Frontend Developer.
Skilled in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and supporting framework. We have an exciting opportunity for a Web App Developer who is looking to make an impact in a successful, growing business. We are looking for a Web App Developer to join our team for a six-month contract to develop our online e-commerce web app. Our office is based in Norwich, but flexible working is possible.

Main Purpose of the role
The primary purpose of this role is to support the business in building web applications to enable product delivery online and automate internal processes.

About Kirby and Haslam:
Kirby & Haslam are trusted and proactive chartered accountants offering high expertise to bring you closer to your clients. With over 19 years of experience, our professional team of accounting experts offers the most beneficial and effective research and development solutions. With the help of our hard-working, dedicated staff we have been able to provide our customers with outstanding services and are looking to expand our team further.

Responsibilities:
Consult with individuals within the business to identify the end goal of web app development and help shape the design of the product(s)
Management of the web app development project including resources, timing, and budget.
Development of web applications including web portals, business automation web solutions, and eCommerce web apps.
Stakeholder management of key project members and Directors.
Guide the business on best practices for user experience to ensure customers have the best possible experience.
Responsible for ensuring the business has well-structured web application architecture.

Skills:
Established understanding of front-end languages including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL.
Experience working in a commercial environment with front-end development.
Up-to-date knowledge of web development practices and ability to develop good quality code.
An understanding of the security and privacy factors affecting development, including GDPR.
Experience in working with API to achieve integration between systems.

Competencies:
Problem-solving: ability to calculate risks and benefits and make informed decisions.
Communication: the ability to influence outcomes through specialist subject knowledge.
Flexibility: ability to adapt, respond and find opportunities in a changing environment.
Creativity: ability to look beyond current practices and invoke innovative thinking.
Project management: the ability to bring about the successful completion of a project.

Staff Benefits:
Modern offices in the heart of Norwich city center.
Discount at Rooftop Gardens, Norwich.
Casual dress code
Regular company parties and social events.
Training and development opportunities.
Salary: Up to £48,000 per annum


Fixed Term Contract: 6 months (with the potential to be extended)
Working Hours: Monday – Friday
Job Type: Full-time, Permanent

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Lincoln is on the lookout for talented .NET/C# Developer who are passionate about developing innovative automation solutions that enhance creative workflows. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar's unique game development studio in the heart of Lincoln.

WHAT WE DO
We design and build tools to support Rockstar's worldwide QA and Localisation teams. Our tools streamline common QA and Localisation processes and workflows. We also provide ways for users to view and analyse business data in a variety of formats.
We maintain a variety of existing tools and systems to ensure the continued smooth running of day-to-day operations.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Write quality, maintainable, and testable code, following the team's coding guidelines, to fix bugs and implement new features.
Work with users to gather requirements and debug problems.
Review other developers' code.

QUALIFICATIONS
A degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering, or equivalent professional experience.
We are hiring across all levels of experience, from Associate (0/1+ year) to Mid (2+ years) and Senior (5+ years).

SKILLS
Strong .NET/C# skills.
Experience writing and debugging asynchronous code.
Experience writing unit tests.
SQL / relational database skills.
Strong communication skills.
Experience working with the MVVM design pattern.
An understanding of different architectures and design patterns.
Ability to work well within a cross-studio team.
Ability to work within a schedule and deliver effectively to deadlines.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
NET Core (Web API).
Knowledge or prior experience with WPF.
Familiarity with Entity Framework or similar ORM.
Knowledge of XAML and/or Angular.
Passion for development and games, especially Rockstar products.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race. Job reference
